In 2008, Joe-alen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell.

Joe-alen is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be his 2nd from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is 41 years old. She is married and is blessed with two children who are in school. She has been sewing for sixteen years. She specializes in women's clothing. Her skills and designs are refined. She sews various styles that give her customers a new look, such as children's school uniforms, church attire, wedding dresses, funeral clothes, and the kaba and slit, which is a tailored top and long skirt.. She wants to use the loan to buy more sewing supplies, such as linen, threads, and thimbles, to increase her output and efficiency. She hopes to increase her savings to provide her children with a quality education. She has three apprentices who are learning skills for their future.

loans.use: To buy sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc.

loans.name: Teegaluo Group

texts.en:
Teegaluo is a group of 5 borrowers, led by Forkpa L., living in Zorzor, Lofa County, Liberia.  Forkpa is married with 2 children, ages 3 and10.  The older child is in the 1st grade because school was interrupted during the war.  Forkpa is 26 years old, with an 11th grade education, and he lives in Borkeza Town.  

Forkpa’s business is selling rice retail, which he buys wholesale, in Bokeza town. He has been running his business for 3 years.   He’s taking a loan to increase his inventory so he can serve more customers.  With the profits he dreams of building a more permanent shop, investing in the future of his kids, especially in education since he was unable to complete school.

loans.use: Purchase bags of rice to increase inventory

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena dreams of providing a progressive life for her family. She wants her children to have a better future life, so she and her husband are working very hard. She is married to Lorenzo Jr. and they are aiming to improve their poor living conditions for the benefit of their three children. 

Her husband is operating a tricycle transport business while Lucena sells frozen foods. She started with a small capital amounting to PHP 2,000 and she is thankful that she has been able to maintain her enterprise. She is hoping for business growth but she needs additional capital. This is the reason why she is asking for a financial capital of PHP5, 000.00. With her efforts and sacrifices in the business, she believes that she can reach her dreams.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Rosa Jazmina

texts.es: La joven Rosa S. de 29 años de edad, reside en el barrio Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua,, trabaja en venta en una tienda  del uno dos tres donde venden variedad de productos, tiene dos años de laborar y su mayor deseo es poder hacer un cuarto y tener sus propias cosas para un futuro, el cual en unos meses será madre aunque sea madre soltera hará lo posible para que no le falte nada. Vive con sus padres los cuales siempre la apoyan. Este es su segundo ciclo en Afodenic el cual comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro y otros para hacer su cuarto y poder estar en mejores condiciones cuando nazca su bebe. Agradece a la institución por la oportunidad de hacer posible su sueño de poder tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
The Young Rosa S. is 29 years old and lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood in the capital of Managua. She works in a shop where she sells a variety of products. She has worked this way for 2 years and her biggest desire is to be able to make a room and have her own things for the future. She will be a mother in a few months and being a single mother she will do everything possible so that her child won’t lack anything. She lives with her parents who always support her. This is her second loan with Afodenic in which she will buy construction materials such as: stone, cement, iron, and other products to make her room and be able to be in better conditions when her baby is born. She is thankful to the institution for the opportunity to make possible her dream of having her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build a room

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Compra de una vaca lechera. (To purchase a dairy cow)

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah A. is married and has one child. She has no educational background. Sarah sells foodstuffs such as garden eggs, onions, tomatoes, raw fresh pepper, palm oil, palm kernel oil, smoked fish, and so on, at Elmina near Bantama. She has been engaged in this activity since 1990. Her husband is a fisherman. Sarah uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Sarah will use the loan to purchase more foodstuff for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Sarah plans to save to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuff for sale

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 39 years old and married to William. Her husband helps her buy and sell junk materials. They are blessed with six children.  She buys scrap materials in her village and sells those materials in big junk shops. She also sells cosmetics products. 

Yolanda would like to borrow PHP6,000 to purchase more products for her customers and to buy more scrap.  The additional capital will help her growth her business.  She would be thankful if KIVA lenders loan her the money.

loans.use: Capital for business development.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah N. is 25 years old and has three school-aged children. She is married to John Mathege, and she and her husband are both in business. Hannah runs a general store. This is her first loan from KADET. She has never borrowed from any micro-finance institution before, but was introduced to KADET by a friend who is a KADET client. Hannah will use this loan to acquire more inventory to sell from her store, including bread, flour and soap. These purchases will allow her to meet the high demand during the Christmas season. Her dream and aspiration is to own a major wholesale shop.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy more inventory to her general store

loans.name: Abimbola Flora

texts.en: Flora is 43 years old and married to a contractor. They have four children. Flora is a hairstylist; she creates different styles of hair and sells hair accessories such as hair creams, hair extensions, nails etc. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. She is a member of LAPO Microfinance.  Having been in LAPO for over two years now, she is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 170,000 to expand her hair clinic by purchasing more hair accessories to sell and for styling hair.

loans.use: to purchase more hair extensions and hair accessories to sell

loans.name: Moussa

texts.en: Moussa is a 28-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. Moussa has been working as a builder since 1998. When he first started his business, he had to face the competition. He also had some financial issues. Moussa is special in his work because he is known for his good work. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. In the future, he plans to keep on improving his work, as well as his financial situation.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Febelita

texts.en:
Febelita B. was born in the town of Tanay, Rizal, in the Philippines. She is 46 years old and is married to a fisherman, Edgardo. She and her husband have three children: two in college and one in high school.

Febelita and her husband come from very poor families. They realize that their lack of education has led to their poverty, and they want a better life for their children. The couple has a strong belief not to be affected by poverty; instead they are inspired to work hard for their children.

Febelita joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap Inc.), a Kiva partner in the Philippines, in 1995; since then, she has grown to love the organization. ASHI helped her in the start-up of a business, enabling her to support her husband in their daily expenditures.

Febelita and her husband have been in the fishing business for more than ten years. She now proposes that her eighth loan of Php 25,000 be used to continue their fishing business with the support of her husband. She will purchase assorted equipment for her fishing business like fishing net, rope, and bamboo. The remaining loan will be use to pay for a cow for additional income.

Febelita hopes that this business will be the source of income to finance the needs of her family and to provide a comfortable house to live in. She is very thankful to all members of ASHI for educating her, especially in dealing with other people, generating an ability to accept new challenges in her life, and helping her to achieve her dreams and improve their standard of living.

Febelita is grateful to the ASHI-Kiva partnership for supporting people like her who want to get out of poverty and get ahead. She hopes that the partnership continues this way for a long time and helps many poor families.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for her fishing business and to buy a cow for additional income

loans.name: Tạ's Group

texts.en:
N. Tạ Thị (20203020020) is a 50-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  N. is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Đông Thái 1 - Nhóm 05 (Nhóm 05).


N. is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, N. owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall.  The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling herbs & spices in the local community.  N. has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


N. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  N. is requesting for the first time a loan from SEDA in the amount of 3,360,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the first loan taken out by N. from SEDA.  N. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị D. (20203020024) is a 34-year-old female who is requesting a 2,912,000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a tailoring business.


2.  Nguyễn Thị Lộc (20203020026) is a 24-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


3.  Cao Thị Hiển (20203020027) is a 52-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a butcher shop.


4.  Nguyễn Thị Lạc (20203020021) is a 31-year-old female who is requesting a 2,016,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


N. Tạ Thị (20203020020) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  N. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Đông Thái 1 - Nhóm 05 (Nhóm 05).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các loại thảo mộc & gia vị trong cộng đồng địa phương.  N. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, N. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  N. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  N. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3.360.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị D. (20203020024) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 2.912.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc.


2.  Nguyễn Thị Lộc (20203020026) là 24 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


3.  Cao Thị Hiển (20203020027) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng T.t.


4.  Nguyễn Thị Lạc (20203020021) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 2.016.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Dulamjav

texts.en:
Dulamjav is 39 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Tuv province, Mongolia. Her husband is a laborer in Korea, and he comes to Mongolia once a year for a vacation. Her oldest daughter is a university student in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Dulamjav's youngest daughter attends a local secondary school. They have been living in their current home for ten years.

Because of her hard work and determination, Dulamjav bought a car this year with the profits from her business. During the day, she has been renting a counter for her toy-retailing business, which currently has working capital of 3,200,000 tugrugs (approximately 2,250 USD). Her daughter supports her mother in her free time.

Dulamjav started her business in 2006 with working capital of 500,000 tugrugs (approximately 350 USD). She purchases toys from Korea, and her revenue is quite good because she only sells high quality products. She has great business experience gained in previous years.

Dulamjav is a decent and very hardworking person. She says, “I would like to expand my counter and I am working hard to establish my own toy shop.” She is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan to increase her working capital and to increase the inventory of her business.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Aynagul's Group

texts.en:
Aynagul J. is an immense woman. She has an ability to overcome the difficulties and looks to the world with the hope for a better tomorrow. Aynagul is 46 and married. She has a smart husband who is a member of a farm. They have seven children whom they adore and their children are as determined as their mother is. The older children are unique themselves. They already achieved goals in their life and at present stay separately from her. The younger ones still attend the local school and in their free time, they eagerly help their mother in her business. Baktygul is the middle daughter and she is a schoolgirl. She is eighteen and studies in 10th grade. Next is Rahat who studies in eighth grade and the last one is Aynagul’s joy. He is a six-year-old boy who studies in first grade. When he grows up, he wants to be the President of Kyrgyzstan. So Aynagul and her friendly family deal with livestock. Since 2000, they have been selling cattle and for the money they got, they already have bought a new house, married off their daughter and increased the number of the cattle. Now their plan is to send Baktygul to get education like her sisters and brothers. Recently, they have decided to get a loan to buy a horse in order to fatten it and resell it later on.

Sayra J. is 25 and married. She has two children. Her husband is a member of a farm.  She works in a part-time job. They already have cattle. They are planning to build a house and increase their  number of cattle. By getting a loan, they are going to buy a horse.  

Kunduz T. is 28 years old. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a member of a farm and a private cattle breeder. They want to get a loan to buy four cattle. Their future plans are to expand the number of cattle and make their living conditions better. 

Saliyma S. is 38 and married. Her husband is a member of the farm. They have four children and they all attend school. She works as a teacher in school. They are planning to increase the number of cattle and send the elder daughter to get an education. They have built a house where they all together live. They want to get a loan to buy three cattle.

Tilek K. is 35 and married. His wife is a member of the farm. They have three daughters. They hope to harvest a good crop in the spring. The reason why he wants to get a loan is that he wants to buy 200 liters of solar oil for agriculture works.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.
Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy a horse to fatten and resell

loans.name: Marilyn's Group

texts.en:
Marilyn T. is from the village of Centro 2, Angadanan, Isabela. She is 33 years old. Marilyn is the group leader of a 15-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Marilyn T..

Marilyn is married and has 1 school-aged child. Marilyn owns & operates a cosmetic retail business, directly selling products such as talcum powder, perfumes &  body lotions. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Marilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Marilyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to pay her children's tuition fees. 
About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie B. is from the village of Mitacas, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Tessie is engaged in the agriculture sector, particularly in the planting of corn and rice. Through this activity she is able to earn a monthly net income amounting to 5,000.00. 

In 2005, Tessie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tessie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Tessie is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Tessie from PMPC. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda W. is from the village of Nes Visayas, Kibawe, Bukidnon. She is 46 years old. Erlinda is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Erlinda runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Erlinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the third loan taken out by Erlinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Erdenebat

texts.en:
Erdenebat S., 45, is a widower and the father of three children. He and his family live together in a ger (the Mongolian nomadic tent). His oldest two children, aged 20 and 18, are university students. His youngest daughter, Urangoo, attends a local secondary school. 

Erdenebat operates an auto spare parts trading business in his town. He started his business in 2009 with a working capital of 800,000 MNT, and within only one year, he has managed to increase his working capital to 1,100,000 MNT. He has been planning to expand his current business and to start a block manufacturing business as well. 

The whole family supports his business. Since he started this business, he has been providing money for his family expenses and paying the education fees for his children. Erdenebat is an open person who has very good communication skills. He says, “The most important thing to me is to provide a good education for my children." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more spare parts for his business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane A. is from the village of Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 32 years old. Mary Jane is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Jane owns & operates a business venture buying and selling coconut fruits and copra in the local community. Mary Jane has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mary Jane joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000  PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Mary Jane is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more copra products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Mary Jane from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim lives in Multan, Pakistan, the city of sweetmeats and tombs along with her husband and children. Her husband sells milk. Shamim is a very good house wife, she not only takes care of the home but also does sewing work in her spare time. She takes orders from her neighbors and fulfills them.

She wants to improve her business by purchasing a new sewing machine because the old one is not in good working condition. She thinks that she can make even more money by adopting this business as a fulltime work. 

In the future she plans on buying a buffalo by saving money from her sewing work and she is very hopeful that she will be able to achieve her target very soon.

loans.use: Purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: Gerardo A. M., tiene la edad de 47 años, está soltero, y vive solo.El crédito lo quiere para la compra de algunos terneros y su alimentación. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. También desea aumentar el número de animales y poder mantenerlos en mejores condiciones, cuenta con un área idónea para el mantenimiento y cría del ganado. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Gerardo tiene varios años dedicado al ganado. El espera en un futuro tener una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Gerardo A. M. is 47 years old, single and lives alone. He is seeking the loan to buy some calves and their feed. He wants to raise them as well as possible so that he can get the best price for them when he sells them. He also wants to increase the number of his animals and maintain them in better conditions. He has an ideal place to raise cattle. This is the first time that he is taking out a loan with FUDECOSUR, and he is very happy with the services they provide. Mr. A. has several years experience raising cattle. He hopes to have a better quality of life in the future and more economic stability, as well as to be able to continue growing as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle (calves)

loans.name: Azra Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Azra perveen is a resident of a city called Borewala in Pakistan. Her husband runs a scrap shop and she helps him by sewing clothes for her neighborhood clients. She is the mother of six children and her two sons work with their father at his scrap shop. She has four daughters who are all getting their education.

Azra is a second year member of Asasah. Last year she received a loan for her sewing business which has giving her good earnings. This year she has applied for a loan for her husband’s scrap business which is out of stock these days, preventing him from generating income for the family.

Azra is hopeful that this loan will be as profitable as the previous one.

loans.use: To enable her husband to purchase more scrap for his business

loans.name: Erkinjon

texts.en:
Erkinjon is 35 years old and the father of three children. His wife is a housekeeper and she supports him in everything he does. Erkinjon is a hardworking person and has been providing taxi services for six years. Most important to him is that his children go to university in the future, and that they finish it successfully so that they will have a better future as professionals.
Erkinjon wishes to keep his taxi business growing, and for this he needs to have his tools in good working order. He needs to buy spare parts to improve his car and that is why he is requesting a loan. Thanks to this work, Erkinjon has been able to stabilize his quality of life.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for repairing his car

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia B. is from the village of Manano, Mallig. She is 52 years old and married with one adult child. To make a living, Lilia has a general store selling a variety of different products. She has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. 

In 2008, Lilia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 22,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Lilia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Rosa Del Carmen

texts.es: Rosa Del Carmen E. de 45 años de edad, reside en la ciudad de Soyapango, una de las ciudades con mayor comercio del país, esta se encuentra ubicada en el departamento de San Salvador, en donde Rosa vive junto a su esposo, dos sobrinos y una hija, todos menores de edad. Rosa es una señora muy dedicada a su hogar, la cual se dedica a la elaboración de tamales, los cuales son hechos con masa de maíz, los cuales se rellenan de carne de pollo y algunas verduras y posteriormente se envuelven en hojas de huerta de guineo, estos los comercializa en su casa de habitación y así mismo los vende de forma ambulantes en colonias cercanas a su lugar de vivienda. De esta misma forma Rosa comercializa cocos, los cuales vende en su casa, los cuales su esposo le ayuda a vender. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima para la elaboración de tamales, los cuales son un platillo típico de este país, y así mismo comprar cocos por mayor y de esta forma obtener mayores ganancias, las cuales sean de mucho beneficio para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa Del Carmen E. is 45 years old. She lives in the city of Soyapango, one of the most commercial cities in the country. It is located in the departament of San Salvador, where Rosa lives with her husband, two nephews and a daughter, all minor children. Rosa is a woman who is very dedicated to her home. She makes tamales there from corn meal. They are filled with chicken and some vegetables and wrapped in banana leaves. She sells them from her house and she also sells them as a streetr vendor in the neighborhoods near her house. Rosa also sells coconuts in the same way in her house, and her husband helps her. She is asking for a loan to be able to have enough money to buy a larger quantity of ingredients to make the tamales, a traditional food in this country. It is also to buy coconuts wholesale and in this way obtain more profits, which is of great benefit to her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for tamales and coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Escarlete

texts.es: Escarlete vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz, tiene 28 años de edad y es egresada de la carrera de arquitectura,actualmente está soltera y no tiene hijos. Escarlete trabaja en la Alcaldía Municipal de La Paz en Villa San Antonio en la sección barrios de verdad donde percibe un sueldo con el cual se mantiene. El crédito es para comprar una computadora y preparar su tesis para poder titularse y de esta manera poder ascender a un cargo mejor en la institución donde trabaja.
texts.en:
Escarlete lives in her parents’ house in the Sopocachi neighbourhood of La Paz. She is 28 years old and graduated in architecture from university. At the moment she is single and has no children. Escarlete works for the Municipality of La Paz in Villa San Antonio in the “Barrios de Verdad” program. She supports herself on the salary she receives. The loan would be used to buy a computer on which to prepare her thesis so she can obtain her professional qualification. This will enable her to take on more responsibilities in the institution where she works.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles K. is a 46 year-old man. He is married to Dinah K..  They have four children (26, 24, 20 and 18 years old). They live in Kuinet, an outcast of the town of Eldoret. Charles earns his income from farming.  He has been in this business for the past five years with an income of Kshs 4000 per month.

Charles was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.  He is applying for his first loan of Kshs 20,000 with KADET LTD.  He plans to use this loan to purchase five bags of fertilizer.

Charles hopes to increase his farming business from a small scale to a large scale business and be able to take his maize to the cereals board.

loans.use: To purchase five bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita D. is from the village of Sta. Rosa. She is 46 years old. Anita is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Anita owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Anita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Anita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Anita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Anita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy food stocks for resale.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a father of 6 and a resident of the town of Litein in the Rift Valley of Kenya. He has been doing mixed farming for 15 years, producing tea and milk and selling locally. He employs one farmhand.

John has applied for this loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He believes this will provide an alternative source of income to his mechanics business. He says that this improved income will ensure that his family has various assets and a better standard of living. John's main challenges are insufficient capital and animal feeds. He is hopeful that he will manage to have purebred cows in a modern zero-grazing unit. He says the loan service from Juhudi Kilimo has been supportive to many.

loans.use: Purchase and insurance of a dairy cow

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel N., 36 years old, runs a retail shop in the very busy market of Bissil in Kajiado. He sells his goods to Bissil residents and livestock traders who come to Bissil every day. He is married to 42-year-old Irene Mwende, a farmer, and together they have three children: Mary, 15 years old and in form one, Judy, 10 years old and in class eight, and Anold, 5 years old and in class one. Daniel was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of the Kitengela office.

Daniel has been running his business for five years and his monthly income is KES 16,100. He also has a barber shop and green grocer shop to supplement his income. He plans to use this loan of KES 50,000, his first with KADET, as follows: KES 30,000 to  increase his stock of rice, sugar and  flour for sale in his retail shop;  KES 10,000 to repair his barber shop seats; KES 10,000 to stock his green grocery. If the loan boosts his business, he will expand it to the wholesale level.

Daniel dreams of having a big wholesale and store in the future and of buying a piece of land and building rental houses and a shop to operate from. He describes himself as ambitious and hardworking.

loans.use: to increase his stock of rice, sugar and flour

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome C. is a married woman with four children. One has graduated from school while three still attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a charcoal selling business for the past three months, selling from home to her neighboring community. In addition she also sells firewood, which contributes to her income. Salome faces a major challenge of seasonality because of price fluctuations. She hopes to expand her business and supply a larger number of clients. 

With the 20000 KES she wants to purchase 100 bags of charcoal for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase 100 bags of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Alvaro Antonio

texts.es: El señor Alvaro Hernández G. es un alegre microempresario que vive con su esposa y 4 hijos menores de edad en el barrio Siete de Abril de Barranquilla. El tiene un puesto estacionario en el cual vende cocteles de mariscos como: ostras, camarón, caracol, chipi-chipi, pulpo y calamar. Su negocio está ubicado frente al antiguo estadio municipal de futbol Romelio Martínez, donde el equipo local, Junior de Barranquilla, se coronó campeón nacional en dos ocasiones. El señor Alvaro tiene 30 años de experiencia en el oficio y aunque ha cambiado de ubicación en varias oportunidades su kiosco, siempre conserva una clientela acreditada. El secreto de su éxito está en la calidad de los ingredientes que llevan sus cocteles como: salsa de tomate, cebolla blanca, extracto de ajo con vinagre blanco, picante, limón, mayonesa, mostaza, salsa negra, aceite de oliva y sal. Este es el primer préstamo que tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y planea invertirlo en la compra al por mayor de mariscos e ingredientes. Los días de mayor venta son los viernes y sábados. El promedio de ventas diarias es de $ 80.000 COP y el margen de utilidad es del 40%. El señor Alvaro dice que gracias a su negocio está sacando adelante a su familia. Todos sus hijos estudian, compró la casa en la que actualmente vive y la está remodelando poco a poco. El disfruta su trabajo porque la mayoría de sus clientes son sus amigos con los cuales conversa mientras degustan su coctel. Definitivamente, este microempresario ama su oficio y esto se evidencia en la destreza que tiene para preparar sus productos y la cara de felicidad que siempre lo embarga.
texts.en: Mr Alvaro Hernández G. is a happy businessman who lives with his wife and 4 grown children in the Siete de Abril neighbourhood of Barranquilla. He has a stationary kiosk where he sells seafood cocktails such as: oysters, prawns, snails, clams, octopus and squid. His business is located in front of the old Romelio Martinez municipal soccer stadium, where the local team, Junior de Barranquilla, was crowned national champion on two occasions. Alvaro has 30 years of experience in this business, and although he has changed locations at several occasions, he always conserves his customer base. The secret of his success is in the quality of the ingredients that he uses in his cocktails such as: tomato sauce, white onion, garlic extract with white vinegar, hot spices, lemon, mayonnaise, mustard, black sauce, olive oil and salt.  This is his first loan with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, and he plans to invest in the wholesale purchase of seafood and ingredients. The best sales days are Fridays and Saturdays. The average daily sales are $ 80,000 COP and the margin of utility is 40%. Alvaro says that he is getting his family ahead thanks to his business. All of his children study. He bought the house where they currently live and he is remodeling it bit by bit. He enjoys his work because the majority of his customers are his friends and he talks with them while they eat. He clearly loves his job and this is evident in the care that he takes in preparing his food and the face of joy that he always wears.

loans.use: the wholesale purchase of seafood and ingredients.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio R. is from the village of Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 52 years old. Antonio is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, he owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. Mainly he plants and harvests corn for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2005, Antonio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC.

Antonio is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be his 4th loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Lizandro Eudoro

texts.es:
Lizandro tiene 43 años de edad, es conviviente, y tiene un hijo. Vive junto a su familia en uno de los distritos de Tambogrande, un distrito de la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, caracterizado por que sus pobladores se dedican principalmente al cultivo de frutas.

Se dedica al transporte en mototaxi (un vehículo de transporte muy común en la zona que está compuesta por una moto y una cabina para transportar pasajeros en distancias cortas).  Lizandro es muy conocido en su zona, por lo que tiene una clientela fidelizada.  Esta actividad es su principal fuente de sustento, y le permite solventar sus gastos personales, así como ayudar a su familia. Por ello siempre trata de mantenerla del mejor modo posible.

Actualmente Lizandro desea reparar su mototaxi que por el uso se ha desgastado. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Lizandro, 43, has a live-in spouse and a son.  He lives with his family in one of Tambogrande’s districts, a district in Piura region, Piura province and notable because most of its residents are fruit growers.

He provides mototaxi (a transportation vehicle very commonplace in the area composed of a motorcycle with an attached cabin to transport passengers over short distances) transportation services.  Lizandro is very well known in the area so he has a regular customer base.  This activity is his main source of support allowing him to meet personal expenses as well as help his family.  Because of this he always strives to maintain it in the best possible condition.

Lizandro currently needs to repair his mototaxi because it has become run down due to use.  To reach his objective he has requested a 500 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: For mototaxi repair.

loans.name: Adrian Antonio

texts.es:
El joven Adrian Antonio C. M. tiene 21 años de edad, es soltero y se dedica a la venta de zapatos, ropa, cameras, toallas, ropa de niño, carteras y mas.
 
Adrian en las noches estudia en la universidad.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa escolar, este mes es de epoca en donde entran a los colegios y a las escuelas los niños y desea tener bien surtido su negocio para cubrir con todas las exigencias de sus clientes.
su meta es crecer como microempresario y llegar a ser un empresario.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con algunos gastos del hogar y para sus estudios.
texts.en:
The young Adrian Antonio C. M. is 21 years old, single, and dedicated to the sale of shoes, clothing, cameras, towels, children’s clothes, purses and more.

At night, Adrian studies at the university.  He will use the loan to buy school clothes, as this month is the season when the children return to school.  He wants to have a well-supplied store so that he can meet customer demand.  

His goal is to grow as an entrepreneur and become a successful businessman.  He needs income to meet some household expenses and to pay for his education.

loans.use: To purchase shirts, pants, socks, t-shirts, undergarments, skirts, and blouses.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Don Carlos, un señor muy trabajador cuenta con 62 años de edad, es carpintero, vive con su esposa de 50 años de edad, residen en Jucuapa departamento de Usulután, don Carlos cuenta con un taller de carpintería, no tiene horario ya que la carpintería la tiene ubicada en su propia casa.
Él solicita un préstamo para comprar madera de cedro, pega, pintura, clavos, esta inversión se da por la necesidad de salir con unos trabajos pendientes y pues debe darle salida para que sus clientes estén satisfechos.
Los sueños y aspiraciones de don Carlos es tener un taller abastecido de las mejores maderas, para elaborar los muebles de calidad y brindar un buen servicio a los clientes quienes al final le reconocen con las ganancias que dejan en cada compra.
texts.en:
Carlos, a hard-working 62-year old man, is a carpenter and lives with his wife, 50 years of age, in the department of Jucuapa in Usulután.  Carlos has a carpentry workshop, but doesn’t have a set schedule since the workshop is located right in his own house.

He requests a loan to invest in cedar lumber, adhesive, paint and nails.  This investment is necessary to complete some pending work in order to satisfy his customers.

Carlos’ dreams and aspirations include having a well-supplied workshop with the best lumber, so he can make high quality furniture and provide a good service to his customer base.  In they end, they are the ones who recognize his work through each purchase they make from him.

loans.use: To purchase cedar lumber, adhesive, paint and nails.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena C. is from Labuyo Tangub City. She is 46 years old. Elena is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Elena owns & operates a  motor transport service. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2011, Elena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Elena is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to repair her vehicle to provide better service. This is her first loan from GDMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair her transport service vehicle

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has three children.  Two of her children are currently in school.  Zainab has a bar, which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Zainab has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more sodas, beer, and wine for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Zainab hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Zainab hopes to build a house of her own.   

Zainab is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more sodas, beer, and wine for resale.

loans.name: Junrey

texts.en: Junrey V. is from the village of Becor, Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 31 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Junrey owns and operates a tricycle transport service. Junrey has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Junrey joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Junrey has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC and is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This will be the third loan taken out by Junrey from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Teofila Esperanza

texts.es:
Teofila es socia del  Banco Comunal “Flor de Canela”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia Puno y departamento Puno.  Está casada y tiene 4 hijos. Tiene 38 años de edad y tiene como grado de instrucción educación superior.
Hace siete años trabaja con  el Movimiento Manuela Ramos.  Su primer inicial fue por S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invirtió en su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de comidas (restaurante).
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 1600.00 nuevo soles, comprará arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, fideos, menestras, papa, gas, etc, y  realizará algunas mejorar en el local.  Ella  trabaja junto con su esposo y sus hijos. 
Su sueño es convertir el negocio en una quinta y preparar platos extras que le permita generar otros ingresos.
Lo que le gusta  del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad, responsabilidad y el bajo interés del préstamo.
texts.en:
Teofila is a member of the "Flor de Canela” community bank which is located in Puno district, in Puno province and department.  She is married and has four children.  She is 38 years old and completed her high school education.

Teofila has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for seven years.  Her initial loan was for 300 Peruvian soles and she invested that money in her restaurant business.

With this new loan for 1,600 soles, Teofila will buy rice, sugar, oil, milk, noodles, mixed vegetables, potatoes, gas, etc. and will make some improvements to her premises.  She works together with her husband and children.

Teofila's dream is to turn her business into a boarding house and prepare additional dishes that will allow her to make other income.

What Teofila likes about her community bank are the punctuality, responsibility and low interest rates.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, milk, noodles, mixed vegetables, potatoes, gas, etc.

loans.name: Bring Amber Court Members To Unite Group A

texts.en:
N. Grace is 29 years old. For 5 years now, she has been overseeing operations at her flourishing beauty salon which she began with modest savings from her poultry sales business. The beauty salon caters mostly to the interests of the middle-income women around Amber Court Street in Jinja. Grace says her weekly business operating profits are to the tune of 90,000 UGX. 

Grace is happily married, but with no kids yet. She says the modest strides she has made are all due to her diligence and determination. With this loan, Grace says she is going to purchase more hair chemicals to use at her beauty salon.

loans.use: purchase more hair chemicals to use at her beauty salon

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es: Doña Petrona es una mujer D. 83 años D. edad que vive en uno D. los barrios más alegres y tradicionales D. la ciudad D. Barranquilla, con un importante movimiento comercial y que  históricamente nos recuerda que allí se construyó el primer aeropuerto D. la ciudad; Doña Petrona en su condición D. viuda,  ha educado a 3 hijos, hoy en las edades D. 22 a 44 años mediante actividades empresariales ; ella inició con el negocio D. confecciones , D. allí pasó la venta D. refrescos y bebidas, como gaseosa, chicha  y cerveza  y aprovechando la oportunidad que le ofreciera un mercado conquistado, le adicionó la actividad D. venta D.  mercancía variada  como pantalones, jeans, suéteres y blusas.; en la medida en que su negocio fue creciendo lo adecuó con su enfriador que le permite vender sus refrescos bien fríos en el cálido clima D. la ciudad D. Barranquilla. Doña Petrona  observando una oportunidad D. vender en mayor volumen, quiere distribuir cervezas por cajas a los negocios cercanos, porque muchos D. ellos se quedan los fines D. semana sin bebidas hasta que llegue el camión D. esa empresa y Doña petrona quiere generarle la opción D. tener sus refrescos rápidamente y así ella también generará otro ingreso, por eso con su Credikiva, cuarto financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, comprará cajas D. cervezas y gaseosas y también invertirá en jeans, suéteres y blusas que ya tiene encargadas.  Con los anteriores créditos ha logrado incrementar su capital D. trabajo y sus clientes han ido creciendo, aumentando sus  ventas, sus planes son aportarle todo su esfuerzo al crecimiento D. su microempresa y por ello trabaja persistentemente.
texts.en:
Petrona is an 83-year-old woman who lives in one of Barranquilla’s most joyful and traditional neighborhoods.  It has important commercial activity and historically reminds us that the city’s first airport was built there.

In her widowhood, Petrona has raised three children, who today range in age from 22 to 44, through business activities.  She started out selling sweets.  Then she went into beverage sales like soft drinks, chicha (corn based drink) and beer taking advantage of the already captive clientele she had.  She then added sales of miscellaneous merchandise like pants, jeans, sweaters and blouses.  As her business grew she equipped it with a cooler that makes it possible for her to sell her beverages ice cold in Barranquilla’s hot climate.

Petrona sees the opportunity to sell in larger volume so wants to start selling beer by the case to nearby businesses because lots of them run out of beverages on weekends and have to wait until the delivery trucks from the respective firms come by.  Petrona would like to offer them the opportunity of having access to their refreshments quickly while she acquires an additional source of income.

This is why she will use her Kiva loan, her fourth loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy cases of beer and soft drinks.  She will also invest in jeans, sweaters and blouses that she already has pending orders for.

Her previous loans allowed her to increase her working capital so her customer base and her sales have grown.  Her plan is to put all her efforts into her micro business and this is why she works so persistently.

loans.use: to buy cases of beer and soft drinks and also to buy jeans, sweaters and blouses she has pending orders for.

loans.name: Melania

texts.es: Melania, de 59 años, reside en la comunidad del Palomar (selva central peruana). Ahí formó su familia junto a Ignacio, su esposo, desde hace 27 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos, a los que criaron y educaron con mucho cariño y esmero. Ahora ellos viven solos en su casa propia. Trabajando arduamente ha logrado sacar adelante sus sembríos, todas las mañana se levanta muy temprano para regar y brindarle el cuidado respectivo a sus cafetales y platanales, los cuales sus frutos los  venderá en la ciudad de La Merced, ya que es ahí donde obtiene los mejores precios por sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede disfrutar de la libertad de laborar en sus campos, lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar la tierra. Pero ve que su sacrificio es recompensado, cuando vende a los mayoristas que visitan su zona constantemente, obteniendo buenas ganancias, Ahora ella se encuentra en cosecha de café, donde está segura podrá obtener los resultados que espera. Además de tener el apoyo de su esposo, quien vende pescado a los pobladores de su localidad, realizando la venta de casa en casa.  Con el tiempo, espera poder adecuar sus tierras para plantar mucho más café. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Aroma de café” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde espera un pequeño préstamo para lograr sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Melania de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para sus cultivos de café que están creciendo sin mayores dificultades.
texts.en: Melania, who is 59 years old, lives in the Palomar community (in the central Peruvian jungle).  There, she raised her family together with her husband of 27 years, Ignacio.  They had 3 children, who they raised and educated with love and great care.  Now they live alone in their own home.  By working arduously, Melania has been successful in improving her fields.  Every morning, she gets up very early to water her plantings and to offer the same care to her coffee plants and her banana plants.  She sells her fruits in the city of La Merced, which is where she gets the best prices for her products.  What she likes best about her work is that she can enjoy the freedom of working in her fields.  She has been doing this for 30 years and considers that the most difficult part is having to work the soil.  But she sees that she is compensated for her sacrifice when she is able to sell to the wholesalers who frequently visit the area, and from whom she receives good earnings.  She is currently in the midst of the coffee harvest, and she is sure that she will obtain the results she was hoping for.  In addition, she has the support of her husband, who sells fish door-to-door in the settlements in their area.  In time, she hopes to be able to improve her fields so she can plant a lot more coffee.  Melania belongs to the communal bank “Aroma de Café” (Coffee Aroma), and this is her fourth loan with MFP, where she hopes for a small loan to achieve her goals.  She promises to, once again, comply with the repayment schedule, like she has with previous loans.  In addition, Melania is thankful for being a part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people.  When Melania receives her support, she will invest the requested money in the purchase of some sacks of organic fertilizer for her coffee plants, which are growing without great difficulty.

loans.use: to purchase some sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Angelina has a retail shop where she sells biscuits, snacks & canned goods. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & biscuits.

Angelina is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & biscuits.

loans.name: Jorge Manuel

texts.es:
En el municipio de Managua, el señor Jorge Manuel  es una  persona, responsable, trabajadora que labora como auxiliar de contabilidad desde hace cuatro años, tiene bueno valores morales, que ha sabido llevar el bienestar a su familia y  ha logrado mantener estabilidad en  su hogar.
Actualmente ha acudido a Ceprodel con el fin de solicitar  un crédito para mejorar la condición de su vivienda, con este desembolso comprara materiales de construcción tales como lamina de zinc, perlines y pago de mano de obra, para  acondicionar la sala de cocina  y poder dar una mejor  vida a su familia.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Managua, señor Jorge Manuel (a responsible, hard working person) has worked as an accounting assistant for the last four years.  He has good moral values and has brought well-being to his family.  He has also been able to maintain stability in his home.
Currently he has come to Ceprodel to request a loan to improve his housing.  With this money, he will purchase construction materials such as zinc sheet metal and rivets and pay the laborers.  He plans to update his kitchen and give his family a better life.

loans.use: to make improvements to his home.

loans.name: Delilah

texts.en:
Delilah is 56 years old, married, and has four children. Delilah works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

Delilah has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from farming rice. Delilah aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her store

loans.name: Sokouen

texts.en: Sokouen is a sugar palm and fish paste seller. Her husband is a motor taxi driver and their income is $6 per day. She has 3 children, one of whom is working in the factory. Every month, she has to spend $70 on food, $50 on school fees, $40 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy more sugar palm and fish paste to sell. She has been in this career quite long and she has got a lot of customers, so she wants to extend her business more when she has more money. For her children, she wants to send them to study at least through high school.

loans.use: To buy sugar palm and fish paste to sell.

loans.name: Luz De Luna Brillante Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUZ DE LUNA BRILLANTE” iniciará su tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Dionicia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de barrio, venta de ollas, venta de productos de curación, venta de comida, carpintería, electricista, costura de chamarras.
 
La señora Dionicia,  indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer  y que ingreso por invitación de la asesora de credito. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de carpintería que viene trabajando hace siete años, aprendiendo el mismo de su papá. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar capital (compra de madera) que adquirirá de Rio Seco (lugar comercial de la ciudad de El Alto)  y posteriormente elaborado los productos los venderá en la feria 16 de Julio. Esta forma de trabajo le permitirá generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta crédito, salud y ahorros.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank, “LUZ DE LUNA BRILLANTE”, will begin its third cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of Centro Collpani.  The communal bank is composed of eight members and is headed by a board led by Dionicia.  The community association members work in businesses that are varied, among them are: grocery, cookware sales, healing products sales, food vending, carpentry, electrician, jacket tailoring.
 
Dionicia indicates that this is the first time Pro Mujer integrated income at the invitation of the credit counselor. Today, Dionicia has a carpentry business that she has been working at for seven years.  She learned the same business as her dad.

Dionicia will use the loan to raise capital (to purchase wood) that she will acquire at Rio Seco (place of business in the city of El Alto).  She will later sell the finished products at the fair on July 16. This workflow allows her to generate resources to support her family as much as possible, because she lives with her partner and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Dionicia replies that she likes the loans, health and savings.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Reala

texts.en:
Reala is 40 years old with three children, all of whom are in school. She is a widow. She has a business selling onions and groundnut paste in Buluk branch in Juba, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Reala requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase more onions and groundnut paste to sell

loans.name: Samba

texts.fr: Monsieur samba vit au Sénégal. C’est un célibataire  de 32 ans qui évolue dans depuis 5 ans dans le secteur de la couture.  Parallèlement  il pratique la vente de tissus thioups, wax et divers autres.  Il a choisi son activité dans le souci de gagner sa vie étant donné qu’il vit dans une grande maison familiale. Il est membre  d’un des guichets de l’ (U-IMCEC depuis 2011. Il sollicite un crédit de 400 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de tissus( thioups, wax, etc. ) qu’il compte revendre a sa clientèle. Les bénéfices générés par son activité lui permettent de régler ses frais de location de son atelier et  de renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
Samba, age 32, lives in Senegal. He's single and, for five years, has been working in the dressmaking business. In parallel, he sells dyed fabrics (called "thioups" and "wax") as well as other products.

He chose this business eager to earn a living since he lives in a large family household. He's been a member of UIMCEC since 2011 and is seeking a loan of XOF 400'000 to buy dyed fabrics (thioups, wax, etc) to resell to his clientele. His profits enable him to pay the rent for his workshop and increase his savings.

loans.use: to buy and resell dyed fabrics

loans.name: Bunthorn

texts.en: Bunthorn, 40, resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Bunthorn is a tailor, earning an income of USD 2.60 per day. Her husband buys green coconuts to resell, earning an income of USD 20 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 80 on food and USD 55 on the other necessary expenses. Bunthorn is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to use to transport coconuts to sell. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to trasport coconuts to sell

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 5 children.  Lilibeth has a retail shop that sells used clothing, or ukay-ukay. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stock of used clothing, or ukay-ukay, to sell.  Lilibeth is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Lilibeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of used clothing ,or ukay-ukay, to sell

loans.name: Said

texts.ru: Саид занимается скотоводством. На протяжении многих лет вместе с сыном он занимается откормом и выращиванием крупного и мелкого рогатого скота. Он женат имеет троих детей, жена домохозяйка. Он хотел бы получить для покупки скота и корма для них  с целью расширения бизнеса и получения прибыли.
texts.en: Said is involved in animal husbandry.  Together with his son, he has been involved in fattening up and raising cattle and small livestock for many years.  Said is married, has three children and his wife is a homemaker.  He wants to obtain a loan for the purchase of livestock and fodder for it in order to expand his business and make a profit.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and fodder

loans.name: Sala-Ko Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SALA-KO est formé de trois personnes qui cohabitent ensemble. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Magni Catherine, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Magni Catherine est âgée de 43 ans et est mariée à un chauffeur nommé François. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont deux à leur charge. Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Le couple vit ensemble avec leurs enfants et subvient ensemble aux divers besoins de la famille. Magni Catherine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Magni Catherine exerce comme activité, la vente de pain accompagné de sandwich dans son quartier ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Magni Catherine désire renforcer son fonds de roulement et rehausser le niveau de son activité. Pour ce faire, Magni Catherine sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SALA-KO, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
SALA-KO Group is made up of three persons who share a home. The group's representative, named Magni Catherine, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. This is the first time that the members of this group are seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their businesses.

Magni Catherine, age 43, is married to a taxi driver named François. The couple has four children, out of whom they have to support two. Some children attend school. The couple live together with their children, and take care of the various household expenses together.

Magni Catherine never attended school. She sells bread and sandwiches in her neighborhood, a business which enables her to provide for her family without much difficulty.

Eager to better meet customer demand, she would like to increase her working capital and bolster her business. To this effect, she's seeking her first loan from ALIDé, together with the other members of the group.

loans.use: to buy bread and ingredients to make sandwiches (oil, fish, avocado, etc)

loans.name: Maria Herminia

texts.es: María, nuevamente necesita un nuevo financiamiento, porque necesita fortalecer su negocio y comprara más mercadería como: azúcar, frijoles, arroz, sopas instantáneas, el propósito de ella es siempre seguir atendiendo bien a sus clientes con variedad de productos,  para las necesidades básicas de cada uno. El préstamo anterior le ayudo a crecer y tener más variedad y a obtener mejores ingresos, esto le ayudo a mejorar mucho en su familia y darles lo mejor en lo económico, aunque los ultimos meses tuvo un atraso.
texts.en: María needs a loan once again because she needs to strengthen her business and buy more merchandise like sugar, beans, rice and instant soups.  Her goal is to continue taking care of customers with a variety of products to meet each of their basic needs.  The previous loan helped her to grow and to have more variety so that she earned higher income which helped her improve in her family very much and to give them the best economically speaking although in the last few months she was a little late.

loans.use: to buy sugar, beans and instant soups.

loans.name: Agripina
