texts.es: Agripina es socia del Banco Comunal Alondras, tiene 57 años y es madre D. 7 hijos, es socia D. FINCA Peru desD. hace 18 años, se dedica a la venta D. artesanías, telares, frazadas, con los préstamos que ha recibido pudo abrir su tienda D. Artesanía, agradece mucho a Morenita (fundadora D. FINCA Peru) porque le enseñó a ser honesta, puntual, y responsable, con la rentabilidad D. su negocio pudo educar a sus hijos. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. hilos para poder hacer los telares. Su meta es poder empezar a construir el terreno que tiene.
texts.en: Agripina is a member of the Alondras communal bank, She is 57 years old and the mother of 7 children. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for 18 years. She sells artisanal crafts, looms, and blankets. With the money she has received she was able to open her artisanal crafts store. She is very grateful to Morenita (founder of FINCA Peru), because she showed her how to be honest, punctual, and responsible with her business' profits and be able to educate her children. The loan she is asking for will be invested in buying thread to make the looms. Her goal is to be able to start construction on the land she has.

loans.use: to buy thread for her looms.

loans.name: Jeanette Yadira

texts.es:
Jeanette, de 45 años de edad, habitante de la ciudad de Estelí,  madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales dos de ellos son independientes y los otros dos viven con ella están estudiando. Inicio su negocio con capital proprio hace 20 años cuando trabajaba par una empresa privada pero enfermo de los huesos y tuvo que dejar de trabajar  por las constantes tratamientos a los que fue sometida, esto no fue obstaculo para buscar como salir adelante no podía dejar a sus hijos solos así que con la pensión que le pasaron ella puso su pulpería para que generara ingresos y sus hijos tuvieran lo necesario para vivir. 
Ella requiere el préstamo comprar ropa, azúcar, arroz, frijoles, detergentes, jabón, papel higiénico, Juguetes. Con esta inversión podrá tener surtido su pulpería  de nuevos y mejores productos de mucha necesidad en su vecindario. Una de sus metas es terminar de preparar a sus hijos y comprar material construcción para mejorar las condiciones de su casa y su negocio.
texts.en:
Jeanette is 45 years old and a resident of the city of Estelí. She is a single mother with four children, two of whom are independent while the other two live with her and are studying. Jeanette started her business when she was 20 years old, using her own capital that she earned while working for a private company. However, she developed a bone disease and was not able to continue working because of the constant treatments that she had to endure. This did not prevent her from moving forward since she could not support her children with only her pension. She opened a store so that she could generate income and provide what was necessary in order for her children to live.

Jeanette is requesting a loan in order to buy clothing, sugar, rice, beans, detergents, soap, toilet paper, and toys. With this investment, she will be able to restock her store with new and better products that have great need in her neighborhood. One of her goals is to finish raising her children and buy construction materials in order to improve the conditions in her home and in her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing, sugar, rice, beans, detergents, soap, toilet paper, and toys.

loans.name: Martha. B

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Martha. She is single and has a child, age 1 year. She has 1 additional dependent that lives with her because she is her sister.  

In 2006, Martha established her clothing business. She began her business because she needed a means of getting livelihood for her family. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 1,700,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Martha requires a loan in order to buy gara, batick and sifon clothing materials. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. 

In the future, Martha plans to build a house and send her son to a very good school. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy gara, batick and sifon clothing materials

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 42 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is single and has 5 children, 2 of them currently in school. For the past 2 years, Christine has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar and soap for resale, and will help Christine to generate greater profits, improving her capital. Christine hopes that, in the future, she will be able to open up another retail shop. 

Christine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Christine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: Saddam

texts.en: Saddam is a 22-year-old single man who lives with his father and mother, who are farmers. Saddam is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary,. He wants to help his family prepare for the winter agricultural season by purchasing different types of peas and fodder and paying the expenses for cultivating their piece of land. Since his salary is not enough to cover these purchases and expenses, Saddam will take a loan from FATEN. This loan will enable his parents to get better crops, to compete with others and to increase their sales and the family income, resulting in better living conditions for Saddam and his family.

loans.use: To purchase peas and fodder and to pay expenses for cultivating the land.

loans.name: Waweru

texts.en:
Waweru is 47 years old and married to Esther.  They have five children.  He makes bricks to sell, a business in which he has been involved for the last five years.  Waweru earns a monthly income of 35,000 KES.

Waweru is requesting his first loan from Kiva partner KADET Ltd.  He plans to use the 30,000 KES loan to purchase firewood to bake bricks and to pay wages.  Waweru plans to open a shop for his wife with the anticipated profits from the business and to pay school fees. 

His hopes and dreams are to become large scale brick seller and businessman.

loans.use: To buy materials for his brick production business.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married woman with five children, two girls and three boys, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a food stall business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a retail shop business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil for the food stall business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil for the food stall business.

loans.name: Franciscana Aurora

texts.es: Francisca tiene 42 años de edad es casada y tiene 3 hijos el  mayor estudia en colegio  y los 2 mejores estudian en un escuela pública cerca de su casa. Comenzó con la ilusión de tener un negocio propio para también generar ingreso a su casa y fue como dio la apertura a  un mini bazar viniendo las necesidades de sus vecinos ya que no habia bazar por su casa. Poco a poco fue incrementando sus ventas por lo que ahora vende, blusa, cuadernos, lápiz. Con es crédito quiere comprar cuadernos, lápices, carpetas etc. Su meta es ampliar su negocio.
texts.en: Francisca, 42, is married and has three children. The oldest is in secondary school and the two youngest study in the public school close to her house. She began with the dream of having her own business to be able to earn money for her household. This is how she came to open a mini-store, selling things that her neighbors needed, since there was no shop near her house. Little by little she increased her sales through what she sells now: blouses, notebooks, pencils. With this loan, she wants to buy notebooks, pencils, folders, etc. Her goal is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pencils, folders, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
2 years ago Maria decided to start her own store out of her home. She started off with just $100 in capital and slowly was able to increase her product line and her customer base. She now sells basic foods and snacks for kids. She opens her business every morning and closes late at night. With profits above her expectations, Maria has been continuously investing in her business.

Maria needs the loan in order to continue investing in her business. She wants to begin selling meats such as beef and chicken. She also wants to make some physical improvements to her shop.

Maria moved to Guayaquil from Esmeraldas, a predominantly Afro community, about ten years ago. She attained her land in a popular invasion of a territory now named Nigeria. She still does not have the paperwork for her home, which is built out of a bamboo like wood. Currently there is no pavement where she lives because the tide brings in the water. She has 5 small children and a husband who is works for the local water company.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She wants to begin selling meats such as beef and chicken.

loans.name: Imeleta

texts.en: Imeleta loves flowers and their scents. She also uses them to accent her fashion, like wearing flowers on her ear make her more beautiful. This is Ime’s life. Around Imeleta’s house are different flowers and different plants. These flowers are used for decorations in homes, chapels, and school buildings, or as a sign of a boy’s love for a girl. Her gift with plants is well known in her area, and she provides vases of flowers and arrangements for many customers. Imeleta is on her 5th loan and she is the President of Tulaele K.P center. These loans help her increase her sales and business.

loans.use: To purchase pots and plastic bags to for planting

loans.name: Laura Del Carmen

texts.en:
Laura is 53 years old and has 4 children. She has been a widow for two years. Her mother lives with her and helps her with the necessities. In order to manage her expenses, she works at a nearby bakery for some hours as a helper. She also has a small grocery store. In this way she is able, with great effort, to support her family. She asks for a loan to supply her grocery store and commit to staffing it all day. Her customers are people of her community and the surrounding area. She is part of the Laguna Azul 2 Group.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

LAURA TIENE 53 AÑOS, VIUDA HACE DOS AÑOS, TIENE CUATRO HIJOS, ADEMAS SU MAMA VIVE CON ELLA Y LAURA LE AYUDA A CUBRIR TODAS SUS NECESIDADES. PARA PODER LOGRARLO TRABAJA COMO AYUDANTE DE UNA PANADERIA CERCANA A SU CASA POR ALGUNAS HORAS. TIENE ADEMAS UNA PEQUEÑA TIENDA DE ABARROTES. CON MUCHO ESFUERZO LOGRA DE ESTA FORMA DARLE SUSTENTO A SU FAMILIA. NECESITA EL CREDITO PARA ABASTECER SU TIENDA Y DEDICARSE A ATENDERLA CON HORARIO COMPLETO. SUS CLIENTES SON GENTE DE LA COLONIA DE DONDE VIVE Y DE SUS ALREDEDORES. PERTENECE AL GRUPO LAGUNA AZUL 2.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her grocery store

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz is married and has four children, they are natives of the city of Monterrey, Nuevo León. Her husband is a city bus driver, nevertheless, the salary that he was earning wasn’t covering the basic needs of her family. In order to improve the quality of life of her family Beatriz started her own dressmaking shop, she learned this occupation very well studying dressmaking and fashion. The good quality of her service has allowed her to grow with her business and to increase the number of clients.

Beatriz wants to keep on growing with her business and she wants to make the most of the school starting classes soon to make school uniforms, therefore she is asking for a loan of $475 that she will use to buy fabrics and material that she needs. She promises to repay the loan in 6 months. Be an important of this business and help Beatriz, she and her family will be very grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Beatriz es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, ellos son originarios de la ciudad de Monterrey, Nuevo León. Su esposo es chofer de un autobús urbano, sin embargo, el salario que recibe no cubría las necesidades básicas de su familia y para mejora la calidad de vida de su familia Beatriz inició su propio taller de costura, oficio que aprendió muy bien al estudiar confección y modas, la buena calidad del servicio que ofrece le ha permitido crecer con su negocio e incrementar su número de clientes.

Beatriz desea continuar creciendo con su negocio y aprovechando que está próximo el regreso a clases quiere comenzar con la elaboración de uniformes escolares por lo que solicita un crédito de $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de telas y el material que necesita, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante de este negocio y decídete a apoyar a Beatriz, ella y su familia te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Sirila Vizcaina

texts.en:
Sirila is 29 years old and has 5 children. She’s living on the upper slopes of Yamasá hill where she runs her business. She buys special cloth and with a sewing machine she makes mosquito nets that she sells in the surrounding community and Santo Domingo, the capital. From a quintal of cloth (approximately 100 pounds), she can make 60 mosquito nets in 15 days.

Sirila is requesting a loan of U.S $225.00 to expand her business and to have the capacity to reach more people, since the demand for this kind of product is increasing. Her product can prevent diseases caused by mosquito bites like dengue which has been very frequent during the last six months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma, 54, and her partner of 20 years, Isidro, live together in Itá, Paraguay, with their four children aged 28, 25, 22 and 19.

Irma’s oldest child has left Paraguay in search of better employment opportunities. Another one of her sons is now married, while her two younger daughters are still in school and live at home. 

Irma owns a small, home-based grocery store. In the past, the family relied on Isidro for the family income. Isidoro worked at a company in Itá, while Irma stayed at home and took care of the children. Unfortunately, due to the uncertain work conditions in the area, Isidoro lost his job. It was at this time that the couple decided to open their own grocery store. 

In the beginning they only sold meat and milk; however, as their business grew, they expanded the variety of goods offered to such items as noodles, sugar and rice. 

Also today, the shop continues to grow, and is well known and popular in the neighborhood. 

Irma has requested a loan of US$625 to be able to buy larger quantities of merchandise for sale. Specifically, she plans to purchase chicken, cold cuts and beef.

loans.use: Bulk purchase of merchandise, including chicken, cold cuts and beef

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia B. is in her early forties, and she and her husband have seven children, three boys and four girls. Her three boys are professionals and the girls attend school.

Julia has a stall in the public market where she runs her business. She sells plucked chickens. “That’s a very useful and profitable business”, she says. Two times a week, she goes to Santo Domingo, the capital, to purchase live chickens. Then, her patio becomes a true slaughterhouse where animals are killed and gotten ready to be sold. With a great sense of humor, she explains that business is successful because "Dominicans eat chicken as any human being needs water to survive”. In fact, chicken is one of the most often prepared dishes of this country.

Julia is requesting a loan to purchase more chickens to sell, especially during the holidays. She hopes she can get the funds before long to be sure she will increase her income and keep on helping her daughters attend school. In the past, Julia has proved to be an honest person. She has already taken a loan from FSMA and was able to repay it successfully.

loans.use: To purchase chickens to supply her little butcher shop

loans.name: Ibrohim

texts.ru:
Ibrohim B. is 41 years old, he has a high school diploma and is divorced. Ibrohim has been raising cattle for 2 years. He has a cattle farm. With his new credit Ibrohim would like to purchase several young calves in order to raise and resell. He plans to sell these calves in 40-45 days. With his profit he will purchase new calves and feed for them. According to the forecast prepared for the client, at the end of the credit cycle he should have 3 young calves as profit.

The client plans to repay credit in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Бобоалиев Иброхим, возраст – 41 год, образование среднее, разведен. Иброхим занимается разведением крупного рогатого скота уже в течение 2 лет. Для этого он имеет большой коровник. Полученный кредит он хочет использовать на приобретение нескольких молодых бычков для их откорма и продажи. Он планирует продавать их через каждые 40-45 дней. На вырученные деньги приобретать новых бычков и корма для них. В конце кредитного цикла клиенту, в качестве прибыли, согласно подготовленного пргоноза должно остаться 3 молодых бычка. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase Cattle

loans.name: Rukmani

texts.en:
Mrs. Rukmani T., 50 years old, is a tailor in the town of Tangal in Patan. She opened her tailoring shop 30 years ago. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies dresses and school uniforms for both boys and girls. She prefers to make popular dresses like Kurta Sulwar, blouses, ladies long dresses, Makhshi, and others.

Before starting her own business, Mrs. Tamarkar took a 6 month training course in tailoring when she was young. She plans to use the loan of Rs 15000 to buy raw materials for her tailoring work. She wants to add to her family's income and support her children's education.

Her husband's name is Rabindra Kumar T.. However she is separated from her husband. She is solely responsible for the family. She has one son and two daughters. They are now studying.

loans.use: To buy raw material for her work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase of fruits and vegetables to expand a small business.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is 20 years old and is a single woman. Salama is a cloth seller; she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $275 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Nora's Furaha Group

texts.en:
Nora is a married woman with 3 children, ages 20, 18 and 15 years old. Nora sells clothes, and she started in 1997. Every day, she works from 8.30 a.m. to 8 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Zuhura, Zainati and Idaty, who have businesses dealing in retail sales, charcoal sales and milk sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth S. has one freezer that she uses to sell  drinks and she also sells provisions and juice. She learned this business for 2 years and she has been in this business since 2003. Elizabeth is 32 years old and married with 4 children. She lives at Afro-media, Lagos State, Nigeria. Elizabeth needs a loan of $425 to buy more drinks and provisions for sale. She says this will increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and provisions for sales.

loans.name: Kayi

texts.fr:
Married with no children, Kayi L. B. A. was born on February 10, 1985 in Lomé. She left school at a young age to apprentice as a hairdresser because the work suited her. In fact, she became a gifted hairdresser and in 2005 she opened her own salon that she calls FLORE COIFFURE. She then added the sale of cosmetics and items used in her work. This additional business made her clientele grow.

She is requesting this loan, her first, to add to her stock of cosmetics by buying 102 boxes of Gel UB, 24 hair extensions, and 10 wigs.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Mariée sans enfant, madame L. B. A. Kayi est née le 10 février 1985 à Lomé. Elle a quitté très tôt les bancs pour se lancer dans l’apprentissage de la coiffure à cause de son goût pour ce domaine. En effet elle devint une coiffeuse très talentueuse et a ouvert en 2005 son atelier de coiffure qu’elle nomma FLORE COIFFURE. Elle associa alors la vente de produits cosmétiques et des articles utilisés pour son travail. Cette association a fait gonfler sa clientèle.

Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour augmenter son stock en produits cosmétiques par l’achat de 102 boites de Gel UB, 24 tissages et 10 perruques.

loans.use:
Purchase of cosmetics

Achat des produits cosmétiques

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Awa G. is 53 years old, widowed with 7 children and 10 other people in her care, and has been a member of the village bank of Lélo in Thiès for 8 years. She is seeking a loan to buy and re-sell local fruit such as mangoes. With her income, she improves the living conditions of her children. The loan she is asking for will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Awa G., 53 ans, veuve avec 07 enfants et 10 autres personnes en charge est membre du banc villageois de Lélo à Thiès depuis 8 ans. Elle veut un prêt pour acheter et revendre des fruits locaux comme les mangues. Avec ses revenus elle améliore les conditions de vie de ses enfants. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To sell local fruit

loans.name: Maguno

texts.en:
Maguno is 49 years. She is divorced with three children aged between 25 and 18 years old. She has been a tailoring, firewood and khanga (traditional clothing) seller since 1990. Every day, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Maguno now requests a loan to improve her business by increasing her inventory.

loans.use: To improve her business by increasing her inventory.

loans.name: Samira

texts.en: Samira (her husband is pictured) is a mother of 2 children. She was born in 1977. She has been in the cattle breeding business for 5 years. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town, and settled in the Fuzuli region in Bala Bahmanli village. Now this family needs a loan of $1200 to buy 2 calves.

loans.use: To buy 2 calves

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.es:
Martha inicio con este negocio ya que su esposo estaba pasando por un momento muy difícil en su trabajo por lo que ella decidió apoyarlo para sacar adelante a su familia. Inicio con este negocio hace 3 años, vendiendo ropa primero en su casa y actualmente vende a todos sus compañeros de trabajo.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar mercancía y surtir unos pedidos que tiene pendientes.
texts.en:
Martha started this business because her husband was passing through a difficult time in his work. She decided to help her family to get ahead. She began the business 3 years ago, selling clothing first from her house, and now she sells to all her coworkers. She needs a loan of US $300, that she will repay in 5 months, to buy merchandise to fill some current orders.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Jerus

texts.en:
Jerus T., 30 years old, a resident of Baliangao, Misamis Occidental, operates a mini store right at home.  She takes care of her preschool-aged son and lovingly supports her husband who is a motorcycle driver.  She tells us that life is tough without a good way to earn a living.  

The initiative of having a store at home started as a hobby but later on became a serious business for the family.  Jerus realized that it’s really convenient to have the store right at their doorstep.  Having this in mind, she has applied for PHP 14,500 from Paglaum MPC to complete the structure and have a bigger space for her inventory.  Jerus is a member in good standing who has made all her repayments in a timely fashion.

Young couple that they are, Jerus and her husband dream of erecting an improved and decent home and desire to operate a real grocery store someday.

loans.use: Completion of store construction and purchasing additional stocks for her mini-store

loans.name: Sun

texts.en: Sun S., 30, has three children and lives in the Kampong Cham province with her husband, Him Channy (pictured here). They work together selling rice from their home, and they make around $8 US each day. All of their children are students. Sun S. is asking for a loan of $300 US to expand her rice stock. They believe that with the loan, the expansion of their business will bring about an increased income and a higher standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase rice.

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Bridget I. is a hardworking woman. She has a shop where she sells baby items. She has been in this business for a long time. She is 35 years old and married with 2 children. She needs the loan amount of N50000 to purchase more baby items for resale. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more baby items for resale

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa Maria C. tiene una miscelánea que se llama “Estanquillo Rosa” con esta tiendita  ya tiene 18 años. La señora Rosa vende de todo fritos, refrescos, chicharrones con repollo, abarrotes y en temporadas de calor “nieve”. Ahora ella no ha podido surtir su negocio por que comenta que en estos meses son bajas las ventas, pero llegando el verano vende más que ahora.
 Ella quiere abastecer su estanquillo para tener más fuentes de dinero, aunque su esposo es una ayuda para ella ya que  trabaja como chofer de camión, tiene dos hijos los cuales todavía están en escuela  y quiere que tengan mejor educación.
texts.en:
Rosa Maria C. has a corner shop that is called “Estanquillo Rosa” ["Rosa's General Store"]. She has owned this little store for 18 years. Rosa sells fried foods, soft drinks, fried pork with cabbage, provisions, and, in hot seasons "nieve" ["snow"]. Currently, she has been unable to supply her business because sales have decreased in these months, but now that summer is coming she is selling more than before. Rosa wants to stock her general store so that she will have more sources of income, even though her husband is a help to her given that he works as a truck driver. She has two children who are still in school and she wants them to have a better education.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Charbel

texts.en: Charbel is a 29-year-old married man with one young child, living in Zouk Mosbeh in Mount Lebanon. Since he was 16, he has worked as a car electrician in a car repair shop, and in 2002 he opened his shop. Today, Charbel wants to borrow US$ 1,000 in order to buy electrical spare parts to increase his inventory.

loans.use: Buy electrical spare parts

loans.name: Asafo

texts.en: Asafo N. is an electrical repairer with a junior high education living at Comender Junction near Elmina. He is married and has 2 children; his wife is a farmer. A repairer of electrical and electronic devices since 1994, Asafo is responsible for paying the family's rent and utility bills, his children's school fees, and other financial expenses. His loan will be used to buy more and better tools and equipment to enhance his repair work. He hopes to reinvest the new profits from his business into expanding his trade and also save towards a house he wants to construct, so he can stop renting apartments.

loans.use: To buy more and better tools and equipment to enhance his repair work.

loans.name: Afde N°2 Group

texts.fr: Les cinq femmes du groupe Association Femme Développement Entreprise AFDE N°2  ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Cité Lamy (région de Thiès). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté. Elles exercent presque la même activité de vente de tissu et de mercerie. Elles sont très sollicitées dans ces activités. Dans le cadre de l’amélioration de la qualité de leurs services et l’agrandissement de la taille de leurs activités, les membres du groupe confiance ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de micro finance IMCEC avec laquelle il est à son deuxième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour constituer un stock important de tissus et patte d’arachide. Les tissus et la patte d’arachide sont vendus en détail, au comptant au marché grand Thiès.  Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 30 000FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The 5 women of the Association Femme Développement Entreprise AFDE N°2 group have an average age of 40 and live in large traditional extended families in the Cité Lamy district (Thiès region). They met because of being neighbors or related to each other. They have almost the same business: selling cloth and sewing supplies. They are much sought after in this activity.

Intending to improve the quality of their services and expand the size of their businesses, the members of the group confidence decided to join the micro-finance institution IMCEC with whom they are on their second solidarity loan (group loan). The preceding loan was correctly reimbursed. They intend to use this loan to make a significant addition to their inventory of cloth and peanut butter. The cloth and peanut butter are sold retail, for cash, in the big market of Thiès. They each hope to make an average profit of 30,000 F CFA during this loan cycle, which will be used to reimburse the interest on the loan and cover necessities for their extended family, with any remainder reinvested into their businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolstering their little businesses

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia es una mujer muy tranquila y trabajadora, tiene 57 años y vive en la casa D. su familia, lo que más quiere es salir adelante y progresar en su negocio. La vida D. Alicia siempre ha sido muy solitaria, desD. que cumplió la mayoría D. edad (18 años), trabajó haciendo todo lo que pudo para mantenerse por sí sola y no depender D. sus padres. Actualmente se dedica a la venta D. instrumentos odontológicos, los cuales lleva a vender a las ciudades D. La paz y Cochabamba (ciudades del país D. Bolivia). Para Alicia el negocio que realiza es muy rentable, ya que tiene muchos clientes, y lo que más le gusta es viajar, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad, lo que considera más complicado es transportar los instrumentos odontológicos, puesto que se tiene que hacer con mucho cuidado. Alicia desea más adelante tener una tienda en el país D. Bolivia donD. pueda vender con más comodidad, puesto que actualmente lo hace sólo a pedido. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y está muy feliz D. la oportunidad D. obtenerlo, en su banco comunal es una socia muy solidaria con el resto D. sus compañeras. Con los 600 soles solicitados planea comprar más instrumentos odontológicos para incrementar la cantidad D. su mercadería.
texts.en:
Alicia is a very laid back but hardworking woman. She is 57 years old and lives in her family home. What she wants most is to move forward with her business.

Alicia's life has always been very solitary. Since she turned 18 she has been working to support herself on her own and not depend on her parents.

Currently she works in dental equipment sales in La Paz and Cochabamba (Bolivian cities). Her business is very profitable, she has many clients. What she enjoys most is traveling. She has been doing this work for 4 years. What is most difficult is transporting the equipment, which must be done very carefully.

Alicia would one day like to have a store in Bolivia where she could conduct sales more conveniently, given that currently she sells on request only.

This is Alicia's first loan from MFP, and she is very happy to have this opportunity. She is very close to the other members of her communal bank.

With the 600 soles she has requested, she plans to buy more equipment, to increase her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia S. is from the village of S.. She is 47 years old and married with three school-aged children. Virginia owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale.

Virginia joined ASKI (Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc.) to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seed, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the borrower's business. 


About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seed, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther es socia del Banco Comunal Marcela.
Esther es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 2 hijos, Esther junto a su esposo vende abarrotes en general en la selva ayacuchana, sus productos los transporta con un carro alquilado, sus ventas los realiza en las diferentes ferias de la selva.
Esther necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Esther sueña con construir su casa y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Esther is a member of Communal Bank Marcela. She is 29 years old, and lives with her husband and their 2 children. Alongside her husband, Esther sells groceries in the Ayacuchana Jungle, and transports her goods with a rented car. They sell their goods at different market days around the jungle. Esther needs a loan of 1500 Soles, which she will invest in purchasing rice and sugar. Her dream is to build her own home and educate her children.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice and sugar

loans.name: Jennelyn

texts.en:
Jennelyn R. is from the village of Santiago, Iligan City. She is 25 years old. Jennelyn is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Jennelyn owns and operates a specialized business venture in the retail sector. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling  scrap materials in their village. From the money she borrows from the organization, she will immediately procure a "trisikad" that will help her in buying scrap materials in their place. Jennelyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jennelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jennelyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jennelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business.

location.town: Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
La señora Ana María D. se dedica a su actividad de venta de productos comestibles y productos del hogar ofrecidos en su pulpería ubicada en la ciudad de León donde atiende a sus clientes que le visitan para realizar las compras.

Ella ha decidido invertir en las compras de los productos y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito  ya que requiere la compra de los comestibles y de los productos del hogar para salir adelante mejorando sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana María D. sells food and home products in her small grocery store, which is located in the city of León and this is where she tends to her customers who come to make their purchases. She has decided to invest in buying merchandise, so she has turned to Ceprodel to request a loan. She needs to buy food and home products so that she can improve living conditions for herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda I., 56 years old, is from the village of Biasong. She is married and has 6 adult children. Erlinda operates a fishing business. She makes her living harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Erlinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP to be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Erlinda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La señora Virginia es socia del Banco Comunal “22 de septiembre”, en el centro poblado de M. del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 29 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, ella pudo estudiar la primaria completa.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 4 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto con lo cual pudo adquirir animales menores.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, el préstamo le servirá para la compra venta de ganado mayor (vacas), La señora Virginia compra  su ganado en la ferias de Pilcuyo e Ilave.

Su deseo es convertirse en mayorista.

A ella le gustan las reuniones.
texts.en:
Señora Virgina is a member of the "22 de septiembre" community bank in M., in the district of Ilave, province of El Collao, department of Puno. She is 29 years old, married, and has three children. She was able to complete her elementary education. Virginia has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for four years. Her first loan of S/. 300 nuevos soles ($100) allowed her to acquire small animals. Now, she needs a loan of S/. 2,000 nuevos soles ($700), which she will use to buy large livestock (cattle). Virginia buys her livestock at the markets of Pilcuyo and Ilave. Her goal is to become a wholesaler. Virgina likes her group meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle and become a livestock wholesaler

loans.name: Boverlita

texts.en:
Boverlita L., 59, is a rice grower. She owns a 1.5-hectare rice field, which she inherited from her parents. She has 11 children who are all her inspirations to do well in the farming business. Her eldest child is 40 years old.

She would like to request a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy quality rice seeds as well to pay for fertilizers to improve the soil's condition. 

She dreams of having a bigger farm someday, of hiring more workers and of having an abundant harvest. In that way, she could not just support her own family but other people as well.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Miged

texts.en:
Miged D., who lives with his wife in Uvurkhangai province, located in the central part of Mongolia, was a driving teacher in the Defense Aide Association until he retired in 1996. Since that time, he has started a taxi service in the Arvaikheer Soum center and is now operating the business in the provincial center.

A good-natured and hardworking person, Miged has lived in his current home for 40 years and plans to continue operating his business in order to support the education of his two grandchildren. He is now requesting 1,000,000 tugrugs (approx. $690 USD) to purchase repair parts for his car.

loans.use: To purchase repair parts for his car

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 24 year old father of one who lives and runs his water supply business in Mukuru slums Nairobi. He is requesting for a third loan of Kes. 80,000 in order to purchase more tanks and open another outlet. He hopes to one day run an established company and raise a successful family. He describes himself as honest, hardworking and focused.



About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add water tanks

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es: Soledad es una mujer trabajadora  y activa, vive en el caserío de Señor de los Milagros que se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Campo Verde región de Ucayali,  tiene 29 años  y es madre de dos hijos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la crianza de pollos para vender en el mercado de Campo verde, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que se dedica a la venta de tablas de madera. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mi Señor de los Milagros” desde hace un año, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que invirtió en alimentos balanceado para pollos, en la actualidad Soledad necesita un crédito de 1000 soles que será utilizado para comprar alimento balanceado para animales menores.  La meta de Soledad es tener una fuente de soda y seguir apoyando a su esposo en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Soledad is an active, hardworking woman. She lives in the community of Señor de los Milagros which is located in the district of Campo Verde in the region of Ucayali. She is 29 years old and is the mother of two young children. She works raising chickens to sell in the market of Campo Verde. She counts on the help of her husband who works selling wood planks. She has been part of the Community Bank Mi Señor de los Milagros (My Father of the Miracles) for about a year. The first loan she received was for 300 soles which she invested in balanced feed for her chickens. Now Soledad needs a loan of 1000 soles that will be used to buy balanced feed for small animals. Soledad's goal is to have a soda fountain and continue to support her husband with household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy balanced animal feed

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es una mujer muy luchadora, tiene 54 años y vive feliz con su esposo Carlos de 64 años y sus hijos; Mercedes de 31 y Daisy de 27 años. Ellos viven en una agradable casa, la cual es propia e invirtieron mucho en que esté bien construida.

Ella se dedica a la preparación de toda clase de pasteles; para lograr emprender este negocio  habilitó un espacio en su casa y allí produce los más variados sabores de postres, tortas, queques, entre otros bocadillos; los cuales despiden un agradable y provocativo olor capaz de convencer al más exigente cliente.
Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a endulzar los paladares, labor que aprendió en una escuela de repostería y cada cierto tiempo toma cursos para como ella misma dice “estar actualizada, porque todo cambia hasta los tipos de pasteles”. 
Julia empezó el negocio vendiendo a sus familiares y conocidos, pero en la actualidad vende desde su casa a muchas personas desconocidas, que se desesperan por comprarle; además  quien escribe esta historia puede dar fe de las delicias que prepara esta dulce señora. 
Es así que esta trabajadora mujer que se proyecta en cada preparación, mezcla diversos ingredientes selectos y obtiene lo mejor día a día en cada pastel.

Ya es la quinta vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y está segura de cumplir con sus pagos como siempre lo ha hecho. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mayor cantidad de ingredientes e innovar en algunos tipos de pastelillos, pues quiere modernizar las herramientas que utiliza y así ofrecer los mejores postres.
texts.en:
Julia, 54, is a very hard-working woman. She lives happily with her husband, Carlos, 64, and their children Mercedes, 31, and Daisy, 27. They live in a pleasant home which they own and have invested heavily in to insure its good construction. She prepares all kinds of cakes. To do so, she equipped part of her house and there produces the most varied flavores of desserts: turnovers and cakes, among others, which emit a provocative and pleasant aroma capable of convincing the most demanding customer. She has sweetened tastes for over 20 years, a task she learned in pastry school and, ever so often, through courses she takes in order, as she herself states: "to be refreshed and up-to-date because everything changes, even cakes." In the beginning, Julia sold to her family and acquaintances but now she sells to many strangers who come to her home anxious to buy from her. The person writing this account can attest to the delicious delicacies this sweet woman prepares. This is how this hard-working woman injects herself into each preparation, mixes various select ingredients, and obtains each day the best in each cake. This is the fifth loan with MFP and she is sure to repay in a timely fashion as she has always done in the past. The funds requested will be used to buy a greater quantity of ingredients and to innovate some of the types of pastries because she wants to modernize the tools she uses to be able to offer still better desserts.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and utensiles for dessert preparation.

loans.name: Kroem

texts.en:
Mrs. Kroem K. lives in Tuol Trea village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Mey Kun, is a fisherman.

Now Mrs. Kroem K.’s husband wants to expand his fishing by purchasing more fishing nets. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for her husband’s purpose. She hopes to increase their income and improve their family’s standard of living with this loan.

Mrs. Kroem K. is 43 years old and the mother of four children who are attending the local school. Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more fishing nets for her husband

loans.name: Domitila Mumbua

texts.en: Domitila is a 24-year-old single parent with one daughter. She was introduced to KADET by an existing customer that operates her business nearby. Domitila has been operating a charcoal business for the last three years, from which she earns a monthly profit of Ksh 6,000. She will use 20% of her loan to repair her business premises and 50% to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell to customers. With the remaining 30% she hopes to open another business selling vegetables. Domitila describes herself as a hardworking lady who is focused and wants to excel in business. She dreams of being a big business owner in Malindi town. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To repair her business premises, to buy more sacks of charcoal, and to open a grocery stand to sell vegetables

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine is 18 years old and is married but she doesn’t have a child. She lives with her husband in the Northern Province of Rwanda approximately three hours drive from Kigali, the capital of Rwanda.

Clementine employs one person from her community as a helper in her retail business selling different kinds of products such as salt, sugar, soap and other cosmetics goods, biscuits and so on. She has been in the business for two years and works from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. every day except Sunday.

Before this business activity Clementine was a full-time housewife. In that situation she could not help her husband to support her family because she hadn’t any income. After becoming a businesswoman she is able to earn a monthly profit of 30,000 RWF (approximately 50 USD).

Clementine is requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to grow her business through purchasing more products such as salt, sugar, rice and shoes.

loans.use: To purchase more rice, sugar, salt and shoes for sale

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Mrs. Sauda K. is a committed lady of thirty-three years. She owns a drug store located in the Kabwohe trading center. She has worked and lived in the area for over fifteen years. She is using the loan to purchase and stock more medicine in her drug store in order to meet her customers’ demands.

She is a married woman, blessed with four children. She is doing her best to provide the best for them. In her absence, her husband helps her run the business. Mrs. Sauda’s future plan is to increase her business for more profits.

loans.use: To purchase and stock more medicines.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou D. est une femme de 35 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SILANE depuis 4 ans et y a bénéficié de 8 prêts. Elle fait de la restauration, une activité qui lui génère des bénéfices lui permettant de participer aux différentes charges familiales.
texts.en:
Fatou D. is a married, 35 year-old woman with four children. For the past four years, she has been a member of the SILANE Village Bank and has been the recipient of eight loans. She works in the restaurant business. The income from her business activities goes towards meeting the needs of the family.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen and develop her business activities

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group
loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Drissa

texts.fr:
Agé de 36 ans, Monsieur  Drissa Traoré est marié et réside  avec sa femme dans une  grande famille traditionnelle élargie  Wayerma II, un des populaires de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas eu la chance de fréquenter l’école, Drissa s’intéressa très vite aux activités génératrices de revenus, notamment à l’achat vente des vêtements de “friperie” depuis près de 20 ans. Il appris cette activité, auprès de son père qui était un grand  vendeur de la place. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant deux ans et avec laquelle il est à son troisième prêt individuel.  Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
 Il compte acheter avec ce troisième prêt de la friperie : 1balle de Maillot de bain, 1 balle de culottes, 1 balle de chemises, 1 balle de soutiens gorge  et 1 balle de chaussettes. 
Les balles de friperies sont achetées sur places auprès des grossistes de la place  et revendues en détail et surtout au comptant  à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Drissa Traoré is 36-year-old married and lives with his wife in large traditional extended family in Wayerma II, one of the popular neighborhoods of Sikasso (Third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Having not had the opportunity to attend school, Drissa developed an early interest for income-generating activities, particularly the retail of second-hand clothes that he has done for nearly 20 years. He learned this business from his father who was a known seller there. He is very much in demand by his customers because of the quality of his articles. In order to meet the ever-increasing demand of his customers, two years ago he decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is his third individual loan with them. All his previous loans have been fully reimbursed. With this third loan he is planning to buy second hand clothes: 1 bale of bathing suits, 1 bale of underpants, 1 bale of shirts, 1 bale of bras, 1 bale of socks. The bales of clothes are bought on the spot from wholesalers and sold retail mostly for cash to customers who are women and men. With this loan he is planning to make a monthly profit of 150, 000 Francs CFA which will be used mostly to increase his working capital, contribute to the family’s expenses and invest the rest in his business.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pour acheter de la  friperie.

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.es:
Basilisa es socia del Banco Comunal Anabella.
Basilisa es casada, tiene 52 años y 6 hijos, Basilisa viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra cereales, que luego vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad. Además junto a su esposo tienen un recreo en su casa.
Basilisa necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo, cebada, papa seca y haba.
Los sueños de Basilisa es mejorar su recreo y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Basilisa is a member of the Anabella Community Bank. She is 52 years old, married and has 6 children. Basilisa travels to different outdoor markets in the region where she buys cereals that she then sells in the wholesale markets in the city. She often takes a break with her husband at their house. Basilisa needs a loan of PEN 2500 that she will invest in the purchase of wheat, barley, potatoes and dry beans. Her dreams are to improve her time off and to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase wheat, barley, potatoes and dry beans.

loans.name: Devika

texts.en:
Devika is a 39-year-old married woman living with her husband, two children, and Devika's mother. Her husband is a mechanic and her two daughters are still studying.  Devika has a tailoring business that she has been running for three years.  She is known to be a hard worker and independent in running her business on her own.

Devika is seeking a 30,000 LKR loan from BRAC in order to buy cloth for her tailoring business.  

In the future, she hopes to give higher education to her children and to pay their tuition.

loans.use: to buy new cloth for her business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
In 2003, Erlinda joined ASHI (Ahon SA Hirap, Inc.) a microfinance institution and KIVA partner in the Philippines. As a member of ASHI for almost seven years, she has shown very good performance in her attendance at center meetings, weekly repayments, and her business still exists; therefore, she is qualified to obtain larger loans.

Erlinda runs a variety store. She wants to continue her business; it gives them a good income to support the education needs of of her grandchildren. She is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000.00 to use for additional capital to improve her business and her income. She dreams of growing her variety store into a mini-grocery store and expanding it to other villages. Her five children and grandchildren are her inspiration to continue with her variety store business. She now feels very happy with the services of ASHI and KIVA partner. It gives them a big opportunity to pursue their family dreams. She hopes that they continue the service for a long time and help many families who want to get ahead.

loans.use: To use for additional working capital to improve her business and her income.

loans.name: Yellow Group

texts.en:
O. I., age 26, is married with one son, age one and a half years. He has had a general store since 2008 and is able to earn a monthly profit of around $1166. 

This will be O.’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the loan, he hopes to increase the stock of his general store. O. will share this loan with his group, comprised of 15 other men and women from his community. They work in food sales and retail sales. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. 

In the picture, O. is first from the left, near the car, with a white cap.

loans.use: To increase his general store stock

loans.name: Aïda

texts.fr: Aïda N. est une femme de 42 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de MONTAGNE NORD2 depuis le 29 mars 2008 et a reçu 4 fois de suite de crédit qu'elle a toujours bien gérés et remboursés sans difficultés. Elle développe un petit commerce de tissus teintés et son nouveau prêt lui permettra d'en acheter 20 pièces. Elle s'approvisionne à Dakar, la capitale du Sénégal, pour revendre à chez elle à Louga en faisant du porte à porte. Son objectif est de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Aïda N. is a 42-year old lady who is married and mother to three children, who are in her care. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois in MONTAGNE NORD2 since 29th March 2008 and has had four consecutive loans, which she has always managed well and repaid without difficulty. She is developing a small business selling dyed fabric, and her new loan will allow her to buy 20 pieces of fabric. She gets her stock in Dakar, the capital of Senegal, and resells them at home in Louga on a door-to-door basis. Her aim is to contribute to the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop her small dyed fabric business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a 48 year old married lady with four children. She has been practicing dairy farming for the past twenty years. Since she joined a group in Faulu Kenya, she has been able to buy a dairy cow through her savings. She has requested for a loan of KES35,000 to repair the cow shed for her cows. She hopes to become financially stable in the future. She dreams of being the main supplier of milk and heifer breeds in the future.

loans.use: To repair the cow shed for her cows.

loans.name: Mrs. Sarin Chea Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan is made up of twelve people who live in Veal village, in Kandal province. Mrs. Sarin C. is a village bank president, selected by the other members, who will each use a portion of the loan for different purposes. She is 41 years old. She is a farmer who owns plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Choun Be, is a fisherman. Now she has a problem because her husband’s fishing supplies are too old to use. So to improve fishing, Mrs. Sarin C. is asking for a loan to buy some fishing supplies. She is a mother of four children, three of whom are attending the local public school, while the youngest one is four years old.

loans.use: To buy some fishing supplies.

loans.name: Joselita

texts.en: Joselita has owned a Brazilian clothing store for more than five years. She is well known in the Brazilian community and has a good client base. Her son speaks English very well and has helped her improve her business. He assisted her in working with ACCION USA to get a loan. This will be Joselita’s third loan with ACCION USA. Her previous two loans had an almost perfect repayment history. She qualified for her third loan to buy more inventory for the summer and refinance her previous loan. Her store mainly sells dresses, shirts, jeans, shoes and perfumes. Joselita hopes that during the summer months her sales will increase and she wants to have enough products to meet the demand. Her busiest months have always been during the summer and around the holidays. ACCION USA’s loans have helped Joselita tremendously in growing her business. Since her first loan in 2007, Joselita has consistently expanded her inventory and clientele. She has always imported most of her products directly from Brazil, which is very appealing to her customers. About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA Have you ever thought about how the cute new café on your corner or the salon you frequent every month got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated ten million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis”. Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education. Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild the economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and proviD. employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: To buy more inventory: shoes, shirts, jeans and perfumes

loans.name: Mheadel

texts.en:
Mheadel S. is from the village of Sta. Cruz. He is 19 years old. Mheadel is single. To make a living, Mheadel owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Mheadel has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Mheadel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mheadel is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mheadel from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi 1est composé de cinq femmes mariées majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles, qui ont un âge moyen de 39 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent le village de Korobougou dans la commune rurale de Sébougou dans la 4ème région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage, de parenté et de voisinage. 
Dans le but d’avoir des intrants agricoles disponibles pendant l’hivernage, elles ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle de prêt de campagne. 
Les membres du groupe vont cultiver dans l’ensemble de l’arachide, du mil et du gombo.
Madame Korotoumou  B. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 sacs de complexe céréale, 20kg de semence d’arachide, recruter la main d’œuvre pour les activités de labour et de sarclage dans ses champs. 
Elle se ravitaille en intrants à la foire de Ségou. Les activités de labour des champs sont l’œuvre des hommes alors que le désherbage est effectué par l’association des femmes du village. 
Sur une superficie de 3 hectares, Madame Korotoumou  B. espère avoir, 8 sacs de mil, 18sacs d’arachide et une trentaine de tasse de gombo. Une partie de la récolte des céréales est auto consommée tandis que le reste est vendu. 
Le bénéfice obtenu est utilisé pour prendre en charge les petits besoins du foyer en condiments et soins de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The Benkadi 1 group is made up of five married women, most of whom have large, traditional families, who are on average 39 years old and have 4 children. They live in the Korobougou village in the rural town of Sébougou in the 4th region of Ségou (4th administrative region of Mali). They know each other from their marriages, families, and neighbors. In the goal of having available farming resources during the winter, they have turned to Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first loan. The group members are going to grow peanuts, millet, and okra. Mrs. Korotoumou B. plans to use her loan to buy 3 bags of grain, 20kg of peanut seeds, and to hire labor to work and hoe in the fields. She obtains what she needs at the marketplace in Ségou. Field labor is done by men, while weeding is done by the women in the village. From a 3-acre area, Mrs. Korotoumou B. hopes to get 8 bags of millet, 18 bags of peanuts and about 30 cups of okra. A part of the crop of grains will be used, and the rest sold. The profits will be used to pay for small household needs and healthcare for the children.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, peanut seeds, and field labor

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca L. is from the village of Calamagui 1st, Ilagan. She is 64 years old. Francisca is widowed and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Francisca owns and operates a tailoring business venture in the services sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Francisca has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Francisca joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Francisca has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. Francisca is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional tailoring equipment, such as needles and thread. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Francisca from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional tailoring equipment

loans.name: Suy

texts.en:
Mr. Suy C. is 29 years of age and is a married man. In order to meet the needs of the family, Suy C. works as a metal heater. He is hired by people to heat metal for a fee. Then, the people turn the metal into housing materials. He has another financial earner in his wife who works sewing clothes in a garment factory.  He has an elderly mother (pictured) who stays at home to manage the household and take care of his two children. 

Suy C. is concerned that he doesn’t have a suitable location to use to operate his service. He has dreamt of having a workshop for a long time but he has no money to build one. This is why Suy C. decided to pursue a loan, in order to build a workshop.

loans.use: To build a workshop

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz M. is a 43-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: a general store and a hog-raising business. She lives in Banquerohan, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental.

Ma. Luz has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and hog-raising businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 30,000.

Ma. Luz is now borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 10th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.

Ma. Luz aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.


About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue in its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Bethel

texts.en:
Bethel S. is a married woman who lives in Passing trak, Barangay Marine, Cadiz City, Negros Occcidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: a general store and a business of food vending. Her husband Edson, 43 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 3 children who are between the ages of 12 to 22 years old. 

Bethel joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 6 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Bethel has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 3,500, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 7th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 which she intends to use to buy more kitchen utensils for her food vending business so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs. Bethel S. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice T.  is currently in the business of selling charcoal at home  and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Joice is 34 years old and is married to a husband who is a policeman. She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent out.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
Rita tiene 38 años, vive en la ciudad hermosa del Cusco, Perú y desde hace mucho tiempo que participa en el banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa. Rita tiene 2 hijos y se considera una madre trabajadora y emprendedora, ella es enfermera y brinda servicios de salud. Rita y su esposo tienen un negocio familiar que consiste en la venta de joyería.  
     
Rita con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de $ 400 USD, ella invertirá el dinero para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar más joyería como por ejemplo aretes, pulseras, aretes y muchas cosas más.
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Rita is 38 years old and lives in the beautiful city of Cusco, Peru.  She has been a member of Arariwa's “Patrón de San Sebastián” community bank for a long time.  Rita has 2 children and she considers herself a hard-working and enterprising mother.  She is a nurse and provides health services.  Rita and her husband have a family business where they sell jewelry.

Rita plans to use her loan for $400 USD to increase her business capital.  She would like to buy more jewelry such as earrings, bracelets, etc.

She is grateful for the opportunity which she is being offered with this loan and she pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy more jewelry such as earrings, bracelets, etc.

loans.name: Thuli Maiya

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Thuli Maiya L..  She is married and has 5 children aged 27, 22, 20, 16 and 12.  In 2003, she established  her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to purchase grocery goods for her shop.  In the future, Thuli Maiya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:  BPW Partner Page.   Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: To buy grocery store inventory

loans.name: Shabana's Group

texts.en:
Shabana resides in the city of Samundri in Pakistan. She lives in a two-room house with her family:  a husband and 3 sons.  All 3 children are enrolled in school and study in different classes. 

Shabana's husband runs a restaurant where he sells Punjabi food such as naan chanay (a chickpea dish served with bread) and biryani (a rice dish served with pickle). He has been in this business for 10 years and has a good reputation in the area for high-quality food and good business practices.  Shabana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy items such as chickpeas, rice, cooking oil and spices in bulk quantities to make tasty, high-quality food for his customers. This will help him get an edge over competitors in the area and earn more profit.
