Shabana is hopeful that an investment will take her husband’s business to a more profitable position and improve his monthly income. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has established a good credit record by paying her installments on time and by attending every meeting. 

In the photo, the woman with a book (an Asasah Passbook) is Shabana.

loans.use: To buy restaurant supplies

loans.name: Jerusha

texts.en:
Jerusha is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rented house that has electricity and piped water and her greatest monthly expenses are rent and school fees.

Jerusha has operated a shoe-making business for the past three years. She currently sells shoes wholesale, but her neighbors and passersby are also potential customers. Her major business challenge is theft. Jerusha joined Yehu to have access to loans. She is requesting 40,000 KES to purchase rubber, materials, and ornaments for making shoes. In the future, Jerusha hopes to establish a retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make shoes

loans.name: Lenin Antonio

texts.es: El señor Lenin Antonio A. Jiménez sigue elaborando correas, billeteras, monederos y bolsos de cuero en el taller que funciona en su casa ubicada en el municipio de Barranquilla.  Tiene su puesto de venta en las afueras del centro comercial Metrocentro al  sur de la ciudad. Ya canceló su anterior Credikiva con gran puntualidad gracias al cual logró aumentar sus ventas, sus utilidades y mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda en lo que se refiere a pisos, pañetes y techo. Con el actual préstamo planea comprar cuero, hilos, herrajes y accesorios. En un futuro no muy lejano piensa comprar una moderna máquina troqueladora para dejar de pagar por ese servicio y darle un mejor acabado a sus productos. Ya está ahorrando para lograr esa meta. El señor Lenin le manda un saludo muy especial a todos sus financiadores de Kiva, deseándoles que tengan un feliz año 2011, pleno de abundancia, mucha salud y prosperidad en compañía de todos sus  familiares. Que siempre continúen apoyando a personas emprendedoras que carecen de recursos económicos en muchos países pobres. Para conocer la anterior presentación del microempresario, pueden acceder a través del siguiente link:	http://www.kiva.org/lend/200668
texts.en:
Señor Lenin Antonio A. Jiménez makes leather straps, billfolds, purses and handbags in his workshop located in his house in Barranquilla.  His sales location is in the outskirts of the Metrocentro commercial center to the south of the city.  He paid off his previous Kiva loan with excellent punctuality thanks to which he was able to increase his sales and profits, and improve the condition of his home (flooring, plasterwork, and ceiling).  With this current loan he plans to purchase leather, threads, hardware, and accessories.  In the near future he hopes to buy a modern stamping machine so he no longer has to pay for this service, to give his products a better finish.  He is already saving to accomplish this goal.  

Señor Lenin sends a special greeting to all his Kiva lenders, wishing them and their families a happy new year for 2011 full of abundance, health and prosperity.  May they always continue helping enterprising people in poor countries who lack economic resources.  To learn about this microentrepreneur's previous loan, you can go to the link http://www.kiva.org/lend/200668.

loans.use: Purchase leather, thread, needles

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa A. is from the village of Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occdental. She is 52 years old, widowed and has ten adult-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Theresa owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Ma. Theresa has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Ma. Theresa joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Ma. Theresa is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Khom

texts.en: Mrs. Khom K. buys silk products from weavers in her village and then transports and sells them in other villages and districts. Her husband has full-time employment, working far away from home. The couple has two children, one son and one daughter, who both attend school. Khom has asked for a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase more silk and cotton fabrics for resale.

loans.use: to purchase silk and cotton products for resale

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
Filomena has been cooking and serving typical Peruvian dishes for about twenty years. During the summer months, January to March, she prepares food and sells it from the patio in front of her house. From April to December she rents space at a market near her house where she is able to sell her food to a larger number of customers. Every Saturday and Sunday she prepares Cebiche, a typical Peruvian dish made of fresh seafood, onion, cilantro and lime. Filomena's loan will help her purchase ingredients for her recipes and also cover the costs to rent space in the market. 

Filomena is in her mid sixties and is a loving wife, mother and grandmother. She enjoys her work but has had to take it easy the past couple of months due to a bad leg that prevents her from being on her feet all day. Now that her leg is feeling better she is getting ready for the winter months when there is a larger demand for her dishes. 

This will be Filomena's 22nd loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA.
texts.en:
Filomena has been cooking and serving typical Peruvian dishes for about twenty years. During the summer months, January to March, she prepares food and sells it from the patio in front of her house. From April to December she rents space at a market near her house where she is able to sell her food to a larger number of customers. Every Saturday and Sunday she prepares Cebiche, a typical Peruvian dish made of fresh seafood, onion, cilantro and lime. Filomena's loan will help her purchase ingredients for her recipes and also cover the costs to rent space in the market. 

Filomena is in her mid sixties and is a loving wife, mother and grandmother. She enjoys her work but has had to take it easy the past couple of months due to a bad leg that prevents her from being on her feet all day. Now that her leg is feeling better she is getting ready for the winter months when there is a larger demand for her dishes. 

This will be Filomena's 22nd loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA.

loans.use: Purchasing food and renting market space

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is a married woman who lives in Ilog, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store and a fish vending business. Her husband Alejandro, who is 50 years old, works as a fish vendor to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have nine children who are between 8 and 27 years old. Jenelyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Jenelyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her seventh loan, she is borrowing PHP 18,000 to use as funds for her business operations so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and family. Jenelyn is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: Janeling

texts.en:
Janeling M. is from the town of San Mariano, Isabela. She is 29 years old. Janeling is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business of providing general dressmaking supplies to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $113 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Janeling joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. 

Janeling is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This will be her 2nd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics and materials to resell

loans.name: Bahriniso

texts.ru: Наботова Бахринисо проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст, 42 года. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Муж, не работает, он инвалид. Сама Бахринисо имеет средне - специальное образование, продавец. Она занимается торговлей. Рядом с домом открыла продуктовый магазин. В этой области четыре года. Кредит берет для покупки холодильника. У нее имеется один холодильник, но из-за большого количества продуктов ей необходим еще один холодильник.
texts.en: Bahriniso N. lives in the region of Vahdat. She is 42 years old, married and has five children. Her husband is not working and is handicapped. Bahriniso has a specialized secondary education, she is a salesperson. She does sales and a has opened a grocery store next to her house. She has been in this business for four years. She is taking out the loan to buy a refrigerator. She has one refrigerator, but because of a large amount of food she needs one more.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Esnairah

texts.en:
Esnairah R. is from the city of Gango, Ozamiz City. She is 24 years old and single. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling mobile phone accessories in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $238 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Esnairah joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like bags and home decor for sale. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like bags and home decor to sell

loans.name: Jessica Moserrate

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Valroc. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable y trabajadora.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Jessica, tiene 21 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una hija de 3 años de edad y está embarazada de tres meses de su segundo hijo. El marido es constructor contratista.

Ella realiza el crédito para el negocio del esposo, él  se dedica a trabajar en el campo de la construcción,  realiza trabajos para Ingenieros que reciben obras del Estado, trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00, nos cuenta que trabaja con la ayuda de 10 operarios a quienes les paga un sueldo semanal, lleva tres años que se dedica a esta actividad.

Este crédito lo requiere para comprar unas carretillas y otras herramientas necesarias en sus trabajos. Está en el Banco Comunal hace tres ciclos y le gusta porque a través de los créditos ella puede contribuir en algo para el hogar.
 
Su sueño es terminar su casa que la tiene en construcción.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank named Valroc meets in the city of Rocafuerte every two weeks. This place is known for its delicious sweets prepared by the locals that are known throughout the country and for the warmth of the kind and hardworking people.

Here we meet Jessica. She is 21 years old, married common-law, she has a 3-year old daughter and she is three months pregnant with her second child. Her husband is a construction contractor.

She requests this loan for her husband's business. He works in the construction field, carrying out work for engineers who are awarded projects by the State. He works from Monday to Saturday from 8am to 6pm. He says that he works with the help of 10 workers who he pays every week. He has three years in the business. 

He requires this loan to purchase some wheelbarrows and other necessary tools for his work. She has been with her communal bank for three loan cycles and she likes it because it is through these loans that she is able to contribute something for the home. 

Her dream is to finish building her house as it is currently under construction.

loans.use: to purchase wheelbarrows and tools.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Tiessiri, sont toutes des femmes mariées et ont en moyennes 44 ans, 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Dioïla, quartier  SOCOURA-NORD, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce des parures, des condiments et des gâteaux.                                                                                                                         
Les femmes du groupe Tiessiri sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire. La cliente ROKIA K. compte acheter des bijoux (boucles d’oreilles, colliers) avec les revendeurs de la ville de Dioïla. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement sur place dans la ville au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes et quelque fois des hommes aussi.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce de bijoux.
texts.en:
The women of the Tiessiri group are all married, and on average are 44 years old with 4 children. They all live in traditional extended families in the town of Dioïla, Socoura-Nord neighborhood, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women met each other through connections with family, neighbors and friends.

The women sell jewelry, condiments and cakes. They are on their sixth group loan. Group member Rokia K. plans to buy jewelry (earrings, necklaces) from the sellers in the town of Dioïla. She sells her goods every day in the local town for cash and on credit, to customers who are mostly women but sometimes men too. Rokia expects to make an average monthly profit of 30,000 CFA francs which will be used to pay the loan installments, pay for contributions to social ceremonies and the rest will be reinvested in her jewelry business.

loans.use: to buy jewelry

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Roberto; el tiene 73 años de edad y es casado y tiene 8 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía, el socio tiene una tienda de artesanía en un lugar llamado Corao que queda a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Cusco, el socio por medio de este negocio saca adelante  a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de artesanía. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería de artesanía como chompas, chalinas, llaveros y muñecas al por mayor.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Roberto is a member of the "Caminemos Juntas" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Roberto is 73 years old, married, and has eight children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his business selling handicrafts.  Roberto has a handicraft store in a place called Corao which is 20 minutes from the city of Cusco.  Through his business, Roberto gets his children ahead in life.  He would like to expand and improve his handicrafts business.  Roberto is requesting this loan to buy handicrafts such as sweaters, scarves, keychains and dolls wholesale.

Roberto is happy to be receiving his loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts such as sweaters, scarves, keychains and dolls wholesale

loans.name: Gladiz Alexandra

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Las Exitosas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Gladiz, tiene 31 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 18  y 15  años de edad los mismos que estudian en un instituto. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella y sus esposo tienen una granja en la cual se dedican a la cría de pollos, nos cuenta que en temporadas crian hasta 200 pollos los mismos que los tienen por espacio de dos a tres meses y luego cuando están listos para la venta los entregan a comerciantes que llegan hasta su granja o también los pelan y entregan por libras a tiendas o venden por libras a los vecinos y allegados.  Tienen su granja ya por 8 años y que poco apoco la han ido mejorando con el paso del tiempo.

Este crédito es para comprar más pollos, alimentos y medicinas para que tengan un buen desarrollo. Ella ingreso en el segundo ciclo del banco comunal y le gusta por la rapidez con que reciben los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener una tienda comercial.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Las Exitosas” (The Successful Ones) meets every 15 days in the canton of Montecristi, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts that have received attention on a national and international level. This place is where the famous Panama hats are made.

It is here that one can meet Sra. Gladiz. She is 31 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children (ages 18 and 15) who are in school. Her husband is a merchant.

She and her husband have a farm where they raise chickens. They can have up to 200 chickens during a period of two to three months. When they are ready, the animals are sold to merchants who come to her farm. Gladiz also butchers the chickens and delivers them by the pound to stores or sells them to neighbors and relatives. She has managed her farm for eight years and has improved it gradually over time.

This loan will be used to buy more chickens, as well as feed and medicines so that the birds can develop properly. She joined the Communal Bank when it started its second loan cycle. Gladiz likes the speed in which she has received the loans.

Her dream is to have a commercial store.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, poultry feed, and medicines.

loans.name: Simeon

texts.en:
Simeon is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines.   He is married with seven children. 

Simeon has a food shop that sells breads and cookies.  He  had this business for 15 years.  He requested a loan 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients for homemade breads.

Simeon is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Simeon hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for homemade breads.

loans.name: Dora Clemencia

texts.es:
Dora Clemencia tiene 43 años, es soltera vive con sus hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 5  hijos Jaime de 20 años, Guillo de 19 años, Carla de 17 años, Lorena de 15 años y Darlin de 9 años.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. VALLE ALTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Voluntad de Dios en el Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra maíz y arroz.


 Dora se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol, Compra sus productos en el Comercial Peña y vende sus productos en el mercado mayorista de ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para mejorar su producción  y suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es seguir adelante con su actividad economía para ayudar a sus hijos en su educación.

Le gusta pasar más tiempo con mis hijos.
texts.en:
Dora Clemencia is 43 years old, single and living with her children in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  She has five children: Jaime, 20, Guillo, 19, Carla, 17, Lorena, 15, and Darlin, 9.

The members of the “Valle Alto” (High Valley) communal bank are located in Voluntad de Dios, Ventanas Canton.  This communal bank is dedicated to short cycle corn and rice farming.

Dora is a corn, rice and broad bean farmer.  She buys her supplies in Comercial Peña and sells at the Ventanas wholesale market.

 She is requesting the loan for her corn and rice crops; she will buy supplies and fertilizer for them.  Support from the loan will help her economically to improve production and meet her needs.  Her dream is to continue with her economic activity to help her children with their education.

She enjoys spending more time with her children.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and fertilizer for the crops.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en: Iman is a 33-year-old mom who is also sales manager at one of the Jordanian companies. In her free time after work, she makes baskets from straw as a hobby. Using her experience in sales, she started a year ago selling cosmetics products at home, which gave her the curiosity to learn more about skin cleansing,  Now Iman has applied for this loan to buy specialized equipment for skin and facial cleansing to move on with this business.

loans.use: To buy facial and skin cleansing equipment

loans.name: Sokhun

texts.en:
Sokhun is a cake seller with $7 per day in income. She is a single mother with two children; one is a student and the other is a car repairman; his income is $3 per day. 

Every month, she has to spend $70 on food, $10 electricity, $30 on school fees, and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy a motorbike for her son to use to travel to work in Phnom Penh. In the future, she plans to sell grocery goods in front of her house to make more income.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son to use to travel to work.

loans.name: Yeilyn Maria

texts.es:
Yeilyn es una señora de 22 años de edad el cual vive con su esposo e hijos, en una comunidad llamada Osa, localizada en Caña Blancal esto en la provincia de Puntarenas. Está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona rural muy visitada por sus playas. Sus principales actividades económicas son las turísticas y agropecuarias.

Dice que tener el apoyo y la ayuda de su esposo le facilita seguir con el proyecto. Además dice que el proyecto le es muy interesante ya que ha visto como poco a poco su negocio crece y la demanda cada vez es más fuerte y que los vecinos de la comunidad se han sentido satisfechos con el servicio brindado.

Lo que en estos momentos solicita Yeilyn es un micro crédito de ¢600,000(seiscientos mil colones), para comprar de pollos y su alimentación, y para dar el mejor mantenimiento y asistencia posible a su proyecto.

Doña Yeilyn es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Caña Blancal, una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Con este préstamo se espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Yeilyn, age 22, lives with her husband and children in a community called Osa, which is in Caña Blanca in the Puntarenas province.  This community is known for being a rural zone that is much visited for its beaches.  Its primary economic activities are tourism and farming.

She says that having the support and help of her husband facilitates continuing with the project.  She also says the project is very interesting to her because she has seen how, little by little, her business grows and there is greater demand.  The neighbors in her community are satisfied with the service she provides.

Yeilin is now requesting a loan for ¢600,000 (six hundred thousand colones) to buy chicken and feed for them.  This is to give them better sustenance and all the help possible for her project.

She is a member of the "Caña Blancal" communal bank, which is one of the 110 organizations belonging to EDESA in Costa Rica.  She hopes to achieve personal and economic progress with this loan.  She also points out that it is thanks to these organizations that facilitate loans that she is able to spend more time on productive business activities.

loans.use: to buy chicken and feed.

loans.name: Jemma

texts.en:
Jemma lives in the Shirak region of Armenia, in the village of Shirakavan.  She is the proud mother of three sons (eleven, seventeen and eighteen years old).  Together with her husband she has been working on the family farm for eighteen years.  She dreams of having all three of her sons receive a university education.  

Jemma is a hardworking person and has become an experienced farmer.  She is grateful for the services of microfinance, especially that the loan disbursements are efficiently organized.  She is looking for a loan to purchase seeds for autumn planting.  This loan will increase her investment in the family farm by thirty percent and produce additional income of fifteen percent.  The conditions for agriculture are favorable in Shirakavan.  Farming is the main source of income for the villagers.

loans.use: to purchase seeds

loans.name: Angel

texts.es: El señor Ángel es empleado en la federación de municipios de Bolivia; trabaja como coordinador de autonomías. El crédito lo requiere para pagar un diplomado en derecho administrativo, pues es muy importante para el trabajo que actualmente realiza. Vive en  alquiler en una casa la misma queda  ubicada en la zona de Cota Cota de la ciudad de La Paz, es soltero  y no tiene hijos.
texts.en: Ángel is employed by the Bolivian Federation of Municipalities; he works as an Autonomous Regions Coordinator.  He needs the loan to pay for an advanced course in Administrative Law because it’s very important for the work he’s currently doing.  He lives in a rented house located in the city of La Paz’s Cota Cota zone.  He’s single and has no children.

loans.use: to pay for an advanced course in Administrative Law.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children.
 
Marciana runs a retail shop that sells fruits & vegetables and has been in business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy fruits & vegetables to sell.

Marciana is a new member of HSPFI.  She hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits & vegetables for sell

loans.name: Adeline Michelle

texts.fr:
Cliente de 31 ans, mariée avec 2 enfants a sa charge, elle se lance dans le commerce de la friperie en 2007 a l'arrêt de ses etudes pour subvenir a ses besoins.
Elle achète des ballots de friperie de sacs et des chaussures  pour enfants en cuir qu'elle fait nettoyer et vend en détail au marche.
Elle a déjà bénéficie de plusieurs cycles de prêts, et ces prêts lui ont permit d'accroitre son commerce, ses ventes ont largement augmentes, elle a en moyenne 25.000 a 75.000 fr par jour, surtout qu'a la période de la rentrée scolaire les chaussures et sacs sont bien achetés par les parents d'élèves.

Elle a plusieurs stratégies pour faire face a la concurrence ; elle choisit les meilleurs produits ,elle a des prix abordables pour attirer sa clientèle.

Dans l'avenir, elle veut ouvrir une boutique pour vendre les articles en cuir .
texts.en:
This client is 31 years old, married, and has two children in her care.  She started selling second-hand goods in 2007 when she stopped her studies in order to support herself.

The borrower buys bundles of second-hand bags and leather children's shoes which she cleans up and sells retail in the market.  She has already been through several loan cycles and the loans have enabled her to grow her business.  Her sales have greatly increased and she makes, on average, 25,000 to 75,000 francs a day, especially during the back-to-school season when she sells a lot of shoes and bags to parents of school children.

The borrower has several strategies for dealing with the competition: she chooses the best products and she charges reasonable prices in order to attract customers.  In the future, she would like to open a store in which to sell leather goods.

loans.use: to buy bundles of second-hand bags and shoes

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys lives in Uganda, is married and has one child.  She also takes care of additional family members.  

Gladys sells clothes and has been in business for three years.  She works six days a week, from home.

Gladys has requested a loan of 100,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of used clothes.  

Her main business challenges include seasonality and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations are to start selling on a wholesale basis and to build rental rooms.   

Gladys lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding her family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ghayath

texts.en:
Ghayath is a 24-year-old single man, working in construction since six years ago. Ghayath is a builder who is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy necessary wood requested for future projects.

Ghayath is a man with a good reputation; he is a hardworking man who puts all his efforts toward improving his business to a more developed one.

Ghayath hopes to open a big construction company in the future to deal with all construction procedures, with a big number of employees to reply faster to customers’ needs.

loans.use: To buy necessary wood.

loans.name: Gricelda María

texts.es:
La Señora. Gricelda es socia del banco comunal Buscando el Éxito, vive por un sector muy reconocido de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta  ciudad es encantadora por su mezcla entre lo colonial y lo moderno, su variedad en su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños, su gente es muy cálida y amable, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Gricelda tiene 52 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 30, 29 y 15 años de edad, su primer hijo es casado e independiente, su segundo hijo trabaja solo para sus gastos personales y su ultima hija estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como agente vendedor, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando. 

La Señora. Gricelda labora en la venta de confites que ella misma fabrica, especialmente el maní de dulce, lleva dos años en el negocio y trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.
 
Este es su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de azúcar y maní para la fabricación de su producto.
 
Su meta es de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Gricelda’s a member of the “Buscando el Éxito” (Seeking Success) communal bank.  She lives in a very well-known sector of the city of Cuenca.  This city is charming because of its mix of colonial and modern, its varied cuisine that captivates the palates of locals and foreigners alike, its warm and kind residents that maintain the culture and traditions of its peoples.

Gricelda is 52 years old, married and has three children who are 30, 29 and 15 years of age.  Her oldest son is married and independent; her second works just to cover his personal expenses and her youngest daughter goes to a local secondary school in the city.  Her husband works as a sales agent.  She does not own her house; she is a renter.

Gricelda works selling snacks that she prepares herself, especially caramel-coated peanuts.  She’s been in business two years and works Sunday to Sunday with no fixed schedule.

This is her second loan with the communal bank and she will use it to buy sugar and peanuts to make her product.  Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy sugar and peanuts.

loans.name: Abram Heriberto

texts.es:
Habram, de 42 años de edad, habita en San Juan de Santo Cristo una comunidad ubicada en León, tiene 4 hijos  de 22,18,14 y 12 años de edad todos están estudiando pues el considera que es una de sus prioridades darle estudios a sus hijos ya que solo logro terminar la primaria y no quiere que sus hijos sean personas analfabetas. Don Habram es comerciante y  agricultor. Comenzó aprendiendo todo acerca de  la agricultura y posteriormente se dedico a la crianza de cerdos con esta actividad lleva dos años, pro sin dejar atrás sus oficios de la agricultura pues también vende verduras tales como la yuca, el vende de manera ambulante sus verduras y su esposa además de ayudarlo con las tareas del hogar lo ayuda con la crianza de los cerdos on estas dos actividades es que el mantiene a toda su familia. 
El solicita el préstamo para comprar cerdos para criar y venderlos, el vio conveniente  invertir  en la crianza de  cerdos, el esta capacitándose en técnicas adecuadas de crianza que le permita mejorar su trabajo así lograr tener cerdos grandes y de buen peso características que es muy buscado en el mercado. Su meta próxima es tener 4 cerdos parideras para aumentar la producción y mejorar el corral de crianza de sus animales. Pero su principal prioridad es sacar a sus hijos adelante.
texts.en:
Abram is 42 years old and lives in San Juan de Santo Cristo, a community in León.  He has four children who are 22, 18, 14 and 12 years old.  They are all studying as Abram considers one of his priorities to be to provide his children with an education as he himself only managed to finish his primary education and he doesn't want his children to be illiterate.

Abram is a salesman and a farmer.  He started off learning everything there was to know about farming and then later started raising pigs.  He has been in the pig raising business for two years but hasn't neglected his farming work.  He sells vegetables, such as cassava, as an itinerant vendor.  His wife helps him with the household chores and also helps him raise the pigs.  These two businesses are how he supports his whole family.

Abram is requesting a loan to buy pigs to raise and sell.  He would like to invest in his pig raising business.  He is training himself in pig raising techniques which will enable him to improve his work and raise large pigs of a good weight.  This is what the market is most looking for.  Abram's next goal is to have four farrowing pigs so that he can increase his production and improve his animal pen.  However, his main priority is to get his children ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is married with 3 children. Jessica is 38 years old and lives in Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental.

Jessica sells a variety of snacks to earn a living and has had this business for two years. She has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase flour, sugar, milk, bananas and other ingredients for her snack-vending business. Jessica has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. 

In the future, Jessica hopes to have more savings for additional capitalization for her other future business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like a sack flour, sugar, milk, and bananas for her snack-vending business

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Felna

texts.en:
Felna is 39 years old and married with eight children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more goods like snack foods, detergents and other groceries to sell.

Felna has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 4 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Felna aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more goods like snack food, detergent and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married with two children. She sells small home products such as tea pots, table lights, batteries for clocks, etc. Her business has three locations in a small open market near a factory. The factory workers can buy what they need after work. Since Irina sells inexpensive items, she has clients nearly all the time. Irina has many repeat clients, and a wise discount policy. 

Irina would like to borrow 15,000 Ukrainian hryvnia (UAH) to purchase new inventory for her business. Irina has used micro loans in the past and considers them very helpful for her business development.

loans.use: to purchase new inventory.

loans.name: Hamrojon

texts.ru: Хамрочон женщина в возрасте 54 лет , мать двоих детей. Мужа нет в живых. Сама Хамрочон проживает в дальнем районе Джамоата Утконсой. В основном жители данного района занимаются откормом и продажей скота. Её сын сейчас на заработках в России, поэтому Хамрочон живёт вместе с невесткой . На получаемый кредит она собирается купить одну корову и корм для неё, откормив зимой планирует продать подороже и на полученный доход улучшить социальное положение семьи.
texts.en: Hamrojon is 54 year-old woman and a mother of two children.  Her husband has passed away.  Hamrojon lives in the remote Jamoat Utkansoi.  The residents of this district are mainly involved in fattening up and selling livestock.  Hamrojon's son is currently working in Russia, and this is why she lives with her daughter-in-law.  She plans to use this loan to purchase one cow and fodder for it, fatten it up over the winter, sell it at a higher price, and use the resulting profit to improve the family's social standing.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and fodder

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sugar, cooking oil, rice, and maize flour.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
This is 33 year-old Richard. He is single and has no children but he has a dependent who lives with him and serves as a sales assistant.  

In 2010, Richard established his leather slippers business. He began his business because he learned it through apprenticeship, and that is his source of livelihood. 

Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about SLL 750,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Richard requires a loan in order to buy 100 leather slippers @ SLL 40,000. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 4,000,000. 

In the future, Richard plans to increase his stock level, marry a productive wife and to build a house. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy 100 leather slippers @ Le 40,000

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es: La señora Matilde vive en Entre ríos, Cochabamba en una casa alquilada, al igual que muchos de los habitantes de la zona ella migro de Chuquisaca, buscando un mejor futuro y por ello desde entonces trabajo de todo lo que pudo, en principio como empleada, como ayudante y otras labores en las cuales se desempeñó muy bien, con el paso del tiempo comenzó a ahorrar dinero y comprar su propio lote agrícola donde actualmente trabaja dedicándose a la producción agrícola de la cual genera buenos ingresos para poder mantenerse, esta actividad demanda cada vez más esfuerzo porque los suelos se desgastaron con el paso del tiempo. Ahora solicita un crédito para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de yuca, así seguira mejorando su producción y los rendimientos de su cultivo.
texts.en:
Sra. Matilde lives in a rented house in Entre Ríos, Cochabamba. Like many local inhabitants, she came from Chuquisaca seeking in a better life. Since then she has had many different jobs mainly as a maid or an assistant, jobs that she did well. 

As time passed, Matilde started to save money. She bought land where she now earns her living from agriculture. It brings in good money but she has to work very hard to maintain the land which has become degraded over the years. She is now seeking a loan so she can care for the land and continue improving production and yield from her fields.

loans.use: Mantenimiento de su cultivo de yuca, para mejorar su producción

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Kiva lenders! Meet Josephine, one of the most hardworking women on earth. She is 41 years of age, very hardworking and a go-getter. She is a proud mother of five lovely children. She hails from Ikonge, a remote village in the Nyamira area of Kenya. This area has harsh weather conditions, and to survive you must have tough skin, but Josephine has defied all the odds and has been engaged in farming for the past twenty years. Her primary sources of income are maize, vegetables, and animal farming.

Josephine passionately loves farming and has even nicknamed one of her cows “Maritati.” Whenever she is milking her cow, she feels proud. She is contented with the farming way of life.

Her biggest challenge in farming is irrigating her farm. She is requesting a loan to buy a water tank and water pipes that she will use in pumping water from the river to her farm. Irrigation is used to assist in the growing of agricultural crops, the maintenance of landscapes, and the re-vegetation of disturbed soils in dry areas, as well as during periods of inadequate rainfall.

Through this loan, she will be able to double her crop production, and this will translate to more income. Through the extra income from farming, she will be able to support her family and keep up with her rising family expenses. Josephine patiently waits for your kindness

loans.use: to buy a water tank and water pipes.

loans.name: Sima Tiflis Gizi

texts.en:
She is 38. Her family’s living condition is not good enough. The family income is rather limited. She is an internally displaced person (IDP). Since 2003 Sima has been engaged in cattle breeding to improve her family’s living condition. She started her business with a cow. As she didn\'t have enough financial resources, she couldn\'t develop her business well enough in the beginning.

Having borrowed 3 loans of $400-$600-$600 from Komak Credit Union in 2003-2005 Sima significantly expanded her business, bought a lot of cows and calves, achieved progress in her business and increased her family income. The loans were paid back timely. Sima is requesting this loan to buy new cows and calves.

loans.use: To buy new cows and calves

loans.name: Salomen Sirri

texts.en:
Salomen is mother of ten children. Assisting her husband in the provision of fees, medication, clothing, and food for their family is her motivation. Having received training in marketing techniques, management, group dynamics, and basic health organized by GHAPE, she believes that she will succeed, especially as her husband who is also a member of GHAPE is supportive. She used her previous loan to provide lunch especially to bachelors in their community.

Given a loan of $300, she plans to increase her stock by buying koki-beans and palm oil, as well as seeds to start cultivating food crops. She wants to maximize the unsold manure from her husband’s piggery. Her immediate goal is to continue providing lunch to busy people and those who don’t know how to prepare koki-beans (bean paste, rich in protein). Her children will eat any leftovers as part of their dinner.

She plans to repay her loan in 18 months. The first installment repayment shall be on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of loan.

loans.use: Selling prepared food and cultivation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Juliah would like to purchase seedlings, planting seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia C. de Lozano is 70 years old, and lives in Ayacucho, Peru. She owns a small corner shop next to her home, and sells “bebidas,” or drinks, such as soda pop, beer, and bottled water. She established her business 27 years ago, to supplement her husband’s income. Her clients consist of people in her neighborhood, who know her as a reliable source for their beverages.

While she runs a successful business now, life has not been easy for Celia. She and her husband had 11 children, 3 of whom died. Furthermore, 21 years ago, her husband abandoned her for another woman, and Celia had to support her 8 remaining children by herself.

Celia´s first loan was for US $50, which she paid back $5 a week. This small amount allowed her to expand her product line, and now, in addition to drinks, she is able to sell candles for church service on Fridays and Sundays. She says that saving money informally in her house is very difficult, but in her Village Bank, Celia has established a savings account where she feels her money is safe. She plans on using her next loan to purchase another type of soda to add to her inventory.

loans.use: Celia plans on using her next loan to purchase another type of soda to add to her inventory.

loans.name: Zacarias

texts.pt:
Zacarias Chiláuleis married. He is 54 years old and father of 8 children. He has a small store in his home in the neighborhood of Magoanine in Maputo. He raises and sells chicken. He joined the program in November 2006, and requested loan of 3.00mt. He is now in the 3rd cycle of the credit program and is requesting a loan of 8.000mt to be repaid in 6 months. Zacarias has noticed an improvement in the business since he joined the program. He used to be able to raise 400 chicks, now he can raise 1500. He also improved his home with the income.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Zacarias Chiláule vive maritalmente, tem 54 anos de idade e é pai de 8 filhos. Tem o seu negócio e residência no Bairro de Magoanine em Maputo. Cria francos e vende a grosso e a retalho. Está no programa desde Novembro de 2006 e tomou como 1º empréstimo 3.000MT. Vai agora para o terceiro ciclo e vai tomar de empréstimo 8.000MT para pagar em 6 meses. Nota-se um crescimento em termos de negócio e na sua vida pessoal: quando entrou para o programa conseguia criar de cada vez 400 Pintos e agora consegue trabalhar com 1500 ;comprou alguns bens para a sua casa e ampliou a mesma com os lucros do negócio.

loans.use: Improve his business of raising and sellking chicken

loans.name: Leonor Magdalena

texts.en:
Leonor (Leo) runs a store where you can find pretty much anything. She sells new CDs and DVDs, as well as secondhand clothes, shoes, accessories, toys, and more. If a store that sells new products has certain items that cannot be sold due to stains or other slight damages, they bring them to Leo. She then fixes the flaw to where the item is good as new and sells it in her store.

Leo’s husband is a security guard at night and drives a taxi during the day. They have three children, ages 16, 13, and 10. Her dream for them is that they graduate high school and have careers. Her dream for her business is to relocate to a less dusty location, but this would be more expensive. With this loan Leo’s goal is to purchase Christmas toys now, before the prices rise too much in December and they become unattainable.

loans.use: purchase Christmas toys now, before the prices rise too much in December

loans.name: Fary Antony Muñoz

texts.en:
Fary runs a ‘colmado´, a general store where people can buy foodstuffs such as rice, beans, spaghetti, vegetable oil, and other goods. She has been operating the business for four years. Fary is twenty-five years old, and she and her husband have two sons, ages 2 and 6. The elder attends school.

Fary explains that before, her store was very small, but she was able to enlarge it with the last loan she took from FSMA about six months ago. Now, the store is more spacious and people can purchase their necessities more comfortably. Fary is requesting a new loan to purchase big quantities of many goods that she runs low on in her store. The entrepreneur says that in the long run, she would like to buy the locale where she operates the store, since it´s a rented one and not hers.

loans.use: to replenish inventory that is running low in her grocery store

loans.name: Maximiliana's Group

texts.en:
Maximiliana, Lizbeth, and Irene have been part of the community bank “Prosperidad” for the last year. They commented that in their community bank they have learned to be responsible, punctual, to save, and to sand in solidarity.  They feel that the lessons have taught them haw to positively view them selves, their families, their role in society, and their role as business people.  
Maximiliana is 34 years old and has three children who are still students.  She has a stand where she sells grains in the Nery Garcia market in Ayacucho.  On the weekends she travels to different markets around the region to buy more grain.  She uses a van which she owns to transport grain.
Lizbeth is 26 years old and lives with her partner.  She has owned a business selling office supplies out of her garage for one year.  She also sells delicious cakes, and pastries.
Irene is 32 years old and has two small children.  She has had a business selling vegetables in the town of Chiara for two years.  She also raises guinea pigs, which are considered a delicacy in Peru.  
Maximiliana and Irene need loans of 300, and 200 dollars respectively, which they will invest in buying grains typical of the region such as habas, quinua, and cebada.  They will also buy vegetables and cages for the guinea pigs.  Lizbeth has requested a loan of 200 dollars which she will invest in a paper cutter, tools to bind paper, and other office supplies.
Maximiliana plans to use her savings to buy a motorcycle taxi so that her son can work.  Lizbeth is saving to buy a color printer and a laptop computer.  In contrast Irene would like to buy a piece of land in the future.  Maximiliana and Irene dream of buying big modern cars, that their children can finish school, building their own houses, and opening a grocery store.  Lizbeth dreams of having a big office supply store and eventually a soda fountain.

loans.use: Maximiliana and Irene need loans of 300, and 200 dollars respectively, which they will invest in buying grains typical of the region such as habas, quinua, and cebada.  They will also buy vegetables and cages for the guinea pigs.  Lizbeth has requested a loan of 200 dollars which she will invest in a paper cutter, tools to bind paper, and other office supplies.

loans.name: Msinune

texts.en:
Msinune A., age 32, is married with 1 child (10 years old). Msinune owns a small café, which she started 6 years ago. Working from 7am-6pm daily, she earns about $40 a month from this business.

Msinune now hopes for a loan to buy food items. Msinune belongs to the loan group called Ushindi, whose members ensure one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy food stock

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 30 years old and is a married woman with one child, age 7 years old. Grace owns a small salon, which she started in 2005. Every day, she works from 6am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $75 from her sales.

In the past, Grace has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her salon.

loans.name: Nasma

texts.en:
Nasma is 25 years old and is a single woman. Nasma owns a small food vendor store and is a cloth seller (Khanga), which she started in 2006. Everyday, she works from 7am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

In the past, Nasma has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Alejandrina Leila

texts.en:
Alejandrina Leila O. M. has a general store in the town of Carabamba high in the sierras of La Libertad Region. Alejandrina has over 20 years of experience working in retail. Her parents also owed a general store. Her store is located right in the middle of town and is well stocked so she has plenty of loyal customers.

Alejandrina is 34 years old, married, and has 3 children. She enjoys being able to work from home where she can also take care of her children. Her husband is very supportive and they work well together.

A member of the community bank Alpha y Omega, Alejandrina is requesting a loan of s/600 to repay over 4 months. Alejandrina will use the loan to restock her store with all her best selling goods such as oil, sugar, corn, beer, and soda.

loans.use: Alejandrina will use the loan to restock her store with all her best selling goods such as oil, sugar, corn, beer, and soda.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther J. is 49 years old and married with 5 children. She lives in the Sabo – Ajamgbadi area at Ojo, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells fruit including pineapples and cherries. She has been in this business  for the past 20 years. Esther needs a of loan of $425 to buy more fruit in bulk, which will enable her to satisfy her customers. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more fruit for sale

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr:
Komla G. is 30 years old, single, with no children. He drives a motorcycle taxi in Assahoun, a village located about 50 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this loan, he wants to buy a new motorcycle to improve his business. The profit from his business will allow him to satisfy his own needs as well as those of his younger brothers.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Komla G. est âgé de 30 ans, célibataire sans enfants. Il est conducteur de taxi moto à Assahoun, un village situé à environ 50 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il désire par ce crédit acheter une nouvelle moto pour mieux exercer son activité. Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de satisfaire ses propres besoins et ceux de ses petits frères

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua O. is a fishmonger. She is married, but her husband's income is not sufficient for Efua and her 4 children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.
She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Mayassa

texts.en:
Mayassa is 46 years old. She is married with 1 child 15 years old. She has been a charcoal seller since 2005. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Mayassa now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Emin

texts.en:
Emin was born in 1979. He is married and has two children. He lives in Baku city. 

He has been in this clothing sales business for two years. Now he needs a loan of $1,200 to buy more clothes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Mrs. Pech Thorn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan group which is located in Veal Thom Village in Kandal Province consists of fifteen people and they plan to use the loan which they have obtained for different purposes. 

Mrs. Pech T. is the village bank president who has been selected from the members. She is a village chef’s assistant as well as a farmer. She now faces a small problem because her field is infertile and this is having a bad effect on her crop.  Therefore she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides to support her field to make her crop more productive.

One member in this village bank has end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. This member is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides to support her field to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Saeed

texts.en:
Saeed is a 43 year old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their four children. Saeed has worked as a taxi driver since 1995. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase an engine for his taxi. This is the second time that he requested a loan; he has always paid on schedule. 
Saeed is known for his good relationship with his clients. His clients are his friends, neighbors and tourists. His future plan is to change his car, improve his financial situation and expand his business.

loans.use: Saeed needs the loan to purchase an engine for his car

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Sáu năm nay 43 tuổi, chị đang sống cùng chồng và 1 con tại xã Hưng Yên huyện Hưng Nguyên Tỉnh Nghệ An. Năm 2003 chị Sáu tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn dể đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Hiện nay công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị là từ  kinh doanh hàng ăn và buôn bán thịt lợn vơí mức thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn cho công việc kinh doanh thịt lợn và đầu tư vào cửa hàng ăn của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi S. is 43 years old. She lives with her husband and child in the village of Hung Yen at Nguyen Tinh district, in the town of Nghe An. She joined TYM Fund in 2003 to borrow fund for livestock raising. Her current income, which mainly comes from selling food and pork, totals at 4,000,000 VND per month. Mrs. Nguyen would like to borrow 10,000,000 VND to invest in her pork selling business and in her family's eatery.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Mariam W. from Mwanza. She is married with two children, 7 and 11 years old. Mariam has been running a poultry ("kuku") business. Raising "kuku" is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst our borrowers. Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. Firstly, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two and either add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiply naturally! Secondly, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Thirdly, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein.

Mariam has been in this business since 2000 and her business is doing well. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 7 days per week, and is assisted by one employee. Mariam W. currently earns about US$ 250 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of US$ 400 in order to continue with her poultry business. Mariam thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy 200 chicks

loans.name: Flaviano

texts.en:
Flaviano G. is a "nipa" maker, that is, a woven roof which is composed of a very light material from the "nipa" plant. "Nipa" in the Philippines is used to roof houses; it is an an aquatic plant and is popular in the country. Flaviano has 3 children, 2 boys and a girl. He was previously working as a carpenter. Now, he focuses more on his business, which is nipa-roof manufacturing.

He is requesting a loan from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy more nipa materials for making roofs. He is also willing to do another line of business to augment their family income.

"I am thankful because I am part of CEVI's program. Now, I have easy access to their credit assistance and training services. I am also covered by their insurance package since I joined CEVI," he said.

loans.use: To buy more nipa (plant) materials to prepare for roofing

loans.name: Kubra Ghulam Jailani Group

texts.en:
Kubra baji is a 37-year-old married lady and a citizen of a city called Borewala, Pakistan for the past 20 years. Her husband's name is G. J. and he is a cobbler. Kubra baji is the mother of four kids: three sons and one daughter. Her first two sons are involved in a carpet-weaving business. The others are getting education from a school located near their house.

Kubra baji is a very supportive lady. She helps her husband in making shoes. She is applying for a loan to buy leather to make more shoes and earn a profit.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Nasreen Kosar baji wants a loan to buy material (colored thread and sketches) for her carpet-weaving business. Salma baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Razia baji wants a loan to buy warm clothes to sell. Sakina baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy leather to make shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To raise poultry

loans.name: Zeynal

texts.en:
Zeynal A.'s main source of income is his calves which he fattens and sells to the local bazaar traders. He also has a job as department chief in the local post office. Zeynal has been involved in livestock breeding since an early age when he had no other job and his family needed the money. He is 39 years old and lives with his wife and 3 children in Sabirabad city. 

Zeynal has applied for a loan to purchase more calves and enlarge his business. He is the only breadwinner in his family and he believes that it is very important to provide his children with an excellent education. We believe in Zeynal's clear vision for the future.

loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria es socia del Banco Comunal Renacer.
Candelaria es casada, tiene 53 años y 4 hijos, Candelaria tiene cabinas de Internet en su casa, brinda servicios de fotocopiado, también vende golosinas, bebidas. Además por las noches Candelaria vende salchipapas.
Candelaria necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de golosinas, gaseosas, papa y aceite.
Los sueños de Candelaria son ampliar su negocio y construir el segundo piso de su casa.
texts.en:
Candelaria is a member of Village Bank Renacer. Candelaria is married, 53 years old and has four kids. Candelaria has Internet booths in her house, she provides photocopying services, also selling candy and drinks. Furthermore, at night Candelaria sells sliced fried sausage and french fries (salchipapas). Candelaria needs a loan of 1500 soles that will be invested in the purchase of candy, soda, potato, and oil. Candelaria's dream is to expand her business and build a second floor on her home.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase candy, soda, potato and oil.

loans.name: Farajika Group

texts.en:
Asha has been a food-seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for two years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $95. Every day she works at her business for eight hours.

Asha is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more meat and other food items for her business. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Asha is 31 years old, married, and has five children: ages 14, 10, 9, 3 and 2.

Asha will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Khadija, who has her own small business selling clothes and shoes in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more meat and other food items for her business

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna es socia del Banco Comunal Obreras.
Reyna es soltera, tiene 32 años y 1 hijo, Reyna tiene una Bodega en un local alquilado en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su hijo, además Reyna tiene una casa donde alquila cuartos, Reyna tiene proyectado construir con material noble su casa y trasladar su tienda a su casa.
Reyna necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas, arroz y azúcar.
Reyna sueña con construir de material noble su casa y tener una tienda mas amplia.
texts.en:
Reyna is a member of Communal Bank Obreras. She is 32 years old, single, with one son. She has a shop in a rented location where she sells groceries, vegetables and meat every day with the help of her son. She also rents out rooms in her house. She plans to build a cement block home and move her business to her house. She needs a loan of 1000 soles to purchase soft drinks, rice and sugar. She dreams of building a cement block house and having a larger store.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of soft drinks, rice and sugar

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro B. is 41 years old. He is married and has two children. He is a resident of Barangay Cataggaman Viejo of Tuguegarao City. He manages a tricycle transport business to support his family. Their place is near market amenities, thus Pedro chose a transport route to and from their place to the city market.

He is asking for a loan from Kiva amounting to 15,000 Philippine pesos for the maintenance of his motorcycle used in transporting passengers. Pedro can be described as a friendly type of person who works hard to give his family a better living situation. He has been in this business for five years and is still hoping to expand into some other kind of business, such vending, to further support the growing needs of his family.

loans.use: Motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Inn

texts.en: Inn Y. is a married woman, 47 years old, who lives in the province of Siem Reap, in Cambodia. Here, she and her husband have been establishing their own small family and working as fishermen. This couple usually sells the fish that they catch in and around Tunle Sap Lake, and typically generate around $5 of income a day to contribute to feeding their six children, who are school-aged students. Two of their children work with them in fishing activities, which helps reduce the amount of hard physical labor. Inn Y. will be using her loan money to buy additional equipment for the purpose of fishing.

loans.use: To buy additional equipment for the purpose of fishing

loans.name: Rona Group

texts.en:
Rona is the group leader of Rona group. There are two members in this group and they have requested a group loan of 20,000 Afghani.

Rona wants to take a loan for her husband’s mobile-selling business. He wants to make his shop larger.

Hafeza wants to take a loan for her son’s general store business.

They both thank AFSG and all Kiva lenders for helping the poor people in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To enlarge her husband’s mobile-selling shop

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
Amalia es socia del Banco Comunal Prosperidad.
Amalia es soltera, tiene 35 años y 3 hijos, Amalia tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, además realiza papa seca en su casa, producto que vende a los intermediarios, Amalia también vende repuestos de carro que reparte a los talleres.
Amalia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Amalia son educar a sus hijos y tener una tienda en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Amalia is a member of the Community Bank 'Prosperidad' (Prosperity).

Amalia is 35 years old and single, and she has 3 kids. She has a store in her house where she sells general groceries as well as making 'papa seca' in her house (a tradition Peruvian dish made of dried potato) which she sells to intermediaries. Amalia also sells car parts to workshops.

Amalia needs a loan of 1000 soles, money which will be invested in buying rice and sugar.

Amalia dreams of educating her kids and having a store in the centre of the city.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar/Para  la compra de arroz y azúcar.

loans.name: Wanglei A Amia Juliet Group

texts.en: A. Juliet is forty-two years old, married with five children and taking care of three dependents that one dependent is schooling. She sells fish so far twenty years while in her business. She is using the loan to purchase fish in much more volume for sale. With the loan she is hoping to improve upon her business. She is a hardworking business woman whose dream is to obtain a goat for keeping and purchase a bicycle which may help her while in transporting fish from source to markets.

loans.use: To purchase fish in much more volume for sale.

loans.name: Enhtsetseg

texts.en:
Enhtsetseg L. is a widow with three daughters in ages ranging from 13 to 18. She currently lives in Arhangai province  with her three daughters and her younger brother. Enhtsetseg has a small retail business in various products including clothes and food products. She has been in the retail business since 2004 and her business has been her sole source of income to feed her family. She rents two stalls at the local market and retails cheap women and men's clothes imported from China as well as dairy products including cheese, milk, butter, and meat including mutton and beef. She mostly purchases these animal products from local herders at wholesale prices and retails them at the local market for profit. She keeps herself busy with selling two different kinds of products everyday and she says that she is working hard to support her family alone. 
Enhtsetseg requests a loan to purchase more clothes and dairy products for her retail business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and dairy products

loans.name: Mouena

texts.en:
Mouena C. is a 23 years-year-old woman living in the town of Fagalii B.  She is married and has 1 child infant-aged children.  To make a living, Mouena owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Mouena has been engaged in this business for over 7 years and earns approximately $600 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Mouena joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Mouena has successfully repaid a previous loan of $1000 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase harvesting equipment.  Mouena is now requesting a new loan of $1500 WST which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Mouena plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Estrellas De Belen Group

texts.es: En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer, “Panamericana” se encuentra la Asociación Comunal “Estrellas de Belén”, con 11 integrantes, están juntas hace aproximadamente 4 años, una de las integrantes es Lidia Alí de 19 años, soltera, esta será su primera experiencia en el grupo y esta muy emocionada ya que siempre ha deseado hacer crecer su negocio, ella  costura  deportivos para varón y necesita el préstamo para comprar tela, acomoda sus productos en la ciudad de La Paz, calle Isaac Tamayo, los días lunes, miércoles, sábado y domingo, de 5 a 8 de la mañana. Las demás integrantes también tienen sus propios negocios como la venta muebles, juguetes, pan, chuño (papa deshidratada) y ropa. Todas necesitan el préstamo para invertir en sus negocios comprando mercadería y materia prima.
texts.en:
In one of the regional offices of Pro Mujer, "Panamerica", is the Community Association "Stars of Bethlehem", with 11 members. They have been together for approximately 4 years. One of the members is Lidia A., who is 19 years old and single. This will be her first experience in the group and she is very excited because she has always wanted to grow her business. She sews men's sportswear and needs a loan to buy fabric. She displays her products in the city La Paz, on the street Isaac Tamayo, on Monday, Wednesday, Saturday, and Sunday from 5 to 8 in the morning. The other members also have their own businesses, such as selling furniture, toys, bread, potato flour (dehydrated potato), and clothing. All the members need the loan to invest in their businesses by buying merchandise and raw materials.

Translated from Spanish by Elycia Mulholland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and raw materials

loans.name: Nanci

texts.es:
Nanci es una carismática mujer de 39 años, vive con su esposo, Jorge, que tiene 41 años y con sus dos pequeños hijos; Nicole de 13 y Jorge de 8 años. Ella vive con su familia en la casa de su padre y también con una de sus hermanas. 

Desde hace 3 se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de una marca reconocida a nivel mundial, este negocio le ha permitido crecer económicamente, a tal punto que ya piensa en tener un bazar donde pueda vender estos productos de belleza y alternarlo con la venta de otro tipo de artículos. 
Nanci tiene ganas de salir adelante y para eso se esfuerza a diario para ayudar en los gastos del hogar a su esposo y también le alcanza para comprarse sus gustos. Es por eso que el negocio le parece muy rentable, ya que no requiere de mucho esfuerzo, además la empresa para la que  trabaja le ofrece incentivos como electrodomésticos y productos para el hogar, y por esta razón  se siente muy feliz, doblemente motivada para continuar en el negocio. 
Para el futuro tiene planes de crecer y aumentar su stock de mercadería, además también incursionará en el alquiler de disfraces, ya que por el lugar donde vive no hay competencia y ser ha dado cuenta que hay bastante demanda.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y se siente muy comprometida con este crédito, ya que según sus expectativas será el primero de varios, porque tiene ganas de salir adelante. Con el dinero que solicita piensa comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería en cosméticos y también ropa de niños para comercializarla entres sus amistades y vecinos.
texts.en:
Nanci is a charismatic 39 year old woman. She lives with her husband, Jorge, who is 41, and their two small children. Nicole is 13 and Jorge is 8. She lives with her family and one of her sisters in her father’s house. For three years she has been selling a brand of cosmetics that is known on a worldwide level. This business has allowed her to grow economically to such a degree that she is now thinking of having a bazaar. She would be able to sell her beauty products as well as other types of articles in the bazaar. Nanci has the desire to get ahead.
