In order to do so, she puts forth great effort everyday to help her husband with the household expenses. She is also able to buy some niceties. The business is very profitable, and does not now require as much effort. Also, the company she works for offers incentives like domestic appliances and products for the home. That is the reason she feels very happy and doubly motivated to continue with the business. In the future, she has plans to grow and increase her stock of merchandise. She also wants to explore renting out costumes. There is no competition where she lives, and she has realized that there is enough of a demand. This is her first loan with MFP. She feels very committed with this loan. According to her expectations, this will be the first of many because she has the desire to get ahead. She will use the money she is asking for to buy a larger quantity of cosmetics and children’s clothes to sell to her friends and neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Usman

texts.en: Usman is a commercial tailor; additionally, he sells colorful sarongs and has a video and DVD rental stall. Thanks to these businesses combined, he hopes to be able to meet his family's basic needs. He is 40 years old and married with 2 children. His wife has a grocery stall that she uses to also improve the family's finances. Usman is requesting a loan of 80,000 NGN so that he can purchase more sarongs, videos and DVDs. This is the high season for business and he hopes to make more of a profit. He says thank you in advance to all of the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing more sarongs, videos and DVDs

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 33-year-old married man and father of 2 children who are unemployed. He has owned a farming supplies and an accesories shop since 2004 to make a good income for his family. Today, Hussein is requesting to borrow US$ 1,000 to purchase additional equipment and tools to develop his business productivity

loans.use: purchase additional equipment and tools

loans.name: Zhanny Nuve

texts.es:
Zhanny Zuñay de 43 años, tiene una casa de cemento con la que cuenta con agua, luz, alcantarillado y caminos pavimentados es uno de los pocos sectores que tiene esta facilidades esta ubicada en la zona Perimetral de Guayaquil, Zhanny empezó con esfuerzo y dedicación con su negocio hace 6 años atrás, cuando escogió poner un bazar en su casa para pasar tiempo con sus 2 hijas.

Zhanny trabaja desde las 08h00 hasta las 21h00 en la cual su hija de 13 años le ayuda a atender el negocio, Zhanny comprar helados a $ 0.30 y los vende a $ 0.50 c/u, cuadernos a $0.70 y los vende $ 1.20 c/u y confites a $ 0.10 y los vende a $ 0.15, aunque una de las dificultades mas importantes es cuando se enferma aunque es muy rara la vez aun así sigue adelante, su esposo le ayuda con los gastos de la familia siendo vendedor ambulante de helados pero aun así su situación económica no es estable ya que su hija de 4 años no estudia y su hija de 13 años estudia en un colegio particular y esta becada.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar $300.00 en helados y $200.00 en confites para surtirlo mas, su meta en un futuro es agrandar su negocio y así poder arreglar su vivienda que aun le falta enlucir y hacer el cerramiento también poder ver que su hija se gradúe del Colegio.
texts.en:
Zhanny Zuñay, 43, has a house made of concrete in one of the few areas in the outskirts of Guayaquil that has running water, electricity, drainage, and paved streets. Six years ago she decided to set up a store in her home so that she could have time to spend with her two daughters. She works from 8am until 9pm; her 13-year-old daughter helps her with the store. Zhanny buys frozen treats at $0.30 and she sells them at $0.50 each; notebooks at $0.70 and sells them at $1.20 each and sweets at $0.10 that she sells at $0.15. One of her obstacles is when she gets sick, although this is rare, she has to go on. Her husband helps with household expenses; he's an ice-cream peddler, but even so her economic situation is unstable. Her 4-year-old isn't in school yet and her 13-year-old is in private school, but on scholarship. With the funding she wants to buy $300 worth of frozen treats and $200 worth of sweets. Her goal for the future is to enlarge her business so that she can improve her house, which still needs lighting and fencing. She would also like to see her daughter graduate from secondary school.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Frozen treats and sweets.

loans.name: Sokhatile

texts.fr:
Madame Sokhatile D. est une femme de 71 ans qui vit dans le quartier de Mbenguene dans la localité de Yoff. Elle est veuve, mère de 2 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 30 et 40 ans mais ayant en charge 4 autres personnes. Elle a une expérience de plus de 50 ans dans son activité  commerciale. Elle est spécialisée dans la vente de couscous. Beaucoup de gens du quartier viennent s’approvisionner auprès d’elle en couscous hebdomadairement. Elle vend aussi des beignets, des oranges des bonbons assez diversifies. Son ambition de début d’activité était d’aider sa mère qui n’avait aucune assistance. Ce qui l’intéresse le plus dans son activité  c’est la réalisation de bénéfices qui l’aident a satisfaire ses besoins actuels et futurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs pour augmenter son fond de roulement. Une partie du financement est prévue pour l’achat de produits destines a renforcer son stock, mais l’autre partie va servir a renforcer sa réserve  en vue de faire face aux dépenses urgentes ou imprévues.
Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les populations  a exercer des  activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique   apprécié.
texts.en:
Mrs Sokhatile D., aged 71, lives in the neighborhood of Mbenguene in the town of Yoff. She is a widow and the mother of two children aged 30 and 40. She provides for four additional persons. She has over 50 years' experience in her trade activity. She specializes in the sale of couscous. Many locals come each week to her and buy couscous. She sells also donuts, oranges and candy of various kinds. In the beginning her ambition was to help her mother who had no other support. Nowadays, Sokhatile is above all interested in the profit she makes in her business, which enable her to pay for her current and future needs.

Sokhatile applies for a loan of 100,000 CFA francs to increase her working capital. She will use part of her loan to stock up on various products and part of it to bolster her cash reserve to be able to meet her urgent or unexpected needs.

Always looking to actively participate in the fight against poverty, U-IMCEC – with the positive support of lenders – succeeds in supporting people in revenue-generating activities which promote valuable socioeconomic development.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan M. is currently in the business of designing bedsheets and sewing pairs of trousers to sell and is requesting a loan to stock more materials to design and sell. Juan is 36 years old and is married to a husband who is a driver. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent out.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock more materials to design and  sell

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes I. is from the village of Calaran, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Mercedes is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Mercedes owns and operates a service-based business, providing manicure and pedicure services in the local community. Mercedes has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $75 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Mercedes joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Mercedes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide her services. Mercedes is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more needed materials. This will be her 2nd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide her services

loans.name: Reine

texts.fr: F. Reine est née le 16 Septembre 1967 au quartier Gbowèlè à Allada, dans le département de l’Atlantique, où elle vit depuis sa naissance. Mariée à HOUNGNIBO Anatole, un imprimeur, Reine est mère de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés. Reine a un autre enfant à sa charge. Reine vit seule avec ses enfants à Gbowèlè. Mais le couple assure ensemble les charges familiales. Reine a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Depuis 20 ans environs, Reine vend des chaussures et divers autres produits (savons, bougies, conserves de tomates et de sardine, sachets, lait, pâtes alimentaires, couscous, etc.) à Allada. C’est à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, que Reine s’approvisionne. Reine a bénéficié déjà de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a tous bien remboursés. Reine voudrait augmenter le stock de ses produits et accroître sa clientèle, ce qui lui permettra de se faire plus de revenu. C’est pourquoi Reine sollicite un troisième crédit de ALIDé. Reine ambitionne plus tard acquérir une parcelle.
texts.en:
Reine F. was born September 16, 1967 in the Gbowélé area of Allada, in the Department of the Atlantic, where she has lived ever since. Married to Anatole HOUNGNIBO, a printer, Reine is the mother of five children, all having had schooling. She has another child under her care. Reine lives alone with her children in Gbowélé, but she shares family expenses with her husband. Reine interrupted school at the secondary level. For the past twenty years, Reine has sold shoes and other products (soap, candles, canned tomatoes and sardines, water pouches, milk, pasta, couscous, etc.) in Allada. She resupplies in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Reine has already been granted two loans from ALIDé, which she duly reimbursed. She would like to increase her stock supply and her number of customers, to generate more revenue. For this reason she is requesting a third loan from ALIDé. Her ambition is to eventually buy a plot of land.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 20 dozen pairs of shoes and various food products 'canned tomatoes and sardines, milk, pasta)

loans.name: Genaro

texts.es:
Genaro, tiene 65 años, es casado y tiene cinco hijos. Genero se dedica a la agricultura siembra papas, cebolla, maíz y cebolla de china. Genero actualmente vive solo en su domicilio su esposa y sus hijos viven en la ciudad de Lima, Genero se levanta muy temprano para hacer sus actividades del hogar como cortar leña,  cocinar,  limpiar la casa y dar de comer a los animales. Genero requiere el préstamo para comprar leña y ganado.   
 
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

(La ciudad de Pucyura es distrito de la ciudad de Anta del Departamento del Cusco, Pucyura se encuentra ubicada a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Cusco).
texts.en:
Genaro, 65, is married and has five children. Genaro lives by himself; his wife and children live in Lima. Genaro farms potatoes, onion, corn and scallions. He rises very early in the morning to do his household chores like, chopping firewood, cooking, cleaning his house and feeding his animals. Genaro needs funds to buy firewood and cattle. He is grateful for the opportunity he has been given through this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion. (The city of Pucyura is a district of the city of Anta in Cusco department; Pucyura is 40 minutes from Cusco)

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood and cattle.

loans.name: Neoun

texts.en:
Neoun L., age 30, is married and resides with her children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has four children. She is engaged in a business of selling fruit, earning an income of USD 4 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband who is employed to look after motorbikes at a tourist place in the town, earning an income of USD 4 per day. 

Their standard of living has improved since L. and her husband have had these businesses. L. is requesting a loan of 600 USD to purchase more fruit for sale and wood to repair their house. This is her third loan from CREDIT, Kiva's partner. (L. is pictured cooking lunch with her husband.)

loans.use: buy more fruit to sell and wood to repair their house

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer is a 30-year-old single lady who owns a pharmacy in Kibera slums. She also sells mobile phone accessories to earn extra income. Besides that, she rents out sewing machines to get more income.

Jenifer was previously employed before she saw the need of having her own business. Her business, which has been running for five years, has really expanded since she joined Faulu Kenya. She uses her income to pay wages to her employee and to improve her living standards. She hopes to open up her own clinic in the future.

Jenifer is a hardworking lady who is determined to see her business grow into a wholesale operation. She has requested a loan of Kes 40,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy anti-malarial tablets, antibiotics and syrups to stock her pharmacy.

loans.use: To buy anti-malarial drugs, antibiotics and syrups

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four people who live in Peam Sala village in the Kandal province. They will use the loan for different purposes in order to improve their business conditions in the current year. 

Mrs. Thy Y. is the group leader who has been selected by these members. She is a farmer who owns 0.85-hectare of land and cultivate rices to support her family. In her rice field, she has a problem because it is time to cultivate, but she did not have enough money to support it. Thus, Mrs. Thy Y. decided to apply for a loan to farm in this current year. 

Her husband, Mr. Srey Sreng, helps taxi drivers find some customers. She has three children, two of whom are seamstresses in the garment factory while the other is six months old.

loans.use: For her farm

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is a 27 year old married man. He has one child. He has been working as a home painter since 2006. Therefore, Mouhamad has 4 years of work experience in this field. When he first started his business, he received the support and encouragement of his family. He works on a freelance basis, working at the request of his clients. Mouhamad works hard to satisfy the demands of his job, in order to pay his daily expenses and provide a better life for his family. 

His previous loans allowed him to purchase new and better tools to improve his work. For the third time, he is requesting a loan to purchase paint tools. For the future, he plans to keep on improving his work, as well as his financial situation.

loans.use: To purchase paint tools.

loans.name: Simon Bolivar Group

texts.es:
Este Banco de Emprendimiento esta Compuesto por 8 Integrantes, todos viven en la misma zona del km 14 en los siguientes barrios Simon Bolivar, Balcon 1, Barrio la Floresta  en la gran mayoria de los integrantes trabajan en el area de comercio como ser venta de productos de primera necesidad, albañil, bombera en pigas, cajera, peluquera y fotocopiadora, transporte, punto viva, trabajan en la zona del km 14 ,centro 1er anillo,santa cruz,urubo condominio las palmas. 

La Presidenta es la Sra. Veronica, casada ella tiene una tiendita d ebarrio donde vende productos de primera nenecidad, el dinero del credito lo utilizaran en la compra de productos para surtir su tienda, ella es muy trabajadora, responsable, por su solidaridad con sus compañeras fue elegida presidenta del banco de emprendimiento, esta casada y su esposo se dedica al transporte urbano, los dos trabajan para salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida de toda su familia. 

Todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras ya que este banco es nuevo pero tienen el deseo de ser el mejor banco y llegar a obtener el mayor monto que otorga emprender los socios estan muy agradecidos por haber confiado en ellos ,
texts.en:
This Banco de Emprendimiento is composed of 8 members, all of whom reside within the vicinity of 14 kilometers in the following neighborhoods, Simon Bolivar, Balcon 1, and Barrio la Floresta. The majority of the members work in the commercial sector, such as a vendor of basic necessities, construction worker, firewoman, cashier, hairdresser, fotocopier, transport, and communications. They work in the area of 14 km, center 1er anillo, of Santa Cruz in the Urubo Condominiums Las Palmas. The President is Ms. Veronica. She is married and has a small store in the neighborhood that sells basic products. She plans to use the money from the loan to purchase more merchandise with which to stock her shop. She is very hardworking and responsible. She was elected president for her solidarity with her colleagues. She is married and has a husband that works in urban transport. Both of them work with the hope of moving ahead and providing a better quality of life for themselves and their family. All of the members are responsible and dedicated and while this bank is new, they have a great desire to be the best bank and achieve the largest amount of credit possible. The members are very grateful for the confidence that has been bestowed upon them.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is 24 years old. He is married and has no children. He is a hardworking farmer from Nyamira town in Western Kenya.

Evans has been practising mixed farming for 5 years. His products are maize, beans and bananas which he sells to the local market. He also operates a shop in the same area. 

His biggest challenges in farming are the limited market for his products, limited land for expansion and lack of farm implements and fertilizers.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 45,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This loan will enable him to purchase a quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk for sale. The extra income from this loan will help improve the family's living standards.

In the future, he plans to purchase additional land to expand his farming activities.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria es casada y tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 4 estudian, Gregoria tiene un puesto en el mercado Las Nazarenas en donde vende jugos que ella prepara, actividad que realiza todos los días desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 11 dela mañana, Gregoria también tiene otro puesto en donde vende frutas surtidas. Gregoria y su esposo tienen equipos de sonido que alquilan para diferentes compromisos y eventos.
Gregoria es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio y solicita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de licuadora y extractor para mejorar la calidad de sus productos.
Los sueños de Gregoria son construir su casa de material noble, porque tiene una casa de material rustico y que su hija sea una cantante profesional.
texts.en:
Gregoria is married and has five children, four of whom are students. She has a stall in Las Nazarenas market where she sells homemade juices from 6am to 11am every morning. She also has another stall where she sells different sorts of fruit. Gregoria and her husband also own sound equipment which they rent out for celebrations and events. She is a member of the Lirio Community Bank and is seeking a loan of 2,000 soles to buy a blender and a juice extractor to improve the quality of her products. Her dream is to build a house made of decent material (her current one is a rudimentary structure), and see her daughter become a professional singer.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a blender and a juice extractor

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo V. is from the village of Burgos. He is 42 years old. Danilo is married. To make a living, Danilo owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Danilo has been engaged in his business for over 12 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP whenever he sells his raised animal.

In 2010, Danilo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Danilo is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and then sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Danilo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and then sell

loans.name: Samaria

texts.en: Samaria P. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at home, and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. Samaria is 31 years old and is married to a husband who is a peasant. She has 2 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a motor bike for hire.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Idalia Del Carmen

texts.es: Idalia del Carmen R. D. D. D. 44 años D. edad, vive junto a sus tres hijos, D. 20, 17 y 11 años D. edad, D. los cuales el mayor se dedica a trabajar, y quien se ha convertido en el gran apoyo D. Idalia, para poder contar con una vida mejor, ya que durante años ella ha trabajado muy duro por sacar adelante a sus tres hijos, debido a que ella es madre soltera, la cual no había poseído ningún tipo D. ayuda. Idalia trabaja comercializando pollos D. engorD., los cuales cría en su casa D. habitación, y que posteriormente venD. en su puesto el cual se encuentra ubicado en el mercado Municipal D. Usulután, mismo departamento en el cual resiD. junto a su familia. D. esta manera ella se encarga D. alimentarlos y darles todo el cuidado necesario para que los pollos crezcan sanos y gordos, D. manera que sean bastante atractivos para las personas que los compran. Idalia solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. pollos pequeños, así mismo para comprar concentrado, el cual es el nombre del alimento para pollos, y D. esta forma poder contar con todo lo necesario para hacer que su negocio prospere y siga siendo rentable para ella y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Idalia del Carmen R. D. D. is 44. She lives with her 3 children, ages 20, 17 and 11. The oldest works and is a great help to Idalia, helping them to have a better life. She has worked very hard for years to get her children ahead, since she is a single mother who has not had any sort of help. Idalia works selling fattened chickens which she raises in her home. She sells them in her stall in the Usulutan Municipal Market; this is the same municipality in which she and her children live. Through this work, she is able to get food and proviD. all the necessary care for her chickens to grow up healthy and fat, so that they are very attractive for her customers. Idalia is requesting a loan through which she will be able to purchase more small chickens, and concentrate to feed them. This way she will be able to have everything necessary to make her business prosper and continue to be profitable for her and her children.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: I Made Wirya

texts.en: I Made Wirya is a 53-year-old man living in the town of Melaya - Bali. He is married and has two grown-up children. To make a living, I Made Wirya raises cattle for sale. I Made Wirya has been in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 875,000 Indonesian rupiah (IDR) a month. His favorite part of the job is feeding the cows because it makes him feel at peace. I Made Wirya also owns a chili garden in North Bali. In 2010, I Made Wirya joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. I Made Wirya is requesting his first loan from MUK. He is requesting a loan of 10,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. I Made Wirya plans to use additional revenue to improve and expand his business. About MUK The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans, thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives. I Made Wirya 0 (0) merupakan 53 tahun pria. Dia (laki-laki) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali. Dia (laki-laki) menikah dan memiliki 2 anak usia dewasa. Untuk membiayai hidup, I Made Wirya memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak sapi untuk dijual. I Made Wirya sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 8 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, I Made Wirya menghasilkan sekitar 875,000 IDR sebulan. Dalam 2010, I Made Wirya bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. I Made Wirya telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya dari MUK. Dia (laki-laki) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 10,000,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli pakan ternak & pasokan lain. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK. I Made Wirya berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk meningkatkan/memperluas bisnis peminjam. Tentang MUK: Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari. Pesan untuk Peminjam Kiva: Grup ini memakai model pinjaman komunitas/""community lending"" (biasanya dijuluk Bank Desa/""Village Banking"") yang populer di Asia. Di model ini, sejumlah representatif dari grup akan meminjam uang sejumlah lebih besar untuk seluruh grup (kadang-kadang seluruh desa). Representatif ini akan distribusi dan mengendalikan pinjaman, dan mengkoleksi pembayaran untuk peminjam akhir. Ini adalah praktek umum dan efisien di daerah ini, tapi merumitkan cara lapor untuk Kiva. Tidak serupa pinjaman lain, partner Kiva, MUK, akan menjadi kontak utama dengan tim kepemimpinan grup, yang sebaliknya menjadi kontak dengan peminjam akhir. Demikian, jurnal yang ditulis akan merefleksikan hasilnya tim kepemimpinan, bukannya peminjam-peminjam akhir. Untuk belajari lebih banyak tentang Village Banking di Wikipedia, mohon kunjungi website ini: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Village_Banking.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier tiene 40 años, vive al lado de su esposa y su hijo en una casa arrendada. Desde hace varios meses se dedica a la venta de  animales menores como pollos y patos, que previos son comprados al por mayor en granjas de prestigio, por lo que luego son vendidos en restaurantes y en ferias ganaderas. Asimismo trabaja como chofer de taxi, actividad que lo realiza durante la semana, mientras que la venta de animales, lo realiza los fines de semana. En ocasiones su esposa la apoya en este negocio, ya que le es muy rentable pero requiere de mucha dedicación y esfuerzo. Procura siempre que los animales que adquiere estén bien alimentados para así venderlos a un buen precio, es por esta razón que desea en el futuro tener su propia granja de aves donde pueda tener gran cantidad de animales. 

Es su sexto crédito con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que conocen de su persona que es responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de calaminas ya que empezará con la construcción de su granja.
texts.en:
Javier is 40 years old and lives with his wife and son in a rented house. For several months he has sold small animals like chickens and ducks, which he purchases wholesale from large farms to resell to restaurants and at livestock shows. He also works as a taxi driver during the week and sells the animals on the weekends. His wife occasionally helps him with this business since it is very profitable, but it requires great dedication and effort. He always tries to acquire well-fed animals so he can sell them for a good price; it is for this reason that he wants in the future to have his own poultry farm where he can have a large number of animals. This is Javier's sixth loan with MFP. He is very happy to know that he has financial support since they know he is responsible with his payments. He is also grateful to be part of his communal bank because all its members are people he knows, and they are responsible and very close-knit. He thanks all the people who have made this loan possible, and it will be very useful to him in his business' growth. With the loan he is requesting, he will invest in the purchase of corrugated metal sheets since he will begin construction on his farm.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for construction on his poultry farm

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel, de 64 años, es una madre de familia con mucho vigor, es viuda, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su hija y su yerno. El negocio al que se dedica, es el de una tienda y una de las más concurridas de su barrio, además la amabilidad y el buen trato que ofrece a sus clientes, han hecho que sea la preferida por sus vecinos. Es así que desde muy temprano atiende a sus asiduos compradores, en donde disfruta mucho de la compañía y la comunicación con ellos. Lleva más 17 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer de pie todo el día, porque sufre con problemas de varices en los pies. Por ello, tiene a su hija, quien la apoya en el trabajo, así evita realizar mucho esfuerzo. En adelante, espera ampliar las instalaciones de su tienda, para tener más productos que vender.  Este es su 15avo crédito con MFP, sabe además que este préstamo le será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su trabajo. Asimismo es líder en su grupo comunal y le gusta poner en orden las reuniones. Con el crédito que solicita, espera comprarse más mercadería en comestibles, de esa manera incrementará  su stock de productos.
texts.en: Isabel, aged 64, is a very energetic widowed mother, living in a house she owns with her daughter and her son-in-law. She engages in retail: she runs one of the busiest shops of her neighborhood, and she has become her neighbors’ favorite thanks to her kindness and the pleasant manners she uses when tending to them. And so she starts tending to her regular customers very early in the morning, and she very much enjoys their company and their conversation. She has been engaging in this activity for more than 17 years, and to her the most difficult part is to keep standing all day long, as she suffers from varicose veins in her feet. For this reason her daughter helps her in the shop, so that she avoids making too many efforts. In the future she hopes to widen her shop’s space in order to have more products to sell. This is her 15th loan with MFP, and she already knows this loan will be very useful for the development of her activity. She is also the leader of her communal bank, and she likes organizing and leading the meetings. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more edible products, in order to augment her stock.

loans.use: To buy more edible products to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Rizan

texts.en:
Rizan M. is from the village of Santiago, Gingoog City. He is 22 years old. Rizan is widowed and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Rizan owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorela or multi-purpose tricycle services to local community members. Rizan has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rizan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rizan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed for the maintenance of the motorela. Rizan is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tools and other materials needed for the maintenance of the motorela. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Rizan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided.

loans.name: Edith Damaris

texts.es: La Sra. Edith actualmente se desempeña como enfermera en el Centro de Salud de dicha localidad donde tiene tres años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel para la compra de ladrillos, cemento y arena con el fin de mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en: Mrs Edith currently works as a nurse in the town's health center.  She has been working there for three years.  This is her first loan from Ceprodel and she will use it to buy bricks, cement and sand in order to improve her home.

loans.use: To buy bricks, cement and sand

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Mariam N. M. is a 38-year-old retail shop owner in Jomvu, Mombasa. She is married to Patrick Kimathi who contributes to the family’s total income. Together they are blessed with three children. She has run a retail shop for the last year, and she says that business has been good so far.

Mariam joined KADET LTD just the other day. She has applied for her first loan which she would like to use to purchase more stocks of cereals, cooking oil and fats. She hopes to use the anticipated profits from her shop to boost her embroidery business as a secondary source of income.

She hopes to succeed in life.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of cereals, cooking oil and fats

loans.name: Olerai Ole

texts.en:
Olerai has been rearing animals to sell for the last six years in Naivasha town. He is 33 years old, married to Tomoini Olerai and has two children.
He was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy five cows and fifteen sheep, which he will rear and sell later at a profit.
In the future, Olerai hopes to buy land from where he will practise zero grazing and also build his family home.

loans.use: To buy five cows and fifteen sheep

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. 

She has operated a business of selling tablecloths for the past 10 years, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. Elizabeth faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the month of January to May the demand for tablecloths is low while during festive season the demand for table cloths is very high. She hopes to be a wholesale supplier of tablecloths in the future. 

With the Kshs 10,000, she wants to purchase 10 pieces of tablecloths for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase 10 pieces of  tablecloths for resale.

loans.name: Carlos Vinicio

texts.es:
Carlos Vinicio L. R. tiene 30 años de edad, Es casado, vive con la esposa  y con los hijos  en  el  Cantón de Ventanas  Provincia los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto campo alegre, por la parroquia guare perteneciente al cantón baba, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.  Esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Carlos Vinicio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en el Comercial Cepeda y Comercial Chicaisa y vende los  productos en el Comercial López.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un carro y una desgranadora.

Le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en: Carlos Vinicio L. R. is 30 and married. He lives with his wife and children in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios Province. He has 3 children. The V.R.C. SAN JACINTO is located in the Campo Alegre district, in the Guare Parish belonging to the Baba Canton. This region is dedicated to short-cycle agricultural labour; the sowing of corn and rice. They spend much time doing this work. Carlos Vinicio works in agriculture, sowing corn and rice. He buys his products in the Cepeda and Chicaisa Markets and sells them in the Lopez Market. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of agricultural inputs and fertilizers for the cultivation of corn and rice. The support of this loan will help him economically to supply his needs. He confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. His dream is to buy a car and a sheller. He enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: agricultural inputs and fertilizers

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo L. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin Province. He is 41 years old. Romeo is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Romeo runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods, detergents and toothpaste in the local community. Romeo has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Romeo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Romeo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

This time, Romeo decided to lower the amount of his loan from 11,000 PHP to 5,000 PHP because it will be easier for him to pay back. This new loan will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Romeo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma P. is from the village of Poblacion, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old, married and has 1 school-aged child. Gemma  works in someone else's store, selling health and medicinal products in the local community. Gemma  has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Gemma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma  has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. Gemma  is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Gemma  from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Reyes

texts.es:
Reyes es un padre de familia de 40 años de edad. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa y cuatro hijos en el caserío Vallecito. Se ubica en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Desde hace 15 años, se dedica al cultivo y comercialización de cereales, maíz y limón. El cuenta con un terreno de cultivo en donde suele sembrar estos productos. Vende sus productos a los comerciantes que visitan la zona. Reyes cuenta con una clientela ya establecida. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad se encarga del sostenimiento de la economía de su familia. 

Reyes desea sembrar más maíz amarillo y mantener el cultivo de limón. Para poder asegurarse una buena producción de su cultivo, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1600 nuevos soles.

Reyes es un hombre bastante trabajadoro y entregado a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir adelantando la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Reyes is a 40 years old father living in his own house in Vallecito with his wife and four children.  It’s located in Tambogrande district, a farming zone located in Piura district over four hours away from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital.

For the last 15 years he has farmed and sold cereals, corn and lemons.  He has a field where he tends to plant these crops.  He sells his products to merchants that visit the zone.  Reyes has an established customer base.  Income from this activity is used to support his family.

Reyes wants to plant more yellow corn and care for his lemon crops.  To assure a good harvest, he has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1600 new sol loan.

Reyes is quite a hard working man who’s devoted to his family.  His greatest wish is to continue improving his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To plant more corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza P. is from the village of Sta.Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old. Annaliza is married and has one infant child.

To make a living, Annaliza makes and sells food and soft drinks to the local community. Annaliza has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 2,100 PHP a month.

In 2011, Annaliza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Annaliza is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase ingredients for rice cakes to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Annaliza from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for rice cakes to sell

loans.name: Debora

texts.en: Debora is currently in a business of selling bread. She is 21 years old, married, has one child, and goes not to school. Debora took a loan to stock more bread to sell. She hopes to build a concrete house with the extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more bread to sell

loans.name: Déborah

texts.fr: Mariée à un transporteur, Déborah a 05 enfants et est âgée de 38ans. Elle réside à Kélégougan (un quartier situé environ  à une dizaine de km de la ville de Lomé).  Elle est dans la vente de mais il ya de cela 9ans. Elle fait son approvisionnement au marché de l’intérieur et revend dans sa maison  à Kélégougan. Elle a des ambitions : avoir un magasin pour mieux vendre, faire d’autres activités, assurer un avenir meilleur à ses enfants, aider en partie son mari et s’épanouir. Elle demande ce prêt pour acheter plus de céréales  et des pagnes pour vendre afin d’avoir plus de bénéfices pour réaliser son rêve.
texts.en:
Deborah is 38 years old. She has five children, and she is married to a transporter. She lives in Kélégougan, a neighborhood located about 10 km from the city of Lomé. 

She started selling maize 9 years ago. She stocks up at the inland market and conducts her sales from her home in Kélégougan. She wants to have a store in order to increase her sales, launch other activities, provide her children with a better future, help her husband, and flourish. 

She is seeking this loan to purchase more grain as well as pagnes (printed cloth), which will increase her profits and help her to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy maize and pagnes

loans.name: I Wayan

texts.en:
I Wayan S., 38 years old, is married and has two children. He works as a pig farmer earning 1,300,000 Indonesian rupiah (IDR) every three months. He raises pigs for pork rolls that are sold after being kept for three months. He applied for a loan of 1,500,000 IDR to buy super quality pig food, because this time he already has 10 pigs. I Wayan S. plans to save his profit to be used for the future of his children.

I Wayan S. lives with his wife and two children. Both of his children are still attending school. He spends 25,000 IDR for the cost of the kitchen every day. This is his first loan with MUK.

loans.use: to buy super quality pig food.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa B. sells provisions in Amoanda near Elmina. She is a single parent taking care of four children. She is responsible for feeding, clothing and educating the children and paying household expenses. 

Her loan will be used to buy Milo (beverage powder), milk, soaps and other provisions to meet the needs of her customers. She hopes to plow back any increased profits into her business for further growth.

loans.use: to buy Milo (beverage powder), milk, soaps and other provisions to meet the needs of her customers.

loans.name: Norberto

texts.es:
Norberto tiene 35 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos en el distrito de Tambogrande  en una comunidad rural con deseos de superación. 

La actividad a la que se dedica Norberto es la venta de productos de primera necesidad: avena, fideos, arroz, aceite, azúcar, leche, café, sal, etc. Esta actividad la realiza en su propio domicilio. Adicionalmente, Norberto se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino y aves de corral los cuales cría y engorda para luego comercializarlos en el mercado local. Su esposa lo apoya en las actividades que realiza y  existe una buena relación familiar. 

Norberto solicita a Edpyme Alternativa  un crédito de 2000  nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio y  la compra de alimentos balanceados para el engorde de sus ovinos y aves de corral que podrá vender a un mejor precio.

Norberto es una persona trabajadora y honrada con muchos deseos de darle lo mejor a su familia y superarse.
texts.en:
Norberto tiene 35 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos en el distrito de Tambogrande  en una comunidad rural con deseos de superación. 

La actividad a la que se dedica Norberto es la venta de productos de primera necesidad: avena, fideos, arroz, aceite, azúcar, leche, café, sal, etc. Esta actividad la realiza en su propio domicilio. Adicionalmente, Norberto se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino y aves de corral los cuales cría y engorda para luego comercializarlos en el mercado local. Su esposa lo apoya en las actividades que realiza y  existe una buena relación familiar. 

Norberto solicita a Edpyme Alternativa  un crédito de 2000  nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio y  la compra de alimentos balanceados para el engorde de sus ovinos y aves de corral que podrá vender a un mejor precio.

Norberto es una persona trabajadora y honrada con muchos deseos de darle lo mejor a su familia y superarse.

loans.use: Comprar mercadería para negocio y compra de alimento para animales.

loans.name: Maira Maribel

texts.es:
La Señora. Maira es socia del banco comunal Medio Ejido, vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es hermosa tanto por su estructura colonial como natural, cuenta con una variada  gastronomía, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones.
 
La Señora Maira tiene 38 años, es casada y tiene 1 hijo de 4 años de edad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo un camión, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 

Doña Maira labora en un pequeño restaurante que es de su propiedad, tiene este negocio hace dos años y medio, trabaja de lunes a sábados.

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su cuarto crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres y vajilla para su negocio.
 
Su sueño es de comprarse una casa y un vehiculo.
texts.en:
Maira is a member of the Medio Ejido community bank and lives on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca.  This city is beautiful both for its colonial architecture and its natural environment.  It has a wide-ranging cuisine and its people maintain their culture and traditions.

Maira is 38 years old, married, and has one child who is 4 years old.  Her husband is a driver by profession and he drives a truck.  They don't own their own home but rent instead.

Maira works in a small restaurant that she owns.  She has owned this business for two and a half years and works in it from Monday to Saturday.

This is Maira's fourth loan through her community bank and she will invest it in buying food products and crockery for her business.

Maira's dream is to buy a house and a vehicle.

loans.use: to buy food products and crockery

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 37 years old and has been running his animal sales business for the last 15 years with a monthly income of KES 10,000.

Servicing his fifth loan of KES 50,000 from KADET he plans to purchase dairy cows and other farm inputs for his farm. This will help him boost his earnings. The proceeds will be used in developing a plot for rental houses in his area.

His future plan is to get business prosperity and become a role model in his society.

loans.use: to buy livestock for resale.

loans.name: Gladys Azucena

texts.es:
Gladys Azucena  tiene 38 años, es soltera vive con sus hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tienen 2 hijos Luis de 8 años y Valeria de 6 meses.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. VALLE ALTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Voluntad de Dios en el Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra maíz y arroz.


Gladys se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol, Compra sus productos en Agripac y vende en el mercado mayorista de ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, frejol, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría a superarse económicamente y  mejorar su producción. Su sueño es comprar una casa para sus hijos.

Le gusta conversar.
texts.en:
Gladys Azucena is 38 years old, single, and lives with her children in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province. She has two children, Luis (age 8) and Valeria (age 6 months).

The members of the Communal Bank “Valle Alto” meet in the neighborhood of Voluntad de Dios in the canton of Ventanas. This Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn and rice.

Gladys is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and beans. She will buy supplies and fertilizers for her crops. With the support of this loan, she will be able to excel financially and improve her production. Her dream is to buy a house for her children.

Gladys enjoys making conversation.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora works hard to support her family. Leonora is a widow and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Leonora requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business. Leonora has been in this business for 4 years.

Leonora would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita lives in Philippines and as a married parent of 9 children, works hard to support her family.

She has a food stall where she sells vegetables and bananas.   She also earns additional income from hog raising. Carmelita is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy additional stock of fruits and vegetables for sale at her food stall.

Carmelita has been sustaining her business activities with the assistance of 2 loans from NWTF in the past.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of repairing and renovating her family home.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Sumiini

texts.en:
Sumiini lives in Uganda. She is married with eight children, all of whom are in school. Sumiini has a retail shop. She has had this business for less than one year, and works seven days out of every week.  
Sumiini has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO. She will use the money to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and a bag of maize flour. She also generates income through a restaurant and selling piped water. Her main business challenges include   transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for the business are to start growing sugar cane and also to sell wholesale.    
Sumiini lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and a bag of maize flour.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a hardworking 47 year old businesswoman. She is single and a proud mother of 5 children, four of whom are in school. For the last 5 years she has been offering hotel services in order to meet the needs of her family. In the next 5 years, she wants her business to have expanded. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy wheat flour and sugar. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she is now able to access credit easily.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour and sugar

loans.name: Richard

texts.es: El señor Richard es chofer y su esposa se dedica a la venta de ropa por distintas ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. El crédito lo solicita para incrementar el capital de trabajo de su esposa, pues necesita comprar deportivos para niños y parcas (chamarras con capuchas) pues son artículos que vende mucho y tiene muchos pedidos. Vive en casa alquiler ubicado en la zona de Rio Seco en  la ciudad de El Alto; Richard  es casado y tiene dos hijos. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2010 y esta es la primera vez que desea que su crédito se canalize a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Richard is a chauffeur while his wife sells clothing at different fairs in the city of El Alto. The loan he is requesting will be used to increase the operating capital for his wife’s business. She needs to buy children’s sportswear and parkas (hooded jackets) since these products sell well and she has many orders. Richard lives in a rented house in the District of Rio Seco in the city of El Alto. He is married and has two children.

Richard has been a client of IMPRO since 2010 and this is the first time that his loan has been referred to Kiva for funding.

loans.use: to buy children’s sportswear and parkas for his wife's business.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Rosario has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, beverages & rice per kilogram.  She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks & rice for sell.

Rosario is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & rice for sell.

loans.name: Givi

texts.en:
Givi is from the village Shalauri. He is 60 years old and lives with his family: his wife Zhenya and 23-year-old son. Givi and his son work as worker-constructors in the village. This job is seasonal and they are mainly busy during summer and fall months. Along with their main job, Givi and Zhenya lead the family-owned small dairy farm. They have a milk cow and produce yogurt, which is sold in Telavi (a nearby town). The total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris (approximately USD 425). 

Givi requested a loan to purchase one additional milk cow. Zhenya will double the amount of produced yogurt as well as income from the sales. Givi and Zhenya plan to make some savings, in order to expand the cattle-shed, as they plan to get more milk cows in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Jehan

texts.en: Jehan is a 34-year-old young woman, married and has two sons and three daughters. She is  a school teacher and her husband is employed as well, and both earn decent salaries. Jehan wants to make some repairs to her house such as changing windows and doors, and purchase some new furniture. Jehan doesn't have enough money to pay, so she needs to take out a loan of $2,000 from FATEN. When Jehan gets the loan, which is to be repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to pay for repairing expenses and purchase new home furniture. This will help improve her house conditions and provide better living conditions for her family. Jehan appears in the picture above.

loans.use: pay for making some repairs to her house and for purchasing new home furniture

loans.name: Vasco

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Inhambane tem 61 anos,  fez a 3ª classe é solteiro pai de 4 filhos, vive na companhia dos seus 7 netos que vão a Escola. Não consegue poupar nenhum valor na sua conta bancaria.


Muda se para o Distrito de Namaacha aprocura de emprego onde fixa sua residência. Consegue um emprego no Colégio Maria Auxiliadora ha 35 anos onde trabalha das 11h as 19h auferindo um valor que aplica nas dispesas da casa e da sua obra. 

Este é seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção da sua casa( cimento, blocos, barrotes e chapas de zinco) para dar continuidade da sua obra. O credito anterior foi de 5.000.00mt foi para a mesma finalidade.
Está  confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo e pedir um novo empréstimo para mobiliar a sua casa.
texts.en:
He was born in Inhambane and completed 3rd grade. He is 61 years old, single and the father of four children. He lives with his seven grandchildren who attend school. He isn't able to save any money in his bank account.
He moved to the district of Namaacha in search of a job and there he established residence. He got a job at Maria Auxiliadora School 35 years ago. He works there from 11a.m. to 7p.m. and earns an income which he uses to pay for home and construction expenses.
This is his second loan with Hluvuku. It is for 10.000mt, which he intends to use to purchase construction supplies for his house (cement, cinder blocks, rafters and zinc sheets) so that he can keep building. The first loan was for 5.000mt, for the same purpose.
He is confident he will be able to repay in advance and request a new loan in order to furnish his house.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies for his house (cement, cinder blocks, rafters and zinc sheets).

loans.name: Mylen

texts.en: Mylen, a 39-year-old married mother of three, lives in the Philippines where she has had a rice field for eight years, allowing her to sell rice grain or rice per kilogram or sack. A new member of HSPFI, Mylen is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy fertilizers for her field. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her rice field.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: Doña Juana, habitante dela cuidad de León, 44 años de edad, madre de tres hijos todos están estudiando, ella es comerciante, dueña de una pulpería la cual la tiene ubicada en su casa de habitación. Este negocio lo tiene desde hace 21 años de edad, lo ha tenido por herencia de su mama, pero desde hace 5 años ella se dedica a vender enchiladas, en las noches mientras uno de sus hijos la ayuda a atender la pulpería ella saca una humilde mesa y silla de plástico las coloca afuera e su casa y comienza a vender su sabrosas y crujientes enchiladas, mientras espera la llegada de su esposo quien trabaja como chofer de auto buses , es en base a estas actividades que los dos realizan como sacan adelante a sus hijos. Ella es una mujer activa, luchadora y con ese mismo empeño es que empuja su negocio día a día. Ella solicita el préstamo para comprar  granos básicos,pan,dulces detergentes, jabones, sopas, aceite, cosméticos, enlatados, canela, snacks, jugos, gaseosas. El crédito le ayudara a surtir parte del inventario que le hace falta y le ayudara a vender más. Entre sus metas esta hacerle mejoras a su pulpería como pintarla, comprar vitrinas, estantes.
texts.en:
Juana lives in the city of León.  She is 44 years old and the mother of three children all of which are going to school.  She’s a merchant; she owns a home-based grocery store.  She’s had the store for 21 years; she inherited it from her mother.  But for the last five years she’s also been selling enchiladas in the evening while one of her children helps her tend to the store.  She sets up a humble plastic table and chair outside her house and starts to sell her delicious, crunchy enchiladas while she waits for her husband who is a bus driver to come home.  Based on these activities the two of them are able to support their children.  She is an active, tenacious woman who with that same drive pushes her business daily.

She requests the loan to buy basic grains, bread, candy, detergent, soap, soup, oil, cosmetics, canned goods, cinnamon, snacks, juice and soft-drinks.  The loan will help her stock part of the inventory she needs and will help her sell more.  Among her goals is to do some improvements to the grocery store, like paint it, buy display cases and shelving.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Wajane Women Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Wajane Women Group in Western Kenya! This  group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 
Sarah is the facilitator of this group. She takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits to educate her children and to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, she had a good maize yield harvesting six bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, she was only able to harvest two bags of maize on half an acre of land. 
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Sarah and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance. 
With income from maize sales, Sarah will repay her loan and educate her children. In 2012, the members of Wajane Women Group will each plant between half and one acre of maize.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda works hard to support her family. Melinda is married and has a firewood and charcoal retail business in the Philippines.

Melinda requested a loan of 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more firewood and charcoal to sell.

Melinda has been in this business for five years now, and also earns additional income from a sari-sari store (a variety store) and motorcycle transportation business.

In the future, Melinda would like to build and expand her business to increase the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more firewood and charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Eman is a 21-year-old lady from Al Hashmi-Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to purchase blankets for trading purposes.
Eman is looking to improve her family's living conditions as well as expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase blankets for trading purposes.

loans.name: Chulduzoi

texts.ru: Чулдузой 43-летняя замужняя женщина со средним образованием, воспитывает 4-х детей, дома занимается обработкой шерсти и вязанием шерстяных и зимних изделий на продажу. Её муж - Чори, занимается откормом скота и постоянно держит скот, это его основной доход. Скот пасёт на пастбище и целый год они питаются горными травами. Среди его скота он также держит ангорских коз, чья шерсть очень дорогая, и считается дополнительной прибылью в семейный бюджет. В период работы с нашей организацией она намного улучшила свои дела и привлекла своих знакомых к нам. Новый кредит она хочет потратить на покупку нескольких коз.
texts.en: Chulduzoi is a 43 year-old married woman with secondary education.  She is raising four children and is involved in processing wool and knitting wool and winter goods at home for sale.  Her husband, Chori, is involved in fattening up livestock and regularly keeps goats, which is his primary source of income.  The livestock grazes at a pasture and eats mountain grass throughout the year.  He also keep several Angora goats among his livestock, whose wool is very expensive, and this brings in an additional profit to the family budget.  During the period of working with our organization, Chulduzoi has significantly improved her business and referred her friends to us.  She wants to spend this new loan on the purchase of several goats.

loans.use: to purchase several goats

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita es una mujer muy trabajadora, a sus 66 años ella se siente muy joven y con mucha fuerza y salud para seguir trabajando y seguir adelante, ella vive en la ciudad de nazca, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido y por la majestuosas líneas de nazca por la cual la ciudad recibe gran cantidad de turistas durante todo el año, Felicita es madre de 8 hijos los cuales ya son mayores y están casados, así mismo como buena peruana el platillo que más le agrada es el riquísimo "Lomo Saltado", Felicita solo estudio hasta el quinto año de educación secundaria ya que sus padre no tenían muchos recursos económicos pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Secretariado. 

Felicita trabaja en su negocio de venta de abarrotes, al cual le dedica 12 horas diarias, 12 horas a las cuales le pone mucho empeño para vender sus productos, en un día puede atender hasta 30 clientes y es que Felicita cree que le va bien en su negocio porque trata a los clientes con mucho cariño y sobre todo porque se trata a los demás como quisiéramos que nos traten. 

Felicita está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que por segunda vez le brindan su gran apoyo y gracias a ello podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio como chocolates, azucar, bebidas gaseosas, fideos al por mayor, entre otros y con ello mejorar su calidad de vida y obtener mayores ingresos para poder seguir ahorrando y poder realizar su más grande sueño:"Tener una bodega mucho más grande y exitosa"
texts.en:
Felicita is a very hard working woman who at 66 years of age feels very young and with a lot of strength and health to keep working and moving forward. She lived in the city of Nazca which is characterised by its warm climate and majestic lines for which the city receives a great deal of tourists all year round. Felicita is the mother of 8 children who are all of age and married and as a good Peruvian, the food that she likes the most is the rich "Lomo Saltado" [strips of beef marinated in vinegar, soy sauce and spices served with rice and french fries]. Felicita was only in school up to fifth grade as her parents didn't have much in the way of financial means but she would like to have taken a secretarial course.

Felicita works in her business selling groceries, to which she dedicates 12 hours a day, 12 hours into which she puts a lot of effort to sell her products. In one day she can have around 30 customers and Felicita believes her business is going well because she treats her customers with a lot of affection, above all because one should treat others and they want to be treated themselves.

Felicita is very grateful to the Kiva lenders as this is the second time that they offer her great support and she will be able to buy more merchandise for her business such as chocolates, sugar, sodas, bulk noodles and others. With this she'll also be able to improve her quality of life and obtain more income so that she can keep saving up and make her biggest dream come true: "To have a much bigger and more successful grocery store".

loans.use: buy more products for her business such as chocolates, sugar, sodas, bulk noodles and others

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Cesar sells chickens in his local community. He mainly targets family and friends but he is sure that he can reach new markets. He sells about 20 to 30 chickens a day and is looking to continue improving his sales. Previously he owned a barbecue stand where he sold roasted chickens. He sold the stand in order to invest in a truck that he believed would allow him to purchase and distribute wholesale goods. Unfortunately he bought a lemon and his truck has not provided the business opportunities he hoped for.

Cesar is seeking the loan in order to increase his investments. He wants to begin purchasing poultry at wholesale quantities in order to resell to market vendors and shop owners. He also needs to fix up the spot in his backyard where he raises the live chickens he buys.

Cesar is 55 years old and has 3 children. His wife is a seamstress who helps bring in a complimentary source of income. Unfortunatley, both of Cesar’s older children (age 28 and 30) have mental disabilities. His kids rely on their mother and father for financial and emotional support. The couple works hard to provide their children with a decent living.

loans.use: He wants to begin purchasing poultry at wholesale quantities in order to resell to market vendors and shop owners

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en: Janet sells charcoal. She has one assistant at her store. She fetches charcoal from local producers in the nearby villages of Chanika and Kongowe in Dar es Salaam. She has been in this business for over six years now. Charcoal is the main source of domestic fuel for most Tanzanians. Janet has realized that firewood is also marketable to those who cannot afford charcoal. She wants to add the sale of firewood as a supplementary venture. This new line of business needs additional funding. She has to employ an assistant, rent another store and buy firewood from the villages. To implement her plan she needs USD 550.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Anisa

texts.en: Anisa lives in district 13 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is uneducated and she is a tailor. She has good working experience and she works for herself. She doesn’t like to take money from her husband, so she wants to take a group loan to buy new sewing machines and also rent a new shop to attract more clients. She wants to expand her business and make a good monthly income for herself. She is happy now and she wants to thank AFSG.

loans.use: To buy new sewing machines

loans.name: Nurida

texts.en: Nurida A. lives in Beylagan. She is married and has 3 children. She owns a small food market in front of her hoouse. Nurida sells sugar, tea, butter, beer, and other items at her market. She has been engaged in this business since 1996, when she only had a small booth. Later on, Nurida managed to expand her business and built a market. Normicro was very helpful to Nurida: in 2003-2006, Nurida borrowed 4 loans from Normicro Beylagan Branch totaling US$2,000, and used these loans for her business. Now she needs a new loan of US$1,100 to expand her business and to increase daily sales.

loans.use: Expansion of business

loans.name: Norma Alicia

texts.es:
Norma lives with her partner. She decided to set up her own business when she had the opportunity to get a "traspaso de negocio"; in other words, someone offered to give her the business for a nominal investment and she took it. Little by little, her hard work and dedication has increased the size of her small grocery business, something that has helped her to get ahead and improve her family's quality of life. She very much likes running a business and she wants to continue growing it.

Norma is asking for a US$475 loan that she offers to repay in 6 months. She will use the loan to buy merchandise for her business so that she can offer a wide range of goods to her customers. She thanks you for helping her continue to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Norma es una mujer que vive en unión libre con su pareja y decidió poner su propio negocio por que tuvo la oportunidad de obtener un traspaso de negocio, es decir, le ofrecieron darle el negocio a una mínima inversión y lo tomó, con un esfuerzo inicial, pero poco a poco lo ha hecho crecer con mucho trabajo y dedicación al mismo, su tienda de abarrotes le ha ayudado a salir adelante y poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia y a ella le gusta mucho el comercio, por ello desea continuar con su negocio y seguir haciéndolo crecer.

Norma solicita un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 475 que ofrece pagar en 6 meses, ella utilizará el préstamo para compra de mercadería para su negocio y así poder ofrecer más surtido a sus clientes, ella te agradece mucho por el apoyo que le brindas para continuar con el crecimiento de su negocio.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida C. is a 40 year old mother of three who has been married for the past 20 years. Her oldest daughter is currently enrolled in college and her two sons are in high school.

Adelaida prepares beautiful cakes and sometimes works in the cafeteria preparing all types of food. She also caters all types of social events such as birthdays and weddings where she is responsible for all the food and desserts. Moreover, her husband, Carlos, a chauffeur, is considering leaving his job to help Adelaida with the food preparation.

Adelaida has the firm support of her family and the experience necessary to prepare a diverse array of high quality foods and cakes. However, she needs loan to invest in a freezer to increase the shelf time of her desserts made from ice cream. She already has all the equipment necessary for her work with the exception of the freezer. She hopes in the future to move her business from her parents' house to her own.

loans.use: To buy a freezer

loans.name: Amah

texts.en: Amah is a 49 year old widow. Her husband passed away so now she has to work to support herself. She has a small shop which sells fresh food and household goods. She usually earns US$10 per day and it's just enough for her daily needs. She requests a $100 loan to expand her business. Since Amah became a member of MBK, her business is done increasingly well.
