She is willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Thi Hoan

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hoan and her family have been working on the fields and breeding poultry and pigs for generations. Now, they already have around 1000 hens. In order to buy more chicken food, they borrowed 125 USD from Binh Minh CDC (Kiva's partner in Vietnam). This time, she wants to borrow 150USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva Volunteer.

Gia đình anh chị truyền thống làm nghề nông: làm ruộng, chăn nuôi lợn thịt, gà. Hiện nay, gia đình anh chị đã có gần nghìn con gà đẻ trứng. Mong muốn bổ sung vốn mua cám cho gà, anh chị đã vay 2006000 từ Chương trình tài chính vi mô Binh Minh cdc.

loans.use: to buy chicken food

loans.name: Mkwawa A Group

texts.en:
Ali Salumu, age 50, is married with 4 children (ages 30, 25, 18, and 2). He owns a tailoring business which he started many years ago. His business is open from 8am to 6pm daily, and he makes a monthly profit of around $88.

In the past, Ali took out 1 previous loan with Tujijenge Tanzania to buy material for his tailoring business. He now hopes for a new loan to expand the same business. He will share this loan with his sub group members who have businesses dealing in selling clothing, soft drinks and fish.

(In the picture, Ali is the only man)

loans.use: Expand their businesses

loans.name: Kiyinki B1 South C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Gertrude N.. She is currently in the business of running a restaurant and is requesting a loan to purchase food warmers. Gertrude is 33 years old and is a widow. She has 6 children ranging from age 3 to 14 and her children go to school. Each week, Gertrude makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to cater for home needs and re-invest in her business. Gertrude has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Gertrude is joined in her small group by Hellen N., Jamawa N., Scovia N., and Deborah N.. Hellen N. has a business selling fuel and wants to invest more in her business. Jamawa N. is currently operating a restaurant business and wants a loan to purchase a fridge. Scovia N. operates a restaurant business and wants to add more furniture. Deborah N. is currently in the business of running a restaurant and is requesting a loan to purchase more raw food.

loans.use: To purchase more restaurant equipment like utensils, warmers and dishes

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Mrs. Faith E. lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells and supplies eggs to her neighboring market and other retailers in her community. She has been in this business since 2005 and she needs the sum of $875 to enable her to buy more eggs so that she can satisfy her customers' needs. This Faith says will help her increase her income.

loans.use: To buy more eggs for sale.

loans.name: Wendy Yovana

texts.en:
Wendy Yovana Z. S. has a general store in Cortijo, a suburb of Trujillo in La Libertad Region. She’s had her store for 5 years and sells all the goods that people buy most frequently. Her store is located in the front space of her home.

Wendy is 25 years old, married, and has 2 children. She works hard every day to take care of her family and business. She dreams of one day sending her children to University and owning a large store.

A member of the community bank Fuente de Vida, Wendy is requesting a loan of s/1500 to repay over 6 months. She will use the extra capital to restock her store and add new products.

loans.use: She will use the extra capital to restock her store and add new products.

loans.name: Reginaldo Elias

texts.pt:
Reginaldo is 33 years old and was born in Inhambane. He is separated and lives with his 3 children and 2 brothers. His children are 10, 8, and 3 months. He had the first two with his ex-wife and the last one with his girlfriend. The two older children are already in school.

Reginaldo concluded training to be an elementary schoolteacher and has taught for 8 years. He began in the district of Magude, and in 1993 he was transferred to Mugado primary school located in on the border of Swaziland in the district of Namaacha. There he works from 7:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. and then 1:30 p.m. to 5:30 p.m. His monthly salary is 3,276.00 MT, from which he is able to save 500.00 MT per month.

This is Reginaldo’s second loan with Hluvuku and his first one with Kiva. The first loan was 1,000.00 MT, which he used to buy material needed to add on to his house. Due to the cost of living, he has had to build the addition in phases, which is why he is taking out a second loan.

Reginaldo is confident that he can pay off his loan before the final due date. In the future he hopes to take out another loan to furnish his house and re-open his small business establishment in order to increase his family’s income, because he plans on marrying his girlfriend soon.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva volunteer.

Reginaldo tem 33 anos de idade, nasceu em inhambane, é separado e vive com os seus tres filhos e dois irmaos ,(Filhos)sendo um de 10 anos de idade, outra de 8 anos e ultimo com tres meses de idade, dizer que os primeiros dois fez com a sua ex-esposa e ultimo com a namorada, os dois maior já estudam.

Reginaldo concluiu a formaçao de professores primarios e trabalha como professor durane 8 anos, começa a trabalhar no distrito de magude e 1993 foi transferido para distrito de namaacha na vila fronteriço com Swazilandia na escola primaria Mugado onde entra das 7:30h – 12:30h periodo de manha e das 13:30—17:30h, tem um salario mensal de 3.276,00mt reginaldo depois das despesas consegue poupar mensalmente 500,00mt.

Este é o segundo emprestimo de reginaldo na balcao da Hluvuku e o primeiro com kiva, o primeiro foi de 10000,00mt e foi usado para compra de material para ampliaçao da sua casa e devido ao custo de vida está ampiando em fase, onde este tambem será empreque nesta mesma casa, futuramente reginaldo, apois a conclusao do pagamaneto que está confiante em liquidar antes do prazo fixado, pretende solicitar outro emprestimo para comprar mobilia e reabrir a seu pequeno estabelecimento comercial para aumentar a renda familia pois pretende casar brevemente com a sua namorada e ja que assim o agregado familiar vai aumentar.

loans.use: To buy materials to build family's house

loans.name: Carlos Andres

texts.es:
For three years Carlos S. has worked hard building his own business selling construction materials in the municipality of El Viejo in Chinandega, Nicaragua. His business has been growing steadily and the income allows Carlos to take care of his wife and three children.

Carlos is requesting a loan from Ceprodel to purchase more construction materials. The loan will help him continue to grow his business and improve the quality of life for his family.

Desde hace tres años el señor Carlos S. se ha dedicado a laborar en su propio negocio de Venta de materiales de construcción en el municipio de El Viejo en Chinandega. El negocio lo ha venido desarrollando muy notablemente y por medio de sus ingresos percibidos, mantiene a su familia compuesta por su esposa y tres hijos.

Hoy en día la razón por la cual ha acudido a Ceprodel es con el propósito de obtener un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción. Con este crédito se beneficia tanto él como su familia.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MATERIALS FOR HIS CONSTRUCTION BUSINESS,  INCREASE HIS INCOME, AND CONTINUE TO PROVIDE FOR HIS WIFE AND CHILDREN.

loans.name: Aramatoulaye

texts.fr:
Aramatoulaye S., aged 40 and married, has been a member of the Belfort Village Bank for seven years. She buys and sells fruit (mangoes and the like), and contributes towards her family’s daily expenses and the improvement of their living conditions. The loan she is requesting will be repaid after six months in one installment.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Aramatoulaye S., 40 ans, mariée est membre du banc villageois de Belfort depuis 7ans. Elle achète et revend des fruits(mangues et mades). Elle participe à la dépense quotidienne et l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Fruit sales

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther A. is 45 years old and married, with seven children. She lives in Uromi, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells provisions, drinks and foodstuffs. She has been in this business for the past four years. She needs the loan amount of $1025 to buy more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more drinks provisions and foodstuffs

loans.name: Mario Antonio

texts.es: Don Mario S. , tiene 53 años de edad, es casado le tiene tres hijos el mayor tiene 10 años cursa el quinto grado de primaria, su segundo hijo hijo es una niña y tiene tres años de edad cursa el primer grado y su ultimo hijo un varoncito de 10 meses de nacido, su esposa es comerciante de de ropa, quien le apoya tambien con los gastos del hogar, Don Mario, es propietario de un pequeño taller de carpinteria ubicado en el sector de la terminal de buses en leon donde elabora juegos de sillas, camas, roperos, teniendo 17 años de dedicarse a esta actividad la cual da incio como una herencia de su padre ya que este tambien se dedico a este negocio, su proposito ha sido poder mantener activo dicho negocio familiar y con este poder ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios y quizas el dia de mañana estos deseen continuar con la tradicion de la carpinteria, su sueño es poder ir ampliando su pequeño taller, para ello requiere de los creditos asi mismo mantener un inventario adecuado al gusto de sus clientes
texts.en:
Mr. Mario S. is 53 years old and he is married. He has three children, the oldest of whom is 10 years old and studies fifth grade in primary school. His second oldest is his 3 year old daughter, a pre-school student. His third and youngest son is a 10 month old baby. His wife is a clothes saleswoman who helps pay the household expenses. Mr. Mario is the owner of a small carpentry business located near the bus terminal in León. In this workshop he produces chairs, beds, and cabinets. He has worked in the business for 17 years, inheriting the work from his father, who worked in this business for many years. Mr. Mario has worked to keep the family business going and hopes it will allow him to support  his children in their studies. He hopes that one day, maybe, they will join him in the family business. His dream is to expand operations; a loan would help him increase his inventory to meet the needs of more clients.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Carpentry workshop expansion

loans.name: Farhat's Group

texts.en:
Farhat Baji is the wife of A. H. and lives in a city named Arifwala, Pakistan. She owes a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the past 10 years. She has one son. Her son is a driver by profession and drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Farhat Baji’s husband sells plastic sheets which are specifically used to cover tables. He has been in this business for the past 20 years. He buys the plastic sheets from different cities (Lahore, Faisal Abad). Farhat Baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more plastic sheets to resell.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Farida Baji wants a loan to buy cigarettes to resell. Naseeem Baji wants a loan to buy wheat to resell. Faizan Baji wants a loan to buy materials (washing powder, bleach) for her laundry business. Nasreen Baji wants a loan to buy candies to sell in shops.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy plastic sheets to resell

loans.name: Jamoliddin

texts.ru: Тагоев Джамоллидин проживает вместе со своей семьей в отдом из отдаленных кишлаков города. Он женат и имеет семерых детей. Арендует землю, которую засеивает пшеницей. Он очень активно работает на своей земле. К посевному сезону планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить семена пшеницы. Если на полученный кредит купит качественные семена , он сможет получить качественный урожай и тогда он быстрее реализует товар. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Jamoliddin T. lives in one of the remote villages with his family. He is married and has seven children. He rents land and sows it with wheat. He works very actively on his land. He plans to get a loan in time for the sowing season so he can buy wheat seeds. If he buys quality seeds on his loan he will then get a quality harvest and will be able to sell his product faster. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Trần Thị M. 46 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1997. Gia đình chị có 2 con đều đã trưởng thành, chồng chị là cán bộ hưu trí. Hiện nay chị ở nhà chăn nuôi lợn gà còn chồng và con buôn bán thuốc thú y. Công việc chăn nuôi, kinh doanh đang ngày càng pấht triển thuận lợi với thu nhập 3.500.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị M. mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ một phần chị đầu tư mua thêm lợn về nuôi, phần còn lại gia đình chị sẽ sử dụng để kinh doanh thuốc thú y.
texts.en:
Mrs. Tran Thi M. is 46 years old. She has been with TYM Fund since 1997. She has two grown children, and her husband is a retired government worker. She raises pigs and chickens while her husband and children sell veterinarian pharmaceuticals. Her livestock and pharmaceuticals business are expanding and bring her an income of 3,500,000 VND per month. She wishes to borrow 10,000,000 VND to invest in livestock and her pharmacy.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Good Friends Group

texts.en:
These people are Isha K., Mariama B., Aminata S. and Emma Koroma. They named their group Good Friend. Previous loans have had meaningful impacts in the lives of these people. The last loan they received through SMT was for Le 1,000,000.00 each. Now they are requesting a new loan for the same amount of Le 1,000,000.00 each to enable them to further strengthen their businesses.

Isha K. (right) is the leader of the group. Isha is forty years of age. She was born in Kono, in Eastern Sierra Leone. She is currently residing in Makeni, together with her husband who is a soldier. The two have five children – two of them are already on their own and three are still going to school. Isha sells cloth – cottons, “wax” and “laise” ("laise" are usually more expensive cloth than cotton and "wax"). Isha has been in the business for over twelve years.

With this loan, Isha will add to her initial working capital to buy additional bales of cloth. She will buy a bale of cotton and a bale of "laise". A bale of cotton costs Le 1,400,000 and a bale of "laise" costs Le 1,800,000. She will have to travel to neighboring Guinea to buy these bales of cloth. Prices in Guinea are more reasonable than in Sierra Leone. The cost to and from Guinea is Le 100,000.

The major challenges for Isa in her business are that of occasional slow sales and high customs duties at the border post. Apart from these, everything in her business is going fine. She likes doing her business as it is her only means of getting her survival.

loans.use: Expand her business by buying more bales of cloth

loans.name: Neema J.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 33-year-old Neema H. from Mbeya. She is married and has one child who is 12 years old. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependant because he is an orphan. 

Neema has been running a grocery and crops business since 2006. She buys different types of crops from the farmers and sells them in town. She works at the business for 16 hours a day, 5 days a week and is assisted by one employee. Neema currently earns about $100 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $600 USD to purchase maize, beans, and rice in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the variety of crops she sells. Neema thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Women are considered non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This situation leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use their equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase maize, beans, and rice in bulk.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị Loan Group

texts.vi:
Chị Loan, 29 tuổi hiện đang sống cùng 1 con T. nhỏ đang đi học. Chị là người phụ nữ trẻ nhanh nhẹn, đảm đang nhưng kém may mắn trong chuyện hôn nhân. Chị đã kết hôn nhưng do không hợp nhau nên vợ chồng chị đã ly hôn. Chị nhận trách nhiệm nuôi con. Vì vậy cuộc sống hiện tại của chị khá là vất vả, chị không chỉ một mình lo lắng về mặt kinh tế mà còn có trách nhiệm lớn lao vưà là mẹ vừa là cha của con mình. H. ngày ngoài làm ruộng, nuôi lợn chị còn nhận đồ mộc về nhà làm thuê để có thêm thu nhập. Thu nhập trung bình của chị khoảng 80000-100000 vnđ/ ngày. Tuy khó khăn nhưng chị rất uy tín, chu kỳ trước nhóm chị đã vay và hoàn trả rất tốt. Nay chị tiếp tục vay 4704000 vnđ/ 50 tuần/ chu kỳ 2 để bổ sung vốn chăn nuôi lợn. Các thành viên khác trong nhóm của chị :
+ Chị Nguyễn Thị H. vay 2016000 vnđ/ 50 tuần để bổ sung vốn mua cám lợn.
+ Chị Nguyễn Thị H. vay 3808000 vnđ/ 50 tuần để mua lợn giống và cám nuôi lợn.
+ chị Ngô Thị P. vay 2016000 vnđ/ 50 tuần để thêm vốn mua cám lợn.
+ Chị Nguyễn Thị Q. vay 1120000 vnđ/ 50 tuần để mua cám lợn.
+ Chị Nguyễn Thị Mỵ vay 1120000 vnđ/ 50 tuần để thêm vốn chăn nuôi lợn.
+ Chị Nguyễn Thị T. vay 4256000 vnđ/ 50 tuần để phát triển nghề xây dựng.
texts.en:
Mrs. Loan, 29 years old, currently lives with her young son who is still going to school. She is an active and responsible woman, but unlucky in marriage. She got married once but was divorced because she and her husband did not get along well. She single-handedly raises up her son. Thus, she faces many difficulties, as she does not only have to worry about finances but also shoulders the responsibility of being both a mother and a father for her son. Everyday, besides working on the farm and rearing pigs, she also does carpenter works at home to increase income. Her average daily income is about 80,000 to 100,000VND. Though facing hardship, she was still able to repay well her previous loan. This time, she would like to borrow 4,704,000VND over the course of 50 weeks to rear pigs. Her group also consists of:
  • Mrs. N. Thi Hang, borrows 2,016,000VND to purchase bran for pigs.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Hat, borrows 3,808,000VND to purchase pigs and bran for pigs.
  • Mrs. Ngo Thi P., borrows 2,016,000VND to purchase bran for pigs.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Q., borrows 1,120,000VND to purchase bran for pigs.
  • Mrs. N. Thi My, borrows 1,120,000VND to rear pigs.
  • Mrs. N. Thi T., borrows 4,256,000VND for building projects.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rearing pigs

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda tiene 58 años, es natural de Iquitos (ciudad de la selva peruana) vive con su pareja, quien es mecánico y sus hijos Goldi de 39 y Henry de 37 años en su casa propia. Desde hace 25 años se dedica a la costura, ya que le gusta mucho elaborar prendas con su máquina de coser y a cada prenda le pone todo su ingenio y creatividad; por su vecindario son muy solicitados sus servicios, debido a que es muy buena en su trabajo, obteniendo buenas ganancias para su hogar. Pero este negocio tiene demanda esporádicamente, e Hilda quiere una actividad que le genere ganancias diarias, es así que ha pensado invertir en un restaurante donde se prepare gran variedad de platillos. Gracias a su esfuerzo ha logrado encontrar el lugar apropiado para su nuevo negocio, lo alquilará y comprará lo necesario para echarlo a andar. Hilda tiene puestas muchas esperanzas en esta actividad, pues confía en su buena sazón e instinto para los negocios, pero también seguirá trabajando en lo que más le gusta, que es la confección de prendas. Este es su préstamo número 14 con MFP, actualmente viene integrando un grupo con dos de sus amigas, quienes trabajan muy bien juntas, siendo muy puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará muebles y utensilios para implementar su restaurante, espera que en el futuro le sea muy próspero.
texts.en:
Hilda is 58 years old, is from Iquitos (a city in the Peruvian jungle), and lives with her partner who is a mechanic and her sons Goldi, 39, and Henry, 37 in a home she owns. Since she was 25 years old she has been working in sewing. She likes very much to make clothing with her sewing machine and she puts all her ingenuity and creativity into each garment. Around her neighborhood her services are in high demand, because she is very good at her work, and obtains good earnings for her household. But this business has sporadic demand, and Hilda would like an occupation that would generate daily earnings, and this is why she had the idea to invest in a restaurant which would offer a large number of dishes. Thanks to her efforts, she managed to find an appropriate location for her new business and to rent and buy that which is necessary for getting started. Hilda has placed great hope in this enterprise, trusting in her good timing and business instincts, but also continuing working on that which she likes the most, which is making clothing. This is her 14th loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA, and she is currently forming a group with two of her friends who work well together, to be punctual in their payments. With the money she is asking for she will buy furniture and utensils for starting her restaurant. She is hoping for a very prosperous future.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in a new food sales business

loans.name: Arubaine C Group

texts.en: Mrs. H. Talibu is 21 years old. She is married and has two children, ages 6 and 1. She is using the loan to purchase new and used clothes, specifically ladies' and children's clothes. She has been able to pay school fees for her child. She is happy and hardworking and her dream is to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase new and used clothes, specifically ladies' and children's clothing

loans.name: Bessy Arleny

texts.es: la Sra. Bessy G. tiene una pulperia desde hace 4 años la cual opera bajo el nombre de Pulperia IVA, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion. ella es casada y es madre de un niño, este negocio le ha permitido generar ingresos sin tener que descuidar a su hijo y ni los que haceres de la casa, su esposo trabaja en la aduana de las manos frontera con Nicaragua, ella nos conto muy alegre que su negocio es de gran bendicion ya que todo le ha salido muy bien y lo que ella necesita en este momento es surtir mas su negocio ya que esta creciendo muy rapido y necesita cubrir con todas las demanadas de sus clientes
texts.en:
Mrs. Bessy G. has owned a general store for four years, which operates under the name of IVA General Store. The business is located inside her home. She is married and is the mother of a boy. The business allows her to generate income without having to leave her son or the household duties. Her husband works for the customs agency on the Nicaraguan border. She told us that she is very happy that her business is such a blessing, as everything has gone very well and that right now she needs to better stock the business. It is growing very rapidly and she needs to meet the demands of all of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soft drinks, paper, coffee, rice, beans, bread, cookies, soups, churros, and soap

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha has been a soup, bites and clothes seller in the Jang’ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar for three years. She currently earns an average monthly profit approximately $25. She works at her business for 12 hours every day. Aisha is 32 years old, married, and has given birth to three children: ages 12, 9 and 2.

Aisha is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more meat and khangas (African garments) for her business. She is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business. She belongs to Mkorofi si mwenzetu group loan (Group code 2032).

loans.use: To buy more meat and khangas

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Elizabeth, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Queñuani, distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chuchito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 33 años de edad y es madre de 02 hijos, de estado civil casada, y tiene estudios de Secundaria completa, y vive en el Barrio Central.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi  ½ año,  con un préstamo inicial de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles  Elizabeth tiene su negocio de compra y venta de ají.  

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en su actual negocio, que es la compra y venta de ají, paralelamente se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado menor, el mismo que lo compra en las comunidades de su zona.

Su mayor sueño es convertirse en mayorista de aji.
A ella le gustan los ahorros y gracias a ellos a salido adelante sola aprendiendo a negociar.
texts.en:
Elizabeth belongs to the "Virgen del Rosario" Community Bank, in Queñuani Community, Yunguyo district, Chuchito province, Puno department. She is 33 years old, married and the mother of 2 children. She has a high school education and lives in the Central neighborhood. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for almost half a year. With an initial loan of 500 PEN Elizabeth started her business buying and selling aji chiles. She now needs to borrow 1000 PEN to invest in her current business, buying and selling aji chiles. At the same time she buys and sells livestock, which she buys in the communities in her area. Her biggest dream is to become a wholesale seller of aji chiles. She likes to save, and thanks to her savings has been able to get ahead, learning to negotiate.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of aji chiles and livestock

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is married to Weslie, who works in a trucking business at Cavite. She is the mother of five, and they live in the peaceful village of Lullutan, Ilagan, Isabela. Their children are: Willy - 16, who has completed the primary level of education; Jessica - 13, and Leonard - 11, both of whom are in high school; and Ericka - 7, and Wendel, - 5, who are both in the primary level.  With her general store, Alona is able to provide the needs of her family and continue to send her children to school. 

To sustain her business, Alona is hoping to borrow PHP7,000 as additional business capital.  She is happy that through her business she is able to help her husband in meeting the needs of their family.

loans.use: Additional business capital

loans.name: Aman

texts.en:
Mrs. Aman T. is a resident of Tangal. Tangal is located in Lalitpur district. Tangal is one of the busy bazaars of Lalitpur district and most of the people in this region are engaged in small business.
Mrs. T. lives in a joint family with her father-in-law, mother-in-law, brother-in-law, sister-in-law and husband. Her husband, Mr. Sujan, is engaged in his own small business. 
Mrs. Aman opened her sandal shop in the footpath in Tangal. She opened her shop in the footpath market because she cannot afford to pay the high rent in the Tangal area. She sells different types of shoes in her shop. 
Now she is requesting an Rs 30000.00 loan to buy different kinds of sandals for her shop.

loans.use: To buy shoes for her shop

loans.name: Wennie

texts.en:
33-year old Wennie C. manages a small rice field in her village. She has five children and the income that she gets from growing rice is basically what she uses to buy their needs. Aside from rice, she also grows vegetables in their backyard. This also helps the family to earn additional income since most of the people in their village like vegetables.

Now, she needs additional capital to run her business. The loan will really go far in buying the herbicides and fertilizers needed on her farm.

Like other CEVI clients, Wennie is enjoying the CEVI credit services and the training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase herbicides and fertilizers

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa tiene 46 años, es una mujer muy luchadora y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su hijo Marco de 10 años y lo que más desea es darle una buena educación. La tienda de Elsa es una de las más concurridas de su barrio, su gran carisma y su paciencia para atender a sus clientes, han hecho de ella una de las vecinas más queridas. Desde muy temprano se levanta para abrir su tienda, ya que sabe que por las mañanas es cuando más sus vecinos necesitan de su productos, pues vende comestibles y otros artículos necesarios para el hogar. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinos sobre las cosas que suceden en su barrio, lleva 10 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, sin poder salir a la calle a realizar otras actividades. Para el futuro espera que su negocio crezca y se convierta en la tienda principal de su barrio. Este es el sétimo préstamo de Elsa con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus créditos y espera serlo también ahora, en su banco comunal es muy activa y es muy querida por el resto de las socias. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados incrementará la cantidad de productos que tiene en stock, ya que desea ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Forty-six-year-old Elsa is a hard-working, cheerful woman. She lives in her own home with Marco, her ten-year-old son. She wants very much to give him a good education. Elsa's store is one of the most popular in her neighborhood; her great charisma and patience with her customers have made her one of the most well-liked residents. She rises early to open her store and knows that her customers need her products in the morning more than at any other time; she sells food and other items necessary for the home. The most enjoyable thing about her job is to discuss neighborhood news with her customers. She has operated her store for ten years and considers the most difficult part of her job that she must remain in the store the entire day and may not go outside into the street or do other things. She hopes that her business will grow and become the most important store in her neighborhood. This is Elsa's seventh loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. She has been very punctual with her payments and expects to continue to be so. In her cooperative bank, she is very active and well-liked by the other members. With the $700 she has applied for, she will increase the number of products that she has in stock. She wishes to offer greater variety to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of merchandise

loans.name: Julian's Group

texts.en: K. Julian is the leader of her lending group in Mukono, Nakifuma Sub County. She is 48 years old and a widow taking care of her 8 children of which 2 are in school plus 3 orphans although with the orphans, she only helps to cater for their health and food. Julian is a teacher by profession and she is also a business lady involved in the sale of produce for 10 years like matooke, cassava, sweet potatoes plus greens and vegetables. Although she buys the produce from other farmers, she is also a farmer and only buys out if her quantity is not enough for her customers. She is in need of a loan to help buy more produce for resale since she does not have enough for all her customers in the various markets that she moves to for the trade.

loans.use: Buying more produce for resale.

loans.name: Enkhtuya

texts.en:
S. Enkhtuya is 48 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in Uvurkhangai province. She started her own business in 1996 by purchasing a Russian truck “ZIL -130”. Enkhtuya sells firewood and coal in the local market with her husband. For now, she is driving to the countryside to sell goods and in the winter she sells firewood and coal with the assistance of her husband. She is able to pay her daughter's student fees due to her successful business activities.

Enkhtuya is healthy and able to run her business further. Personally speaking, she is a good communicator and a meticulous person. Enkhtuya said: “I will keep running this business until my children get into a profession.” She is requesting 1,000,000 tugrugs (approx. $690 USD) to purchase repair parts for her truck for 200,000 tugrugs and firewood with the rest of 800,000 tugrugs.

loans.use: to purchase repair parts for her truck and firewood

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en:
Edgardo D. C. is from the town of Sta.Cruz, Poblacion, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. He is 50 years old and married with five grown children. To make a living, Edgardo owns and operates a business, a motorcycle repair shop for community members. Edgardo has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately $87 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Edgardo joined Paglaum-MPC, a Kiva field partner, to gain access to financial services that would enable him to engage in business activities and thereby improve his living situation. He has successfully repaid previous loans which were used to purchase some materials and additional products for his business. Edgardo is requesting a new loan that will again be used to purchase materials amounting to PHP8,000. This will be his second loan from Paglaum-MPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family.

loans.use: To buy materials for his business.

loans.name: Jhon

texts.es:
Jhon, de 29 años, es un joven trabajador y sencillo, vive en una habitación alquilada y tiene muchas ganas de sobre salir en la vida. Los días de Jhon comienzan muy temprano por la mañana, cuando junto a su inseparable motocarro sale en busca de clientes que quieran utilizar sus servicios, él es un conductor muy hábil y con mucha suerte, ya que siempre tiene clientes para transportar, lo que ha hecho que su negocio se vuelva muy rentable.

Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es manejar su motocarro por las calles de la ciudad de Juliaca, tiene 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar hasta altas horas de la noche, ya que necesita ganar más dinero. Para más adelante, espera poder juntar el dinero necesario para comprar un nuevo motocarro.

Este es el cuarto préstamo de Jhon con MFP y está dispuesto a trabajar muy duro para pagar todas sus cuotas sin demora. En su banco comunal es muy querido por el resto de las socias. Con los mil quinientos soles solicitados hará arreglar su motocarro, ya que con el paso del tiempo se ha ido deteriorando.
texts.en:
Jhon, 29 years old, is a hard-working and unassuming youngster. He lives in a rented location, and has a great desire to succeed in life. Jhon’s days start very early in the morning when, along with the motorcar from which he is inseparable, he leaves to look for customers who require his services. He is an able driver and very lucky, since he always finds business and this has made his enterprise very profitable. What he enjoys most about his work is driving throughout the streets of the city of Juliaca. He has been in this business for 5 years, and finds its most difficult aspect to be working until very late at night to earn more money. In the future, he hopes to gather enough money to buy a new motorcar. This is Jhon’s fourth loan with MFP, and he is committed to working hard to pay his installments on time. He is well-liked by the other members of his cooperative bank. He will use the one thousand five hundred Peruvian soles he is requesting to make repairs to his motorcar, which needs work.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make repairs to his motorcycle.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer trabajadora y dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali,  tiene 30 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general, pues tiene una bodega en su casa. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “María Montessori” desde hace seis años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de  300 soles, que lo utilizó en la compra de abarrotes.
En la actualidad ella requiere de un crédito de 1000 soles que será utilizado para comprar abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, fideos, etc., y surtir su negocio. La meta de Luz es tener una tienda más grande y seguir adelante en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Luz is a hardworking and dynamic woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the region of Ucayali. She is thirty years old and sells groceries from a store in her home.

She has been a member of the village bank "María Montessori" for six years. The first loan she received was for 300 soles which she used to buy groceries. Now she needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy goods like rice, sugar, and pasta to stock her store.

Luz's goal is to have a larger store and move forward with her work.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries at wholesale

loans.name: Felesa

texts.en: Felesa D. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 57 years old, is widowed, and has nine adult children. Felesa owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over thirty years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2005, Felesa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Felesa is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 9th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is 32 years old and married with one child. He has been working in construction for nine years. Today, Mahmoud is asking to borrow $1,000 to buy specialized machinery that will help to satisfy his customers' needs and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy specialized machinery

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase and sale of spare parts

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: Doña Felipa es una cliente antigua que esta retornando desde el año 2005, trabajando sola con individuales y oportunos tiene un historial impecable con cero dias de mora y desde el año en que descanso hasta la fecha se pudo constatar el crecimiento que tuvo el negocio de carpinteria que tiene la señora y su esposo Fermin, el negocio tiene contrato con la Caja petrolera y es precisamente para este que necesita el dinero, pues necesita comprar  material (accesorios de muebles) y asi terminar los muebles y proceder a la entrega de 18 escritoios y 3 mesas de reuniones  segun el pedido de la institucion.
texts.en:
Felipa is an old client who has been returning for loans since 2005 and has an impeccable history always paying her loans back on time. The carpentry business that she has with her husband Fermin has been growing every year. Their business has a contract with the petroleum company and this is why they need the loan. They will use it to purchase materials to finish 18 desks and three meeting tables according to the company's order.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials to make furniture

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane M. is a 38 year old single mother of five children between 15 and 23 years of age. She resides and owns a four room house where she lives with her family.The family has access to electricity and piped water and gets three meals a day.  

Jane sells second hand clothes in the Kawempe market. She incurs transport costs buying clothes from the Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda. She works in a semi urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala.  Jane works six days a week. She receives an average of 20 customers a day and sells to all categories of people both retail and wholesale.  Her greatest monthly expenses include feeding the family, monthly market dues for her business and school fees for her children. Jane's major business challenge is the transportation of bales of clothes from the Owino market to her business premises. 

Jane has been in this business for five years and with MCDT for six years servicing her twelfth loan. Jane joined MCDT because it was near her home and was working with poor women. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of cloth.  She hopes to see her business grow so that she can start selling to only wholesale customers.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Erasmo Antonio

texts.es: Erasmo Antonio B. V. de 29 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Salvador, vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos de 5 y 4 años de edad. Él posee una carpintería, la cual esta ubicada en su casa de habitación, lugar en el cual trabaja por las noches y fines de semana, lo cual demuestra que Erasmo es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable quien vela día y noche por el bienestar de su familia, sin importar el doble esfuerzo que tenga que realizar, esto debido a que durante el día, de lunes a viernes, él trabaja como empleado de otra carpintería, en la cual se encarga de atender a los clientes que visitan el lugar. Erasmo solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda hacer sustitución de paredes de adobe por paredes de block en su casa, esto debido a que las fuertes lluvias del invierno pasado deterioraron las paredes de su hogar, y antes que inicie la temporada de lluvia el desea poder contar con paredes nuevas, las cuales le brinde mayor seguridad a sus hijos y su esposa. Erasmo es un ejemplo de emprendurismo y dedicación, ya que trabaja arduamente para poder seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Erasmo Antonio is 29 years old and lives in the San Salvador Department, along with his wife and children, ages 5 and 4. He has a carpentry shop, collocated within his home, where he works in the evenings and on weekends. This demonstrates that Ernesto is a hard working young man who toils day and night for the well-being of his family, despite him having to put in double the effort. He works as an employee at another carpentry shop, Monday through Friday, where he attends to customers. Erasmo is requesting this loan so that he can replace the adobe walls in his home with cinder block, since the strong rains last winter caused his walls to deteriorate. He would like to have his new walls installed before the rainy season begins so that his wife and children can feel more secure. Erasmo is an example of enterprising and dedication, as he works diligently to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rebuild the walls in his home

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret has been running a beauty salon and beauty products business for four years.  She sells hair beauty products in her salon. She says that Faulu Kenya has helped her learn how to manage her business and have good customer service from their trainings.  She previously took a loan of Kes. 20,000 from Faulu and now she plans to take a loan of Kes. 40,000 to buy four blow dryers, mirrors, chemicals and cosmetics.  She hopes to open other beauty shops to increase her sources of income and create employment.  She sees herself owning a beauty college in the future.

loans.use: To buy hair dryers, mirrors, chemicals & cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy general food products

loans.name: Sidoine

texts.fr: G. Sidoine est née le 22 Novembre 1982 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Sidoine vit depuis 15 ans à Cocotomey, dans la communne d'Abomey Calavi. Mariée à GONSAVES Salomon, un transitaire, Sidoine  est mère d'un enfant qui est scolarisé. Sidoine a un autre enfant à sa charge. Sidoine assure avec son mari les différentes charges familiales. Sidoine a très peu fréquenté, et a appris la coiffure. C'est cette activité que Sidoine exerce depuis une dizaine d'année et qui lui permet de se prendre en charge. Parallèlement à cette activité, Sidoine vend des mèches, des bijoux et divers autres produits de beauté dans son atelier situé à Cococodji, dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi. Sidoine achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché inernational du Bénin. Sidoine a déjà bénéficié une fois de crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé. Sidoine sollicite un deuxième prêt pour rehausser le niveau de son activité et satisfaire plus sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Sidoine G. was born November 22, 1982, in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Sidoine has lived in Cocotomey, in the village of Abomey Calavi, for 15 years. Married to Salomon Gonsaves, a shipping agent, Sidoine is the mother of one child who attends school. Sidoine has one other child in her care. Together, she and her husband meet the different family responsibilities. Sidoine attended very little school, and she learned hairstyling. This is the type of work Sidoine has been doing for about 15 years and it allows her to meet her needs. Along with this work, she sells hairpieces, jewelry and various other beauty products at her shop in Cococodji, in the village of Abomey Calavi. Sidoine buys her products in Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin. She has already benefitted once before with a loan through ALIDé, a loan which she has repaid. Sidoine is requesting a second loan to increase the level of her business and to satisfy her customers better.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy hairpieces and jewelry

loans.name: Chhlat

texts.en:
Mrs. P., 26, resides in a small wooden house with other family members. The location of their house is in the rural area of Kompong Tom province, where P. has been earning a living by raising pigs. By doing this, P. has received many benefits to ensure a better standard of living for her family.

Her husband is a temporary laborer who is hired by villagers to do anything for a fee. P. became a mother of a young child four years ago. Her child is enrolled in school and dependent on her. 

Mature rice is commanding the lowest price at this time. P. would like to take this occasion to generate extra profit by looking for a loan to order and buy rice in bulk from farmers. Then she will sell it later to raise a profit. With any remaining amount of the loan, P. will improve her pig-raising business.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk and improve her pig-raising business

loans.name: Albert

texts.en: Albert is a 31-year-old hardworking man. He runs a retail shop in his hometown where he sells household goods, plastics and utensils to earn a living. He has 10 years of experience and has a high turnover due to his good customer care skills. He talks well to his customers and gives credit to his best customers, which keeps them returning. His wife usually assists him in the business and their togetherness is what has brought them this far.  He saves part of his earnings with his group in Faulu Kenya called Extra Shinner and this enables him to access loans that the group guarantees. This is his first loan. He was previously selling chicken before he ventured into this business. His wish is to see his children go through school and be professionals. He has requested a loan of Kes 20,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy sugar, rice, cooking fat and utensils to sell.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, cooking fat and utensils to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
El señor David E. vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Tembladerani, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa.
El señor David es empleado de un restaurante del centro de la ciudad, ingresos con los que mantiene a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la adquisición de un anticrítico ( es una forma legal de alquiler de un inmueble) ya que en casa de sus padres solo ocupan una habitación y buscan mejores condiciones de hábitat.
Esta es la primera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Davis lives with his wife in his parents’ home, located in the Tembladerani zone, on the west side of the city of La Paz. He is employed in a restaurant in the city center and this income allows him to support his family. He is requesting this loan in order to lease a better place to live because his parents only have a single family home. This is the first time he has requested a loan and his economic status allows him to qualify.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Lease a home

loans.name: Cristo Vive 3,4 Group

texts.en:
Juliana is the coordinator of her group Cristo Vive (Christ Lives), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the lush, rugged Samana peninsuL., an area with a nascent tourism industry, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with long-term partner and their three children.

Juliana is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling fish balls from the kitchen of her home by purchasing more fish. She will use the profits to buy school supplies for her children. Her long-term goals are to save enough money for a car and her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase fish to make fish balls

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali A. Abeileh is a young man from Jericho. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee. Ali is responsible for a big family that consists of his wife, parents, sister and brother. His salary from the Palestinian National Authority doesn't cover household expenses.

Ali's father owns a piece of land. Five years ago, Ali and his father started growing vegetables and distributing them to the neighboring market to generate a second income to support their big family. Ali took a $1,500 loan to purchase an agricultural pesticide sprayer, because the hot weather for which Jericho is known is good weather for worms to grow and harm plants.

Ali, who appears in the photograph, works the land after his working hours. Then, early each morning, he distributes the plant yields to the neighboring market.

loans.use: Purchase an agricultural sprayer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Build a house

loans.name: Mikayel

texts.en: Mikayel V. is 28 years old and lives in Khashtarak village, Ijevan area, with his parents. Mikayel works as a contract serviceman for the Ministry of Defense's system. At the same time Mikayel and his family are engaged in cattle-breeding, swine breeding, bee-keeping and land cultivation. In their farm they have two cows, two calves, two pigs, four rabbits, some hens and turkey hens, and five beehives. With incomes from farming Mikayel and his family solve their everyday needs and they hope to increase their farm in future. Mikayel asks for a 350,000 AMD loan to buy fodder for his farm animals.

loans.use: To buy fodder for his farm animals

loans.name: Jakeline

texts.es:
Jakeline vive en la zona de Escobar Uria de la ciudad de La Paz.
Esta casada y tiene tres hijos, de 7 años, 3 años y 3 meses.
La señora tiene un negocio de Internet y juegos en red en su domicilio desde hace tres años; su esposo trabaja como empleado en una fotocopiadora.
Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la segunda vez que requiere el apoyo de kiva, demostrando responsabilidad en el pago de sus cuotas. El crédito será utilizado para lacompra de una impresora Lasser a color y sus accesorios, para ofrecer servicios de impresión en su negocio.
texts.en:
Jakeline lives in Escobar Uria, a neighborhood of the town of La Paz. She is married and has three children: one is a 3 month-old baby, the other two are aged 7 and 3. She has been running and Internet café with video games services in her house for three years; her husband works in a photocopying shop. This is the third loan she is requesting to Impro, and the second time she is asking for support from Kiva: she has demonstrated being responsible with the repayments of her dues. The loan will be used to buy a laser color printer and its spare parts, in order to add a printing service to her activity.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a laser color printer

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha V. is from the town of Rizal West in the municipality of San Isidro. She is 24 years old. Editha is married and has two school-age children. To make a living, Editha owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Editha has been engaged in her business for over 3 years, and she earns approximately 1500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Editha joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Editha has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Editha is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Editha from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna E. is from the village of Kipaducan, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 36 years old. Lorna is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Lorna owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Lorna has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lorna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lorna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 18000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Lorna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes, de 40 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Federico de 40 años y sus dos menores hijos Geral de 14 y Wilbert de 7 años, quienes son el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Las fértiles tierras del poblado de Huaripampa, le han brindado a Merced un lugar ideal para cultivar arvejas y papa, productos con los que alimenta a su familia y a la vez gana el dinero necesario para el sustento de su hogar, ya que debido a la buena calidad de su cosecha siempre obtiene muy buenos precios en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, que es el lugar donde vende sus cultivos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras, ya que sabe que de esta actividad depende el progreso de su negocio, lleva 22 años realizando esta labor y considera que lo más difícil es  fumigar sus cultivos, ya que los químicos que utiliza son muy peligrosos para su salud. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras a sus vecinos, ya que siente que es hora de incrementar la cantidad de su producción. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesta a hacerlo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida, por el orden que pone en las reuniones. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para sus chacras e invertirá también en la compra de insumos para evitar que la plaga de insectos dañe sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 40 years old and is a very happy and hardworking mother. She lives in her own house with her 40-year-old husband Federico and their two young boys Geral (14) and Wilbert (7), who are the main motivation for all of her efforts.

The fertile lands of Huaripampa have provided Mercedes with an ideal place to grow peas and potatoes, products that she uses to feed her family. At the same time, they also provide the money necessary to support the household. Her crops are of good quality so they always have good prices at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma, where she sells them. What she likes most about her work is planting since she knows that this determines her business’ progress. She has been in this business for 22 years and considers the most difficult part to be spraying her crops because the chemicals used are dangerous for her health. In time, she wants to buy new lands from her neighbors because she feels as though now is the time to increase her amount of production.

This is her first loan with MFP. She knows that she needs to make her payments on time and she is prepared to do so because she does not want to cause any problems for the members of her communal bank, where she is very well-liked for the order that brings to the meetings. With the 800 PEN she is requesting, she will purchase more fertilizer for her lands and also invest in the purchase of products to prevent pests from damaging her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizer, as well as products to prevent pests from damaging her crops.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac, en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.  Georgina;  La socia tiene  40 años de edad;  ella es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos,  La socia se dedica al comercio minorista ella es comerciante de granos secos (vende cereales, quinua, habas, frejoles, maíz, comida para pollos entre otros.) La socia necesita el capital para comprar mercadería y poder implementar su negocio en el mercado de ttio.  La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería para implementar su stand en el mercado.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Georgina, 40, is a member of the “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS” (Let’s Walk Together) communal bank located in Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

She has a live-in partner and two children.  She is a retailer.  She sells basic grains (cereals, quinoa, lima beans, broad beans, corn, chicken feed, among others).  She needs capital to buy merchandise to stock her business in Ttio’s market.  She is requesting funds to invest in merchandise to stock her stand in the market.

She is grateful for and values the loan granted by this means and at the same time pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her stand in the market.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 42 years old. She is married and has 5 children between the ages of 16 and 28. Two of her children are enrolled in school and three of them have completed their university. Her husband does not work. Marie sells milk, and with this loan she will buy more liters of milk to sell. With the profit from the business she will pay school fees for her children. She says that her business is successful because the community likes milk.

In the future, she would like to be a distributor of milk in the whole district.

loans.use: To buy more liters of milk to sell.

loans.name: Maria Emperatriz

texts.es:
Maria Emperatriz tiene 46 años y vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, Perú, ella desde hace mucho tiempo que participa en el banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa. Maria Emperatriz es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos, ella es docente cesante y actualmente se dedica a la venta de zapatos, ropa y bisutería. 

Maria Emperatriz con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de $ 1000 USD, ella invertirá el dinero para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar zapatos y ropa.  

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Maria Emperatriz is 46 years old and lives in the beautiful city of Cusco, Peru.  She has been a member of Arariwa's “Patrón D. San Sebastián” community bank for a long time.  Maria Emperatriz is married and has two children.  She is an out-of-work teacher who currently works selling shoes, clothes and jewelry.

Maria Emperatriz plans to use her loan for $1,000USD to increase her working capital.  She would like to buy shoes and clothes.

She is grateful for the opportunity which she is being given with this loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy shoes and clothes

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 32 years old.  He is married to a farmer. He has four children who are between four and seven years old. Two of his children go to school while the other two are still too young to go to school. 

Daniel sells clothes and he has spent thirteen years in this business. He needs this loan to buy more men's clothes to sell.  He says that his business is successful because it sustains the family's needs. He expects to expand his business from the profit that will be obtained.

loans.use: To buy more men's clothes to sell

loans.name: Prak

texts.en:
Prak K., 42, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia.  She produces clay pigs and earns about $2 per day.  Her husband is employed and earns about $1 per day. 

K. spends $50 on food, $5 on electricity and water and $65 on other necessities every month.  

She is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a motorbike for her family's use.  In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike for the famliy use

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a widowed woman with three children all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

She has operated a Khanga’s (African garments) selling business for the past two years, selling from door to door. Her potential business is from customers and neighbours. Saumu faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation incurred when moving from door to door. She hopes to become a wholesale supplier in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of Khanga’s for sale. She decided to join Yehu because of its simple procedures to join.

loans.use: To purchase bales of Khanga’s for sale.

loans.name: Arco Iris Group

texts.es: Roberta tiene 49 años D. edad, es socia D. L. Alcancía Comunal “Arco Iris,” elL. es viuda tiene 6 hijos y participa en EDAPROSPO desD. hace 4 años, se dedica al negocio que heredó D. su madre hace diez años: venD. bebidas como: refrescos, gaseosas y agua ardiente que consumen los comuneros D. su zona, también se dedica  a L. ganadería y venta D. queso. El ingreso D. estos le permitió comprar algunos electrodomésticos que le hacían falta en su hogar, también compró un terreno para chacra, actualmente el ingreso D. dichas actividades cubre los gastos D. su hogar. Solicitó el préstamo a EDAPROSPO para comprar comida para los vacunos que elL. cría, Roberta sueña con comprarse un terreno especialmente para criar ganado vacuno. Podemos apreciar en L. fotografía el momento en que se reunieron para su desembolso en las fiestas D. navidad, donD. no pudo asistir  el socio Ámel por motivo D. trabajo.
texts.en: Roberta is 49 years old and a member of the “Arco Iris" township.  She is widowed with 3 children and has participated in EDAPROSPO for 4 years.  She works in the business she inherited from her mother 10 years ago.  She sells beverages such as: soft drinks, soda and hot water consumed by villagers in her area.  She also raises cattle and sells cheese.  This income has allowed her to buy some appliances that were needed at home.  Also, she bought land to farm and the income from such activities cover household expenses.  She is requesting a loan from EDAPROSPO to buy food for the cattle she raises.  Roberta dreams of buying land especially for raising cattle.  We can see in the picture when they met for disbursement in the Christmas holidays, where the partner, Amel was unable to attend because of work.

loans.use: Food for cattle

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en: Andrew is a 72-year-old single father of two children. He lives in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His desire is to set up an income-generating activity for the family. He has been selling goats for five years, and this has helped him to generate money to provide the basics for his children. Andrew needs the loan to buy goats to sell.

loans.use: To buy goats

loans.name: Genie

texts.en: Genie is a married woman who lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store. Her husband, Jonie R., who is 44 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children who are 11 to 20 years old. Genie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Genie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 13,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her ninth loan, she is borrowing PHP 18,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for future family expenses. Genie is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team: http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Ana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Ana tiene 34 años, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Vive en su casa propia en la zona rural del caserío La Victoria, a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Desde hace 10 años, se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pavos. Cría los animales en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo se los ofrece en venta a los negociantes de la zona y al público en general. Aprendió esta actividad de su padre así que conoce a la perfección este rubro. 

Ana desea invertir su capital para adquirir más animales y alimentos balanceados con la finalidad de ampliar sus ventas. Por  ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Ana is 34 years old, single, and doesn't have any children.  She lives in her own home, in the small village of La Victoria, which is in a rural area, twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

For 10 years, Ana has been raising and selling small animals such as turkeys.  She raises the animals in an area behind her home and when they have reached a good level of development, she offers them for sale to traders in the area and to the general public.  She learned the business from her father and so knows it perfectly.

Ana would like to invest her capital in purchasing more animals and balanced feed in order to increase her sales.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To acquire more animals to expand her business

loans.name: Purevhuu

texts.en:
Purevhuu, 29, is married and lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in his father-in-law's backyard. His wife is unemployed and takes care of their two little children. 

He began transporting coal in 2007. He transports coal from a mine that is located close to Ulaanbaatar and sells it at a local market. In the summer he transports goods for various businesses. He wants to work for mining companies in the future as a driver. He is a hardworking and modest person who says, " I want to make more money and buy an apartment in the future". 

He is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to buy spare parts for his truck.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his truck

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel Y. is from the village of San Ramon. He is 35 years old. Joel is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Joel owns & operates a business venture providing transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating motorcycle transport services. Joel has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Joel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joel is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Joel from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay his child's tuition fees.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories.

loans.name: Divina Cajucom's Group

texts.en:
Divina Gracia C. is 47 years old and widowed with five school-aged children. She is from the village of S. P. and is the group leader of “Divina C.'s Group,” a nine-member loan group offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

To make a living, Divina Gracia owns and operates a business raising livestock. Her main source of income comes from raising pigs for breeding. Divina Gracia has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

Divina Gracia joined ASKI in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her first loan from ASKI. Divina Gracia plans to use the additional revenue generated from her loan to pay the tuition fees of her children.


About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and supplies

loans.name: Mukhidin

texts.en:
Mukhidin I. is a hard-working man who feeds his cattle early each day. He started his business with one animal and gradually increased the number of his cattle. Today he has five cattle in his business. 

He is requesting a loan of 7,000 TJS to purchase cattle and expand his business. 

Mukhidin is very grateful to everyone who is helping him achieve success in his business with this loan. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes having been a key post along the Silk Road and having witnessed the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC, and communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Awen Indah Group

texts.en: The nine member Awen Indah Group, led by Ni Komang A., age 20, received a first loan from MUK totaling 13,500,000 Indonesian rupiah (IDR). Each member gets 1,500,000. Ni Komang A. used this loan to buy three piglets at 300,000 IDR per pig, and used the rest to repair the barn. Before getting a loan, she was raising pigs and making a profit of 200,000 to 250,000 IDR. She hopes that with this loan her business will increase and she will make more profit.

loans.use: to buy three piglets.

loans.name: Gombo

texts.en:
Gombo is 52 years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His son goes to a local secondary school. With the help of his wife, Gombo manages a meat and dairy trading business. Generally, his wife is responsible for selling dairy products and Gombo is responsible for selling meat and meat products. He started his business in 2000 after having worked as a carpenter. Since that time, Gombo has managed to stabilize his business and has built a strong customer base. 

Gombo is quite an experienced businessman who knows the unique features of his business very well.  He is a hardworking and open-minded man who is planning to expand his business in the future.
