He says, “I want to save some money for my son’s education.” Gombo is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase inventory for his business.

loans.use: to purchase more meat and dairy products

loans.name: Cristo La Fuente 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Graciela is the coordinator of her group, Cristo la Fuente 1, 2, 3 (Christ the Source). She makes her home in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their 4 children. She says that her most difficult challenge is saving enough money to buy a house and to return to Haiti. In the meantime, she plans to continue to enjoy attending the church.

Graciela is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza. She has had her business for 7 and a half years, and it was started with a loan from a family living here before her in the Dominican Republic. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying more shoes, clothes and cosmetic products to sell. She has been saving her profits because, through this business, she wants to make her dreams come true: to have her own house and to move back to Haiti.

Graciela's group is located in the rural area surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominate the economy.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is now 50 years of age and is married with three adult children. Emily is a farmer working in the Philippines, and she earns 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month. 

Emily is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase feed supply and additional hogs to raise. She manages a hog-raising business and has been doing it for almost five years.

In the future, Emily hopes to improve this kind of business in order to supplement her husband's income to satisfy their daily needs and to save for the future needs of their children. They hope that Kiva lenders will continuously assess them in the business so that they can able to achieve their business goals.

loans.use: to purchase feed supply and additional hogs to raise.

location.town: Brgy. Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Karoti Group

texts.en:
Nimulike, who is in her early thirties, is married with two children. The elder one goes to school.  She has been a food vendor for one year now at a place called Tegeta, some 10 kilometers from the city center. She works from 5am to 5:30pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Nimulike’s 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to increase her capital, and managed to sell more food. She has paid back her loan successfully.  She wants a new loan to buy more food stuff for making more and better quality food.  Her dream is to one day open a shop and sell drinks at wholesale prices.

She will share this loan with her loan group ("Karoti") which has a total of 15 members, who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more food stuff for the food market.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal “Las Natividades” de la Asociación Arariwa.

La socia nació en la ciudad de Huarocondo  (provincia de Anta, departamento del Cusco, Perú) y tiene 34 años de edad, ella está casada y fruto de esta unión tiene cuatro hijos. Las edades de sus hijos de la socia son de 10 años, 8 años, 3 años y de 3 meses de nacido y permanecen en su lado todos. 

Actualmente, la socia vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades comerciales. Ella se dedica a la crianza de animales como chanchos  y también se dedica a preparación del plato típico que se llama Chicharrón. Ella vende su comida en la feria de Inquilapata de la provincia de Anta, en las fiestas patronales y en otras ferias.  

Otra actividad que desarrolla la socia es la compra y venta de maíz. Desde los 8 años la socia se dedica a los negocios pues acompañaba a sus padres pero ahora que es mayor tiene que velar por el bienestar de su familia. En esta oportunidad, la socia requiere el préstamo para comprar chanchos y maíz.
texts.en:
This borrower is a responsible and hard-working person.  For that reason, her friends invited her to join Asociación Arariwa's "Las Natividades" community bank.

The borrower was born in the city of Huarocondo (in Anta province, Cusco department, Peru).  She is 34 years old, married, and has four children from her relationship who are 10, 8, 3 and 3 months.  They all live with her.

The borrower currently lives in the same city in which she was born and this is where she carries out her business.  She raises animals such as pigs and also prepares a traditional dish called 'chicharrón' (fried pork rinds).  She sells her food in Inquilapata market, in Anta province, during town fiestas and also in other markets.

Another business that this borrower is engaged in is buying and selling corn.  She has been in these businesses since she was 8 years old as she used to accompany her parents but, now that she is an adult, she has to look out for the well-being of her own family.  On this occasion, she needs a loan to buy pigs and corn.

loans.use: to buy pigs and corn

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul, aged 29, is married to Leah, and is blessed with one three-year-old child. He runs a boutique which has been in operation for nine years. The business earns him a monthly income of 41,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). 

This is his first loan with KADET Ltd. He will use the loan funds to buy new clothes for sale. He intends to use the anticipated profits to open another boutique and hopes to own a modern fashion house in the future.

loans.use: To buy new clothes for sale

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa is married and has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for a year. Ma. Teresa works hard to support her family.

Ma. Teresa has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell

loans.name: Celedonia

texts.es: La clienta Celedonia dedicada a la venta de ropa en una  de las avenidas mas concurridas en la ciudad ella junto a su nietita salen por la tarde a vender las prendas que durante toda la semana ofrecerán  a la clientela que pase por esa zona, el lugar es concurrido mas por la noche y existe mas venta, es por eso que ambas se quedan hasta altas horas de la noche para poder tener un poco mas de venta y no irse con poco dinero de ganancia, la señora Celedonia debe de encargarse de su nietita ya que a su hija la mama de la nietita con la que vive falleció. El objetivo de la clienta es cuidar y hacer estudiar para así sacarla profesional, ya que ella es su única acompañante. El dinero del credito la utilizara para la compra de ropa de temporada.
texts.en: Celedonia sells clothes in one of the busiest streets of the city. Together with her little granddaughter they leave in the afternoon to sell the clothes that during the whole week they will offer to the clients that pass through this area. This area is busiest at nighttime and there is more opportunity to sell, and for this reason they both stay until the late hours of the night to be able to sell more and not have to leave with only a little bit of money. Celedonia is in charge of the little girl since her daughter, the mother of the granddaughter, passed away. The objective of this client is to care for and make sure the little girl studies so that she can be a professional, since she is her only companion. She will use the money from the loan to purchase the latest season of clothing.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for the upcoming season to sell

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru:
Рустам более 14 лет занимается бизнесом. Он начал свой бизнес с куплей продажей детских одежд, а потом перешел на изготовления и продажа сырого кирпича. Он хочет содержит свою семью в хороших условиях и устроит своих детей в школах. В этом бизнесе помогает ему его старший сын, который составляет ему 16 лет. Рустам хочет расширить свой бизнес и покупать необходимое сырьё для изготовления кирпича. Этот займ будет 4 циклом, который он получает от Имон Интернэшнл. Все займи, который он получал, дал ему хороший прибыл и расширился бизнес. Рустам благодарен Киве и Кива кредиторов за их поддержку и поощрения.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Rustam has had his own business for over 14 years.  He started his business with buying and selling children's clothing and then transitioned into making and selling raw bricks.  He wants to provide good living conditions for his family and place his children into schools.  His oldest son, who is 16 years old, helps him with this business.  Rustam wants to expand his business and buy the necessary materials for making bricks.  This will be his fourth loan from Imon International.  All of the previous loans helped him make good profits and expand his business.  Rustam is grateful to Kiva and Kiva creditors for their help and support.

loans.use: to purchase materials for brick making

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana es natural de la zona de Cullpa Alta, lugar donde vive actualmente. Su vida siempre ha sido el campo, pues sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar en esta actividad, es así que la agrícultura y ganadería han sido parte de su vida y lo serán, más aún que gracias a éste trabajo puede sostener y educar a sus hijos. Es así que cada día se dedica a la crianza de vacas y toros, pues los compra cuando están tiernos para luego encargarse de su alimentación y al cabo de un tiempo alcanzan el peso exacto para ser vendidos y a un mejor precio. Del mismo modo sucede con las vacas a diferencia que primero son fertilizadas, para obtner las crías y extraer la leche. Su deseo de Ana es isntalar una pequeña empresa de producción de leche, y para ello se esta capacitando. Por otro lado, también se dedica a la siembra de papa, maíz, trigo, cebada y olluco, considerandolo de ser un trabajo que requiere de mucho esfuerzo. Es será su crédito número 13 que esta solicitando a MFP, ya que espera comprar más animales y sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Ana is a native of the District of Cullpa Alta and currently resides there.  Her life has always been spent in the fields since her parents taught her everything about farming and raising livestock since this was and would always be how they earned their living.  Thanks to her work, Ana is able to support her children and provide them with an education.  Each day is spent raising cows and bulls.  She buys these animals as young calves and then feeds them until they reach the exact weight so that they can be sold for a good price.  However, the difference is that she holds on to the cows for breeding and milk production.  Ana’s wish is to start a small milk production business since she is receiving training on how to do this.  In addition to raising cattle, she grows potatoes, corn, wheat, barley, and ulluco.  She considers farming to be a job that requires much effort.  

This will be the 13th loan that she has requested from MFP.  She plans to buy more animals and sacks of compost.

loans.use: to buy cattle and sacks of compost.

loans.name: Nhạnh's Group

texts.en: Nhạnh owns and operates a business making and selling dried goods in her community. She is a 62-year-old woman living in the Yên Phong district, Bac Ninh province. Nhạnh is married and has four grown-up children. Nhạnh has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,500,000 dong (VND) a month. In 2009, Nhạnh joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and enable her to engage in business activities. Nhạnh has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,840,000 VND from SEDA which was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She is now requesting a new loan of 8,736,000 VND which will again be used to purchase raw ingredients. This will be her third loan from SEDA. Nhạnh plans to save the additional revenue generated from the business as a reserve for future emergencies. Nhạnh is the leader of a four-member group accessing a loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Yen Hau. About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. Nhàn is a 28-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising pigs. 2. Sinh is a 44-year-old man who is requesting a 8,736,000 VND loan to support his business raising chickens, swans and ducks. 3. Thúy is a 34-year-old woman who is requesting a 8,736,000 VND loan to support her business raising pigs and chickens.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en:
Hebert is a 40-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 10 years to 15 years. He describes himself as a visionary. 

He operates a retail store where he sells school bags, sauce pans, basins, mattresses and more. He has been involved in this business for three years and employs one staff member. His business is located in a shopping center. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be inflation. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to increase his stock of general items. His goal is to grow his business to wholesale within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will purchase a van to facilitate running of the business.

loans.use: to purchase mattresses for resale

loans.name: Raeli

texts.en:
Raeli is a farmer in South Rift, Kenya. She is 57 and has been in active farming for 15 years. Her farm produces potatoes, tea and eggs for the local market. She is married, with 6 adult children.

Raeli (pictured above with one of her dairy cows) has made a loan request of 20,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her buy poultry birds to boost her poultry  farming . She says the business will grow with additional poultry from the loan and make her family members' lives better, as they will have food security with increased income.  She laments the fact that she can only get poor prices for the farm produce.

loans.use: To buy more poultry birds

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys, a married mother of one child, was educated to the junior high level. Married to a driver, she sells kenkey and will use the loan to purchase more maize to prepare banku. Gladys with reinvest into her enterprise the new profits arising from the loan.

(The photo shows Gladys with her hand placed on the corn dough she will be using for the kenkey).

loans.use: to purchase more maize to prepare banku.

loans.name: Glenda Marisol

texts.es: Glenda Marisol D. treinta y uno años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida y  sus hijos. Ella posee una venta D. medicina natural para todo tipo D. enfermedades gripe, dolor D. cabeza, dolor D. espalda y otros, se ha hecho D. muy buena clientela, pues venD. medicina D. muy buena calidad y con buenos resultados, a un precio realmente accesible, además que el servicio que les ofrece es inigualable; Glenda es una mujer dedicada a su negocio siempre dispuesta a superarse a si misma, su mayor secreto es la perseverancia y la entrega en su labor, quiere mantenerse adelante D. la competencia es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar jarabes, pastillas, ampolletas, suero, vitaminas etc. Glenda Marisol tiene la confianza que D. esta forma le dará a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Glenda Marisol, 30, lives with her life partner and their children. She sells natural medicine for all kinds of ailments: colds, headaches, backaches and others. She has a very good clientele since she sells high quality medicine that has good results at a truly accessible price. As well she offers unparalleled service.

Glenda is a woman who is dedicated to her business. She is always ready to surpass herself. Her greatest secret is perseverance and self-sacrifice in her work. She wants to keep ahead of the competition and for this reason she has requested a loan from INTEGRAL so that she can buy cough syrup, pills, vials, powdered whey, vitamins, etc. Glenda Marisol is confident that in this way she will give her family a full life.

loans.use: to buy cough syrup, pills, vials, powdered whey and vitamins.

loans.name: Ana Beatriz

texts.es:
La Señora Ana es socia del banco comunal Estrellitas, vive por el sector de Totoracocha en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad tiene una mezcla entre lo colonia y la moderno, sus amplios paisajes naturales, la variedad en su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños, su gente quienes son cálidos y amables hacen de esta ciudad hermosa y muy hospitalaria.

Doña Ana tiene 46 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 27, 20 y 11 años de edad, su primera hija es casada y vive independiente, su segundo hijo trabaja para sus gastos personales y su último hijo estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión fotógrafo, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
La Señora Ana se dedica a la venta ambulantemente de limpiones de cocina, en esta actividad se encuentra hace 5 años y trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.

En el banco comunal se encuentra en el treceavo crédito y lo va a  invertir en la compra de limpiones de cocina para temporada  de navidad.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the "Estrellitas" communal bank. She lives in the Totoracocha area of the city of Cuenca. This city is a mixture of the colonial and the modern, with vast natural landscapes. The variety of its cuisine captivates the palate of locals and visitors. Its people, who are warm and friendly, make this a beautiful and very hospitable city. 

Ana is 46, married, with three children, ages 27, 20 and 11, Her eldest daughter is married and lives independently. Her second child works in order to cover her personal expenses, and her youngest child goes to a small school in the city.  Her husband is a professional photographer. They don't have their own house, so they live in rented accommodation. 

Ana sells kitchen cloths in the street. She has done this for five years, and works from Sunday to Sunday with no fixed hours. 

She is on her 13th loan with the communal bank, and she is going to use it to buy kitchen cloths for the Christmas season. 

Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: To buy kitchen cloths.

loans.name: Umoja B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Umoja B Group in Western Kenya! Christine is the facilitator of the Umoja B group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Christine takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund to access the firm's best prices offered and to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds to ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, she had a good maize yield harvesting 14 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, she was only able to harvest six bags of maize on one acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Christine and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from her maize sales, she will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Umoja B group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a cosmetics business in the Philippines. 

She will borrow PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more items like body lotion, perfume and cosmetics for her cosmetics business.

Helen has been in this business for four years.  She earns most of her income from clothing sales.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF.  She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items like body lotion, perfume and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Barrio Florida Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de de la ciudad de Encarnación surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la Fundación. Actualmente el grupo se encuentra en el quinto ciclo, opera con la Fundación desde el año 2010. Todas las mujeres realizan actividades independientes como así también actividades en grupo para fomentar su compañerismo.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Nancy, ella tiene 3 hijos, esta acompañada con el Sr. Omar. Comenta que se dedica hace varios años a la venta de ropas, en lo cual le va muy bien, puesto que siempre tiene mucha variedad de prendas, lo cual atrae a más clientes. Dice que desea seguir creciendo y es por ello que solicita el crédito, ya que desea comprar prendas de verano para poder estar abastecida para esta época que viene.
Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad de progreso que se les da.
texts.en:
This group from the city of Encarnación arose through the contact of one of the members with the Foundation. Now the group is in its fifth loan cycle and has been working with the Foundation since 2010. All the women have independent business activities as well as activities in their group to promote good fellowship.

One of the members of the group is Señora Nancy. She has three children. Her partner is Sr. Omar. She comments that she has worked for several years selling clothing, which has gone very well for her, since she always has a great variety of items, which attracts more customers. She says that she wants to continue growing, and this is why she is applying for the loan, since she wants to buy summer clothing so that she will be stocked for the coming season. She is thankful to the foundation and to Kiva for giving them the opportunity to progress.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Tasleem Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Tasleem Kosar is a 30 year old woman involved in the sewing business. Her work is home based. She does this work to financially support her husband. She is a very talented woman. She sews dresses with perfect measurement. Her clients are very satisfied with her performance and they give her regular orders every month. 

Her husband and her brother-in-law are involved in a dairy business. They have buffaloes at home from which they get milk and earn income. Earlier, they worked together but now her brother-in-law has started his dairy business independently. Her husband taught him and guided him a lot in this business and feels happy to see him working with great dedication.
 
Tasleem Kosar has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the growth of her brother-in-law’s business. He will use the loan to buy a buffalo to get milk for reselling. She is hopeful that he will be established with his business after the loan investment. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Tasleem Kosar”.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for the dairy business.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is 40 years old. She is married and has three children aged three, six and nine. She runs a beauty salon to earn a living. She has been in this business for ten years. She earns extra income from her farming activities. Since she joined Faulu Kenya she has been able to save her income. She hopes to educate her children and be financially stable in the future. She has applied for a loan of 10,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a hair-drying machine and weaves.

loans.use: To buy a hair-drying machine and weaves.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. Felisa has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for nine years. 

She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Felisa has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Felisa hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods,snacks and beverages

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is one of those young smallholder farmers who are determined and are not limited by their age. He is an ever smiling youthful 22-year-old farmer from Endebes, a remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya. Paul is elegant and admirable in spirit and effort. He is a role model, a mentor, and an inspiration to many young farmers in his village because of his resilience despite personal challenges and his passion to support his parents and siblings as a primary source of income. The living conditions in the Endebes, Kitale area are very tough and one needs to have tough skin in order to survive. Paul has always shown the resilience to beat all odds. Because of the hardcore poverty in his village, Paul started practicing mixed farming and has been doing it for the past 3 years. Paul's sources of income are from producing vegetables, maize, and eggs. These products are very perishable and require timely delivery to the market, which is a problem for Paul. The Endebes area has a poor road network and poor feeder roads that really hamper timely delivery of products to the market. Paul with great humility is kindly seeking a loan to buy a motorbike. With the motorbike he will deliver products to the market on time and reap more profits because the products will still be fresh. Paul is very determined to succeed, and because he is much disciplined with finances, he plans to accumulate profits to provide a secure future for himself and for his parents and siblings. Paul's dream is to provide a secure future for his siblings. Through your loan you will help him realize his dream. Paul promises to make his payments punctually and is thankful to all those who will support him in acquiring the motorbike, all he can tell them is "Thank You".

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for speedy delivery of farm produce to the market.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: 55 летняя Фотима, из города Исфара. Она разведена с мужем и вырастила сына одна. Ее сыну 21 лет. Он хороший, самостоятельный и заботливый. Сын Фотимы занимается мастером по ремонту домов. Сама Фотима после развода начала зарабатывать на жизнь. Она сейчас занимается шитьем женской одежды у себя дома. У него имеется больше клиентов, и ее все знает. Фотима опытная и  талантливая мастерица. Она планирует отремонтировать свой дом и улучшить жилищные условия. Она нуждается в помощи. Фотима просит кредит для купли стройматериалы и другие принадлежности.

loans.use: Для купли стройматериалы и другие принадлежности.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy goes to the rural communities and buys agricultural produce from farmers and sells them to urban workers in a market near Accra. Mercy does not have a market stall of her own. She would like to rent one since she sells in an open space near a major road which poses some danger and risk to her income generating activity. After participating in Kraban Support Foundation\'s TEACH lending programs she has plans to have a stall with KIVA loan to enable her keep her business records in her own apartment devoid of any hazard. She wants a  credit  facility of $875

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is 28 years old and single. She takes care of her two sisters. Her parents are dead. Their death prompted her to drop out of school and take care of her family. Cecilia owns a pharmacy selling medicine in the Vingunguti area of Dar es Salaam. The Vingunguti area is a squatter area with no proper sewage systems. Her business has a higher turnover of drugs for malaria and waterborne diseases. Her business is licenced by the local authorities. Cecilia wants to improve her business by adding to her stock of medicines. This would require additional funding of USD 550.

loans.use: to add to her stock of medicines

loans.name: Hai

texts.en: Hai and her husband were born in 1980. They have a daughter who is one year old. Her husband is a farmer who has 1000 square meters land of rice. Hai has a grocery store at home. Their income is $11 per person/month. They hope to get a loan of $75 to supply for her grocery store. They promise to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: Supplying for the grocery store.

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda has a business selling delicious sweets from a small space at one of the busy markets in Zaporoshye, Ukraine. She sells a variety of small cookies and candy. Nadezhda’s business does well as there are not many other vendors who have the product selection that she does. She has been in business for 15 years, and has gained much experience and many happy customers along the way.

Nadezhda makes about $300 a month in profits which helps to support herself and her husband. In the future she hopes to be able to help her grandchildren financially as well. Nadezhda has requested a short-term loan of $300 to help her purchase more product inventory for her business.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory for her confectionary business

loans.name: Faataape

texts.en: Faataape P. has been a member of Mulivai Leauvaa centre for a long time. She is now 63 years old. She has a very big banana plantation worked by her husband and some of her sons. She joined our program in 2006 when she needed help for her family and her plantation. She plans to pay off her loan of $300.00 and then apply for another loan of $500.00 to buy more stuff for her plantation and for her family expenses.

loans.use: To buy more chemicals, knives, and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more electronic goods and clothes for sale.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah Ezekieh is 39 years old. She is married and has four children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells children's clothing. She has been in business since 2003. She is in need of $875 to enable her to buy more children's clothing for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: Buy more children's clothing for sale.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a single mother who supports herself and her child with a small business selling footwear at an outdoor market in Mukachevo, Ukraine. Eva is an energetic, hard-working entrepreneur. She has had her own business for about four years. There is good, stable demand for the shoes and boots Eva sells.

The colder season in Ukraine means higher sales of warm and stylish winter boots. Eva has requested a loan of $600 to broaden her assortment of available inventory so she can meet customer demand and continue making a good profit.

loans.use: Purchase inventory for her little shoe business

loans.name: Ferhada

texts.en: Ferhada is 19 years old and is not married. She lives in Vardi, a little village near Zenica. She re-sells clothes at the market. Ferhada wants to use this loan for purchasing additional clothing in order to improve her sales and increase her monthly income. She thinks this will  help her to find her niche at the market because she is new in this job.

loans.use: Purchasing  additional clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Mukuba North D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Bayati M.. She is currently in the business of produce trading and is requesting a loan to expand busines. Bayati is 45 years old and is divorced. She has 6 children ranging from age 11 to 25 and her children go to school. Each week, Bayati makes approximately UGX 7000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to constrcut a house Bayati has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to invest in business and the loan was paid back on time.

Bayati is joined in her small group by Justine N., Rebecca M., Martha T., and Rehema N.. Justine N. has a business in beauty salon and wants to purchase a hair dryer. Rebecca M. is currently operating a business in clothing sales and wants a loan to add in business. Martha T. operates a business of selling clothes and wants to re-invest in business. Rehema N. is currently in the business of selling potatoes and is requesting a loan to purchase in large amounts.

loans.use: To add more working capital in produce business

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
A. Esi is a trader. She travels to a distant town to buy Gary and other food items for sale. Her business is doing very well and she wishes to increase sales. She is married and has 3 children.

She is requesting a loan of $425 as additional capital to buy more food items to sell.

loans.use: To buy more food items to sell

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is an entrepreneur from Kherson. She runs a business selling women’s clothing in the central market. Focused, committed, and known for her integrity, Irina carries an excellent reputation among both clients and entrepreneurs in her region. With her excellent work ethic, Irina has multiplied her turnover capital since she opened her business three years ago. She is now making about $2200 in net profit each month.

Currently, Irina is seeking a loan of 2500 Grivnas ($US525) to re-stock her inventory of seasonal clothing. With her additional income, she plans to continue supporting her family and develop her business. Irina is very responsible and orderly in everything she does. She can always handle competition with decency and honesty. We believe her business integrity as well as the previous 10 loans she has promptly repaid to Nadiya Ukraine characterize her as a client capable of current loan repayment.

loans.use: Purchase inventory and seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Elbrus

texts.en: Elbrus K. is a 50-year-old man who sells dairy products such as milk and yogurt in the southern region of the Bilasuvar Internally Displaced People Settlement. He has more than 20 years of experience in this field. His main financial source is selling dairy products to local people and to the local milk factory. His current income is just enough to cover his family's basic needs. As well, much of the dairy products Elbrus keeps in the family, which uses the milk and yogurt as their main everyday meal. He decided to purchase two calves for $400 USD each and raise them as milk cows. The raising period of a middle-size calf takes approximately two to three months.

loans.use: To purchase two calves for milk cows.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Ms Felicita is a member of the communal bank Sol Naciente, located in the Jr. Augusto B Laguia 1098, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali She is 58 years old and is the mother of 6 children, her husband is merchant, but their income is not sufficient for the expenses of the home, so Ms Felicita with the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decided to invest on a small restaurant. Currently she sells meals at night, for which she gets up at at 7 o'clock in the morning, prepares her husbands breakfast and then begins with the preparation of the food she sells from 5 pm. to the 10 pm. With this loan of S/. 2500 which will be paid in 4 months, she bought sugar, rice, condiments, coal, eggs, olives, oil, seasonings, all for the preparation of the meals. Ms Felicita is a very hard-working woman, who even with the support of her children, she still desires to do well on her business so she can continue to feel proud of being a woman and mother.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Felicita pertenece al Banco Comunal Sol Naciente, ubicado en el Jr. Augusto B Laguia 1098, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 58 años y es madre de 6 hijos, su esposo es comerciante, pero los ingresos económicos con los que cuenta no son suficientes para la canasta familiar, es así que Felicita con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en un pequeño negocio de venta de comidas. En la actualidad ella cuenta un negocio de venta de comidas en las noches, para lo cual se levanta a las 7 am, para preparar el desayuno de su esposo, de allí se dedica a la preparación de sus comidas para venderlos en las tardes desde las 5 pm. hasta las 10 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 2500 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, compro azúcar, arroz, hojas de bijao, carbón, huevos, aceitunas, aceite, condimentos, etc. Para la preparación de sus comidas. Felicita es una mujer muy trabajadora, que a pesar de contar con el apoyo de sus hijos ella desea salir adelante a base de su propio trabajo y esfuerzo para sentirse orgullosa de ser mujer y madre.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients

loans.name: Melita Gayle

texts.es:
Melita is a very hard-working mother. She has a daughter who is in school and who is her inspiration to get ahead. Melita is a single mother and is very happy with her young daughter, who loves her very much.

Melita has been dedicated to transporting passengers for 6 years. She owns a motorcar and doesn't need a driver because she is a great driver herself and takes good care of her motorcar. She works from 5 a.m. until 6 p.m. without resting, for the only reason of giving her small daughter what she needs so she doesn't lack anything. The loan that she is requesting will be used to have her motorcar repaired, to continue working, and to buy another motorcar in the future to give a job to someone who needs it.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Melita es una madre muy trabajadora, tiene una hija que está estudiando y es su inspiración para seguir adelante. Melita es madre soltera y es muy feliz con su pequeña hija, quien la ama mucho. Melita se dedica al transporte de pasajeros desde hace 6 años, es propietaria de un motocarro, no necesita de un chofer, ya que ella misma es una gran conductora y lo cuida muy bien. Trabaja desde las 5:00 de la mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde, sin descansar, por la sola razón de darle a su pequeña hija lo necesario y que no le falte nada. El préstamo que solicita es para mandar a reparar su motocarro, para continuar trabajando y más adelante comprarse otro para dar oportunidad de trabajo a quien lo necesite.

loans.use: To repair her motorcar to continue with her transportation service.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is married with two children, Olena who is 10 and Vladislav who is 8. She is an entrepreneur from Novyi Rozdyl. Nataliya sells women's clothing items in a local market which is the only big marketplace in her small home town.

Nataliya has had rich experience working in the sphere of sales because she started as a salesperson. She decided to take a chance and launch her own enterprise one year ago and has enjoyed every second of being self-employed. Presently, Nataliya has about US$ 1800 of gross income each month.

Nataliya is seeking a 3000 Grivna loan to purchase additional merchandise, e.g., T-shirts and sweaters, for this fall season. She is hoping to purchase a vending kiosk to run her business more efficiently and facilitate her sales. Nataliya is very responsible and perseverant. We believe her strategic planning and prudence will help her achieve her business goals as well as her individual goals in life.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise for re-sale

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret G. is 50 years old, married and has four children, all of whom are still in school. For the last three years, she has made a living selling products like rice, fresh tomatoes, canned tomatoes, cocoa, skimmed milk, body pomade and biscuits in the market at  Nankese a suburb of Koforidua, Ghana. Her experience in trading has made her one of the most successful people in this market. She considers the loan as a great opportunity to expand her business to include other items frequently demanded by customers, such as cartons of milk, bags of sugar, boxes of vegetables, assorted containers of biscuits and palm oil. Margaret G. belongs to a loan group called Nyame Mma (or God's Children). In this group, members help each other repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy milk, sugar, vegetables, biscuits and palm oil to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha has been selling kanga in the Jang'ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar for two years. Kanga is a local fabric common throughout Tanzania, with any of a variety of elaborate patterns and many bright colors. Kanga is used for clothing, curtains, table cloths, baby slings, and many other daily household needs. The fabric Asha is wearing on her head in the photo above is a kanga.

Asha works daily from 8:00am to 5:00pm and is able to earn a profit of approximately $13 each month. She sells each kanga for between $2.50 and $4. She is requesting her first loan so that she can expand her inventory and increase her profit.

Asha is 30 years old, single, and has no chldren.

loans.use: To buy more kanga for her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase wheat seeds

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Mrs. Sim E. is a farmer in Kos Roka Krauv village in Kampong Cham province. She owns a plot of land to cultivate vegetables to earn a living. In the plantation, she faces some problems because she does not have enough money to support the field to make her crop more productive. In order to improve her living standards, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and hoses for a pump to water her field. She is a 46-year-old widow of three children, two of whom are farmers who help their mother on the plantation, while the other is a motorbike repairer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides, and hoses for a pump to water her field.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha vende productos de una marca de cosméticos. Hace tres años una amiga la animo a dedicar se a este negocio, poco tiempo después ella se dio cuenta de que era mas rentable que su actual trabajo ene se entonces y dedicó inscribirse para la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo.
Anteriormente ella vendía comida, se dedicaba a hacer repartos según los pedidos que recibía; sin embargo, muchos de sus clientes no eran puntuales con el pago y tenían muchas deudas. Este motivo la convenció de cambiarse de negocio.

Por las tardes, ella dedica su tiempo en la atención del restaurante de una amiga suya. Por ahora las ganancias las ahorra para poder en un futuro terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Bertha sells products for a well-known cosmetics brand. Three years ago, a friend encouraged her to try her hand at the business and she soon realized that it was more profitable than the work she was doing at the time. It was then that she committed herself to buying beauty products from catalogs and reselling them to her customers. Before that, she sold and delivered prepared meals. Many of her customers failed to pay her promptly, though, and had large debts. That's why she decided to switch to selling beauty products. During afternoons, Bertha works in a friend's restaurant. Now she is saving her earnings so that she can one day finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita S. is a 51-year-old mother of 4 children and has a dress shop. She cuts and sews fabrics to make clothes for her customers in her home. Perlita started this business in 1980. It has sustained her and her family all this time. She originally invested Php 6,000 in her dress making business because she loved to sew. From her profits, she has been able to send her children to school and buy all her personal needs.

She is asking for a loan of Php 6,000 to buy additional tailoring materials. She will also use the loan to start another business. She is working very hard to achieve a good quality of life for her family. She especially dreams of sending her children to school one day.

CEVI is a field partner of KIVA in the Philippines. CEVI helps more people sustain their businesses by providing credit assistance, training, and insurance services.

loans.use: Buy more sewing supplies

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane is 36 years old, married, and has 4 children. She sells foodstuffs. She hopes for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She says "thanks" to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase provisions and foodstuffs

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario tiene 41 años, está separada de su pareja, vive con sus 4 hijos; Victor de 23 años, Esther de 14, Estrella de 11 y Franco de 6 en su propia casa. Ella es una mujer muy alegre y carismática, su buen humor ha logrado que se desenvuelva en variedad de oficios; como en la venta de ropa, actividad que dejó de realizar porque la alejaba del contacto con los niños, con los cuales le encanta trabajar, es así que actualmente gracias a lo ahorrado tiene un puesto de golosinas cerca de un colegio muy conocido del distrito de Ancón en la ciudad de Lima. Muchas veces se pone una nariz de payaso y así atrae la atención de los niños vendiendo su mercadería entre bromas y juegos, haciendo que su puesto siempre esté repleto de niños a la hora del recreo y a la salida. Además, también tiene un negocio paralelo que es la animación de eventos infantiles, labor que mayormente realiza los fines de semana con gran alegría ya que a Rosario le encantan los niños, pues para ella son seres llenos de energía que te transmiten alegria y ganas de vivir, no como los adultos que siempre paran preocupados y serios, es por eso que todos su trabajos siempre tienden a ser para niños. Rosario quiere, en el futuro, tener más puestos de golosinas en los otros 4 colegios de la zona y así generar trabajo a otras personas y mejores ingresos para su familia. Hace varios años que viene trabajando con MFP, pero este es su primer préstamo individual y espera ser tan puntual como lo fue en su banco comunal. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de golosinas y con la otra parte quiere ayudar a su hijo Victor en el negocio que tiene de venta de CDs.
texts.en:
Rosario is 41 years old, separated from her partner, and lives in her own home with her four children: Victor, 23 years old; Esther, 14 years old; Estrella, 11 years old; and Franco who is 6. She is a very happy and charismatic woman, and her good sense of humor has helped her get by very well in a variety of activities, such as selling clothing. She stopped selling clothes because it kept her too far from contact with her children, who she loves to work with.

Now, thanks to her savings, she has a little candy shop close to a very well known school in the district of Ancón in Lima. She often puts on a clown nose in order to attract children, selling her candy with jokes and games, making sure her shop is always full of children at recess time and when school lets out. She also has another business, which is animation for children's parties, which she primarily does with great joy on the weekends. Rosario loves children, and for her they are beings full of energy that transmit joy and a thirst for life, unlike adults who are always worried and serious. This is why her work always tends to have something to do with children.

Rosario wants, in the future, to have more candy shops near the other four schools in the area to be able to create jobs for other people, as well as a better income for her family. She has been working with MFP for a number of years, but this is her first individual loan and she hopes to be as punctual with her payments as she was with her group loans. With the money she is requesting she will buy more candy, and with some of the money she wants to help her son with his CD sales business.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Salomé

texts.fr:
G. Salomé est née le 01/06/1959 à Djougou au Nord Ouest du Bénin. Salomé est mariée à BASSAN Louis, elle a cinq (5) enfants avec son mari, tous scolarisés. seuls trois (3)enfants restent encore à la charge de Salomé et son mari. Salomé est dactylographe de formation. Salomé a exercé la dactylographie jusqu'en 1994 où elle fut sortie de la fonction publique. C'est alors que Salomé s'est mise à faire de petit commerce. Salomé achète et revend les fournitures scolaires. Puis Salomé a diversifié son activité à la vente des articles de mercerie (boutons, fils à coudre, popelines, etc.). Salomé a déjà eu deux prêts de ALIDé. Salomé sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé pour renforcer son activité afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
G. Salomé was born on June 1, 1959 in Djougou in northwest Benin. She is married to BASSAN Louis, and with her husband, she has five children, all schooled. Only three children are still supported by her and her husband. Salomé is a typist by training and worked at it until 1994, when she left the public sector. This is why she got started in small-scale commerce. She bought and resold school supplies. Then she diversified her business by selling sewing supplies (buttons, thread, popelines, etc.) Salomé has already had two Alidé loans before and is requesting a third loan in order to bolster her business, so as to satisfy her customers better.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for micro-loan recipients.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy packets of thread, rolls of popeline, boxes of notebooks, and boxes of pens

loans.name: Shahlohon

texts.ru: В свои 34 года Шахлохон уже имеет 4 детей. Муж работает в колхозе, дополнительно занимается разными видами бизнеса. Шахлохон воспитывает детей дома, кроме этого занимается откормом скота дома. Так как она с детства знает как выращивать скот сейчас это у нее не вызывает затруднений. Скот растет быстро и приносит хорошую прибыль. Сейчас она планирует приобрести маленького бычка и просит займ для этого.
texts.en:
At 34 Shahlohon has already four children. Her husband works for a collective farm and is involved in different businesses in addition. Shahlohon is a stay-at-home mother but she also tends to the cattle. Since she has been tending to cattle since childhood, this is easy for her. The cattle grows fast and brings good profit. Shahlohon is applying for a loan in order to puchase a little bull calf.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase a bull calf

loans.name: Naseem Raheem Baksh Group

texts.en:
Naseem baji is a citizen of Multan, Pakistan. Her husband's name is R. B.. He runs a boutique in the clothing market. Naseem baji helps him by preparing embroidered dresses that he can display in the boutique. Naseem baji is applying for a loan to buy materials like cloth, colored thread and designs. Multan is famous for its shrines and for its sweetmeat. People come from different cities to Multan with the belief that their wishes will come true if they visit the shrines.

Naseem baji is the leader of a group with four other women from her locality. Sajida baji and Jamila baji both want a loan to buy similar embroidery materials for their boutique. Shabana baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her dairy business. Pathani baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy embroidery materials

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta D. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 69 years old, is married, and has six adult children. Antonieta owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products. Antonieta has been engaged in this business for over 40 years and earns approximately 1,200 PHP a month.

In 2000, Antonieta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Antonieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. She used this previous loan to purchase additional products to sell. Antonieta is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP that she will also use to purchase additional products. This loan will be her 24th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Brasia

texts.en:
Brasia K. has a small business in Iringa, Tanzania selling charcoal and firewood. By working twelve-hour days, she is able to earn 60,000 Tsh, which is approximately $46, per month. She has been doing this kind of business for over five years and, especially since she has three children to support, wants to improve her business and her life.

By taking a loan from BRAC Tanzania of 200,000 Tsh, Brasia hopes to increase her profits and be able to put both capital and more of her profits back into her small business. 

Brasia is 35 years old, married, and her three children are aged 15, 12, and 10. This is her first loan from BRAC.

loans.use: To use for business expansion

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 24-year-old Rosemary Mshumbus from Mwannza. She is married and supports one dependent who is an orphan. Rosemary has run a beauty saloon since 2008 -- a place where customers can come to buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, or hair in various colors, and then have it attached to their heads, woven, cut, or braided so that it looks like their own. She works at her business for seven hours per day, seven days per week, and earns about $240 a month. She is requesting a loan of $400 to buy hair, weaves and other items. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Rosemary thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy hair and other items for a beauty parlor.

loans.name: Meth

texts.en:
Meth S., age 49, has been involved with her business sewing on her own in Battambong Province since 2006. Typically, she makes US$4 per day. S. and her husband work very hard all day to ensure a comfortable standard of living for their family. They are blessed to have four children: three of them are enrolled in a local school, and the oldest one is employed at a gas station. S.'s husband is a teacher at a public school in their village and makes approximately US$1 per day.

S. wants to take out a loan of US$1,000 US to purchase a new motorbike for her husband; and with the remainder, she wants to use it to repair her house. She hopes that a new motorbike will allow her husband to go to work much easier and thus generate more income for their family.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike for her husband and to repair her house

loans.name: Eugenio Benedigto

texts.es:
Eugenio tiene 48 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, a cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace tres años tiene una bodega - tienda que administra junto a su esposa en donde venden abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, aceite), con este pequeño negocio ellos sustentan a su familia e invierten en la educación de sus tres hijos.

Debido a los continuos gastos que genera la educación de sus tres hijos, se han visto en la necesidad de ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas productos que vender así como de mostradores, por esto ha solicitado por primera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito de 2500 nuevos soles.

Eugenio anhela seguir sacando adelante a su familia con este negocio y desea que sus hijos puedan tener un mejor futuro estudiando carreras técnicas o profesionales; el goza de muy buenas referencias personales con vecinos de la zona, los cuales lo consideran como un padre responsable y trabajador.
texts.en:
Eugenio is 48 years old, married, and lives with his wife and three children. They live in the district of José Leonardo Ortiz located five minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

For three years, he’s had a warehouse-store that he manages with his wife. They sell groceries and products of basic necessity (rice, sugar, oil). This small business makes it possible for them to support their family and invest in their children’s education.

Due to the ongoing costs of their children’s education, they need to expand their business. They will purchase counters and additional products for the store. This is the reason for requesting this loan of $875 (2500 nuevos soles).

Eugenio wants to continue to get his family ahead with this business and hopes that his children can have a better future studying technical or professional careers. He has very good personal references from his neighbors who consider him a responsible and hard working father.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products of basic necessity for his store

loans.name: Flista's Group

texts.en:
Flista, 45, is the leader of her lending group in Mubende. She is a married lady with three children. Flista also takes care of five dependents as well.

Flista has a retail shop in Kiruuma that has been running for seven years. She is able to make 50,000 profit a week. She is a friendly and very hard working lady. She has a dream of transforming her retail shop into a whole sale shop to sell more and make more profits. She also strives to build a good family house for her children and the rest of those she cares for.

Flista is also a farmer and since it is a rainy season, she would like to buy quality seeds and employ manpower to clear the farm land for fresh planting. She has a strong drive to succeed.

loans.use: Buy quality seeds and employ manpower on her farm.

loans.name: Walita

texts.en:
Walita O. is from the city of Tinago, Ozamiz City. She is 55 years old. Walita is married and has 5 adult-aged children.

To make a living, Walita owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling "banana cue" food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling banana snack to the local community. Walita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Walita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Walita is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Walita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “Cuturapi”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 39 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 02 hijos, La señora Rosa estudio educación primaria completa, vive en el Barrio 24 de Junio Cuturapi.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 9 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que invirtió la compra de repuestos de autos.

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra adornos para autos los trae directamente de Lima, la señora Rosa también se dedica a la cría de ganado mayor y engorde.

Su deseo es poner una tienda de auto partes en Juliaca.

A ella le gustan las reuniones donde se divierte mucho y comparte sus experiencias.

loans.use: Para la compra de adornos para autos.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La socia Norma, pertenece al banco comunal “KANTU SAN JERONIMO”; nuestra socia es natural de la ciudad del  Cusco.

Nuestra socia  tiene 41 años de edad, ella es soltera,  la socia  es dueña de una tienda abarrotes, ella está en este tipo de comercio desde hace muchos años, conociendo íntegramente el manejo de su negocio, nuestra socia desea implementar su tienda y hacerla más productiva, la socia requiere el préstamo para así poder reinvertir en su negocio y comprar más mercadería para abastecer de productos su tienda.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo que le brindan mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member Norma belongs to the Kantu San Jerónimo Community Bank and is a native of the city of Cusco.

Norma is 41 years old, single, and owns a grocery store. She has been in this type of commerce for many years, understanding intimately how to manage her business. She wishes to expand her store and make it more productive. She needs a loan to reinvest in her business and buy more merchandise to supply her store with products.

Norma appreciates and values the loan which is being offered through this means, and she commits herself to make her payments in the time established.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO RESUPPLY HER GROCERY STORE

loans.name: Rubith

texts.es: Rubith es una persona dinámica y  trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 27 años, está casada y es madre de un menor de edad. Su esposo es obrero de construcción. Rubith  se dedica a la venta de zapatos, actividad que realiza junto con su mamá, este negocio funciona en su casa. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Corazón de Jesús” desde hace dos años. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que invirtió en  la compra de zapatos para vender. Actualmente,requiere un crédito de 1200 soles, monto que invertirá en la compra de zapatos, que trae desde la ciudad de Lima. La meta de Rubith es tener un taller de costura.
texts.en:
Rubith, 27, is a dynamic, hard-working person. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She is married and the mother of one child. Her husband is a construction worker. Rubith sells shoes with her mother from her home. She has been a member of the “Corazón de Jesús” communal bank for the past 2 years. Her first 300 sol loan was used to buy shoes to sell. Now, she requires a 1,200 sol loan to invest in shoes which she brings from Lima. Rubith's goal is to have a sewing workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes at wholesale.

loans.name: Akram

texts.en:
K. Akram is a good father, hard working, and steadfast in his endeavors as a farmer and in raising animals. Thanks to his wife’s assistance (pictured), he is able to care and feed the animals for sale later at both fairs and marketplaces in nearby towns. Traveling to nearby towns increases his costs, but that is offset by the higher asking price he gets there. For this reason, Akram and his wife take care to feed them properly in order to bring in more profit. Nevertheless, they would now like to increase the number of cattle. In order to buy cattle he needs a loan of $1500 USD and promises to be responsible and prompt in repaying it.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: http://www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Ivania Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Ivania posee un negocio que es una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, ella comenzó su negocio vendiendo tortillas de manera ambulante, gracias a su esfuerzo, logro establecer el negocio que actualmente posee el cual es una pulpería, es madre de tres hijas las cuales están a su cargo, todas ellas asisten al colegio gracias al apoyo incondicional de la mama , la señora está solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para invertirlo en su negocio ya que sus clientes  están demandando diversidad de productos. A pesar de las circunstancias es una persona que quiere salir adelante con su negocio que es el único medio de ingresos que tiene.
texts.en:
Ivania has a business, a mini market, which is located in her house. She started her business selling tortillas as a street vendor. Thanks to her effort, she was able to establish the business she currently has, a mini market. She is raising her three daughters. They go to school thanks to the unconditional support of their mother. She is asking for a new loan to invest in her business. Her customers are requesting a variety of products. In spite of her circumstances, she is a person who wants to get ahead with her business. This is the only income that she has.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is 42 years old. She is married and the mother of four children, all of whom are in school. Through her business, she has supported her elderly child to finish senior high school and he is still to continue his schooling. She lives with her husband who is also a merchant. Doris is a food vendor; she sells kenkey and fish in the community lorry station. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. Doris has many customers since many Ghanaians enjoy kenkey for breakfast, lunch and supper.

Doris has been in business for the last two years so one can see that she persists to provide for her family. She said she enjoys doing this business because it brings her income and she feels she is working to support her family. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials such as bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. Doris takes delivery of stock, especially maize, from the nearby villagers. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials such as maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is thirty-seven years old. She is a married woman who has given birth to five children. All of her children are in school. Grace lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial community. 

Grace sells pastries. She prepares the pastries and supplies them to retailers in her community. Grace buys bags of flour from nearby communities. She has been in business for over twelve years and wants a loan to buy more flour, and other ingredients, in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour

loans.name: Yasamen

texts.en:
Yasamen S. is a 43-year-old hardworking mother of four children. She sells poultry in the small village of Agsu and has 12 years of experience in this field. Having been in this business for quite a long time, Yasamen has lots of customers, mainly restaurants owners who buy turkey and geese from her. She gets up at 5 a.m. and works hard, looking after the poultry, until late at night. This is why she is in high demand among her clientele.
Now she is requesting a loan of 1280 AZN to purchase more poultry in order to increase her profit and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry

loans.name: Baygalmaa

texts.en: Baygalmaa is a teacher and lives with her 17-year-old daughter. She purchased the eco fuel out of curiosity. So far, she likes the new fuel because it starts burning quickly and preserves heat longer than other fuel. She also plans to sell some of her fuel to her neighbors. She said: “The product was released at the right moment. Ulaanbaatar air pollution is getting worse every year.” About XacBank Eco Products Program: Ulaanbaatar is the coldest capital in the world. Winter temperatures can average -20 Celsius. Sixty percent of the city population live in tents called gers, with wooden frames covered by layers of wool felt. On average, households located in the Ger Districts use 5 tons of coal and 1.5 tons of wood per year. Sixty percent of the pollution in the city during the heating season is attributed to coal burned in the Ger Districts. The bottom fifth spend as much as 40% of their monthly winter income on heating fuels. XacBank has worked with MicroEnergy Credits to launch a line of eco-products consisting of energy efficient stoves and ger blankets, which will reduce energy consumption.

loans.use: To buy clean and energy-efficient heating fuel

loans.name: Young Carpenters Group

texts.en:
Mansah Sayo T. is the leader of this group. The 45-year-old Mansah was born in a place called Samaya; he is married to a businesswoman and they have 4 children – 1 in secondary school and 3 in primary school. For 5 years now, Mansah has been a carpenter – he makes beds, chairs, benches, tables and several other sorts of furniture.  With his share of this loan, he will buy working materials – nails, timber, polish, etc. to make pieces of furniture to sell.

(On the right in the photo is Loan Officer Abdul Karim Conteh handing over the loan during disbursement.)

loans.use: Buy working materials – nails, timber, polish, etc. to make pieces of furniture to sell

loans.name: Neivi Esmeralda

texts.es: Neivi Esmeralda M. B. de 23 años de edad, reside en San Martín, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja para una empresa privada y su hija de 2 años y medio. Neivi posee un puesto en el cual comercializa ropa para hombres, mujeres y niños, así mismo comercializa ropa interior femenina, galletas, papel higiénico y obsequios como arreglos con globos y dulces. Todo esto lo hace con el fin de poder incrementar sus ventas, brindándoles mayor variedad a sus clientes, los cuales puedan llegar confiadamente donde ella sabiendo que encontrarán lo que desean. Es por esta razón por la cual Neivi solicita un préstamo a Integral, con el deseo de poder contar con más mercadería de manera que pueda contar con mucha mas variedad de productos de los que cuenta ahora, esto la beneficiara mucho y le permitirá mejorar la estabilidad económica de su hogar.
texts.en:
Neivi Esmeralda M. B., 23, lives in San Martín, San Salvador department, with her husand, who works for a private firm, and their 2-and-a-half-year-old daughter. Neivi has a stall where she sells such things as: men's, women's and children's clothing, women's underwear, cooking, toilet paper, gifts like balloon arrangements and candy. She does all this with the goal in mind to increase her sales offering a greater variety of goods to her customers so that they will come to her sure that they will find what they are looking for. Neivi is seeking funds from Integral to buy more stock items so that she can have a wider variety of goods available than what she has now; this will be of great benefit to her and will allow her to improve her home's economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock inventory.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn C. is a 41-year-old woman living in the town of Sawangan Payao, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental.  She is married and has three school-aged children.  To make a living, Jocelyn owns & operates a business selling a variety of food products in the local community.  Jocelyn has been engaged in this business for over 12 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2002, Jocelyn joined NWTF to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 19,000 PHP from NWTF. Jocelyn is now requesting a new loan of 19,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be her 21st loan from NWTF.  Jocelyn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay tuition fees for her children.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To purchase additional product to sell

loans.name: Esterlita Permale Group

texts.en: Esterlita P. is from the village of Plaridel. She is 59 years old. Esterlita is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Esterlita is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Esterlita runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Esterlita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2008, Esterlita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esterlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC.This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Esterlita is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the third loan taken out by Esterlita from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao.
