It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Analou

texts.en:
Analou D. is from the village of Macapari, Damulog Bukidnon. She is 20 years old. Analou is married and has two children, a toddler and a baby. To make a living, Analou owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for her business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Analou has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 Phillipines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2009, Analou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. 

Analou is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Analou from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Tacko

texts.fr: Tacko D. est une femme de 32 ans, elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle est membre de Banc villageois depuis le 06 octobre 2008 et a 3 fois de suite reçu de crédit. Elle est vendeuse de téléphones portables et son prêt lui permettra de d'acheter plus d'articles, d'étendre son marché et augmenter sa clientèle. A côté de cette activité elle vend aussi des vêtements pour hommes et dames. Elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge des enfants et des autres besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Tacko D. is 32 years old, married and the mother of two children. She has been a member of the local “Banc Villageois” loan group since 6 October 2008 and has been granted three successive loans. She sells mobile phones and her loan will enable her to buy more products, extend her business and increase her customer base. As a side business, she also sells men’s and women’s clothing. She assists her husband in taking care of the children and other family needs.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her small business selling mobile phones

loans.name: Carlitos

texts.en:
Carlitos F. was born in Zambezia province 36 years ago. He attended secondary school till the 12th grade and started university. The last part of his studies was undertaken after he joined the military. He lives with his partner (she is the one in the photo) and has five children with her, aged 16, 15, 12, 7 and 3. They all go to school and need support. He also has one younger brother under his responsibility.

Carlitos moved from his original Zambezia province to the Maputo area for work reasons – he got sent to teach in a military school in Catembe, right across the Maputo bay. He has done this job for the last two years.

Carlitos is asking for a loan to buy cement to upgrade the house where he lives with his family, to make it more habitable. He hopes that he can provide his family with a suitable home with the help of Kiva lenders. He came to request the loan in person but he was at work when we had the chance to visit his construction to take the picture, so his life partner is posing in the photo.

loans.use: To buy cement to upgrade his house

loans.name: Ngoen

texts.en:
Mrs. S. is a young woman whose husband appears in the photo here. S. is a mother who takes care of a baby who is not yet enrolled in school. Her husband is a firewood seller who obtains his firewood from the forest.

S. raises poultry out of her home to earn a living. She doesn’t have a stall for her poultry and she proposes to build one; thus, S. would like to ask a loan in order to construct a stall for her poultry.

loans.use: To construct a stall for her poultry

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 34-year-old taxi driver. He transports local passengers (teachers, tailors, night guards, etc.) from his town to their destinations. He has been in this business for just two months and his biggest business challenge is security since people can pose as clients and turn out to be thieves.

He is married and has three children, two boys and a girl who range from 9 months to 9 years old.  In addition to his taxi business, Samuel and his wife generate income by selling repair parts for bicycles.  Before having his car, he had a motorcycle taxi business.

Samuel plans to use the 70,000 Kenya Shilling loan to purchase car parts to upgrade his new taxi. He has successfully repaid two previous loans of 20,000 and 50,000 Shillings.

In the future, he hopes to have a successful car business and own a large fleet of vehicles so that he can take care of his family and educate all his children.  In five years, he dreams of having a car-rental business with his own fleet of cars.  He is also considering opening a poultry-selling business.

Samuel describes himself as very hardworking and innovative.

loans.use: To purchase car parts to upgrade his taxi

loans.name: Yeredon (Se Respecter) Group

texts.fr:
Yeredon est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Koulikoro de Koutiala qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans, sont mariées et mères d’au moins 3 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers, les habillements,  l’huile  et certaine d’entre elle fait la couture. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a 2 ans. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents  ont été bien remboursés. 
Sanata Famanta, qui est un membre du groupe fait de la couture homme et femme.  Elle est très appréciée et sollicitée  par ses clients.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, du fil pour la couture et  la broderie, des aiguilles et toutes sortes et bien d’autres matériels pour son activité. 
Elle se procure du matériel au marché de Madina coura. Elle à sont atelier  de couture bien équipé à la maison où elle habite et a une clientèle diverse et variée. 
Tandis que Les autres membres du groupe comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 180 000FCFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Sanata Famanta compte réaliser 200 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille les charges d’électricité lier à son activité. 
Elle ambitionne renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour pouvoir acquérir d’autres machines.
texts.en:
Yeredon is a women’s group in the Koulikoro quarter of Koutiala. The women live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives. They are 35 years old on average and are married with at least 3 children. This group of women is involved in the sale of various products, such as clothes and oil, and some of them make clothes. In order to expand their business, the group’s members decided to partner with Soro Yiriwaso two years ago and are now on their fifth loan, having successfully repaid all previous ones. Sanata Famanta, who is a member of the group, makes clothes for men and women. She is highly appreciated and sought-after by her customers. She aims to use her loan in order to purchase sewing and embroidery thread, needs and other materials necessary for her work. She has her own well-equipped dressmaking studio at her home, she purchases her goods from the Madina market and sells her wares to a varied customer base. Whereas the other members of the group each aim to generate an average monthly profit of 180 00 FCFA, Sanata Famanta envisages generating 200 000 FCFA. As well as repaying the loan, the women will use some of their revenue to see to their families’ needs and the electricity costs associated with her business. She would like to strengthen her relationship with Soro Yiriwaso in order to purchase more sewing machines.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sewing materials

loans.name: Akwata Empola Gambwa Womens Group 1- Mityana

texts.en: "Always try to derive by all means necessary good bargains out of even unfortunate business circumstances." That is the precept and philosophy that 30-year-old Harriet N. has applied in her retail business operations over the last five years in Gambwa-Mityana. This affable, evergreen and happy-go-lucky married mother of four buoyant school-going children has improved her profits with this modus operandi. She seized the opportunity to get established in this general store business after much persuasion from her husband. With an open mind, she started off even though she had no prior business experience. In a month, her profits add up to 200,000 Ugandan shillings. Harriet also ekes out side income from agricultural and rental businesses. With the assistance of this loan, she is looking at buying a plot of land.

loans.use: The purchase of a plot of land

loans.name: Hay Dee

texts.en:
Hay Dee P. is from the village of Calamagui 1st, Ilagan. She is 36 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Hay Dee owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Hay Dee has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2007, Hay Dee joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hay Dee has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Hay Dee is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Hay Dee from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sreyroth

texts.en:
Miss Sreyroth C. (shown in the photo) is 33 and single. She lives with her parents, brother and sisters on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sreyroth has been a weaver for a year. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market. Sreyroth has two looms to use and she wants to buy one more loom and additional weaving materials for her business so she is asking for a loan of 1,100 USD to make the purchases.

loans.use: To buy a loom and  weaving materials

loans.name: Grimaneza

texts.es:
Grimaneza tiene 50 años de edad y vive en el caserío Guaraguaos Alto del distrito de Tambogrande junto a sus tres hijos, actualmente se encuentra separada de su conyugue. La zona en donde vive es una zona agrícola que produce principalmente mango, limón y maracuyá. Pertenece a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra ubicada en la región del mismo nombre, a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y prendas de vestir en una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio. El negocio le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia durante todo este tiempo. Diariamente se esfuerza por sacarlo adelante brindando un buen trato y productos de calidad a sus clientes. Gracias a ello se ha vuelto conocida en el rubro y su establecimiento siempre cuenta con clientela fija.

Grimaneza desea ampliar su bodega con la compra de mas productos de primera necesidad de modo que pueda ampliar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias que le permitan sacar adelante a su familia. Por este motivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer luchadora y que da todo de si para sacar adelante a sus hijos, las personas que le conocen en la zona donde vive le consideran una mujer tranquila y confiable.
texts.en:
Grimaneza is 50 and lives in the hamlet of Guaraguaos Alto in the Tambogrande district with her three children. She is currently separated from her spouse. The zone where she lives is an agricultural zone that mainly produces mango, lemon and passion fruit. It belongs to the Piura province and is located in the region of the same name, more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. Grimaneza sells basic staples and clothing items in a small store in her home. The business has allowed her to get her family ahead during this time. She makes an effort every day to make the store succeed, offering good service and quality products to her customers. Thanks to this, she has become known in the area and her establishment always has loyal customers. Grimaneza wants to expand her store with the purchase of more basic staples in order to increase her sales and make more income, which will allow her to get her family ahead. For this reason she has decided to request her first loan, 1000 soles, with Edyme Alternativa. She is a hard-working woman who gives all of herself to get her children ahead. Those who know her in the area where she lives consider her to be a calm and reliable woman.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of basic staples and groceries to expand the store in her home

loans.name: Marizol

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MACHUPICCHU”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marizol;  La socia tiene  34 años de edad;  ella es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo,  La socia es natural de la provincia de Apurimac, la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa, ella distribuye a diferentes lugares, trae de la ciudad de Lima al por mayor. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería y repartir  a sus clientes. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de ropa para la venta.

 La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Marizol is a member of the “MACHUPICCHU" community bank.  This bank is located in the Huanchac district in Cusco province in the department of Cusco.

Marizol is 34 years old.  She is a single mother and has one son.  She is from Apurimac province.  She buys and sells clothes, which she brings mostly from Lima and which she distributes in different areas.  She will use this loan to buy clothing to sell to her clients.

She is grateful for this way of getting a loan, and she promises to comply with her payment schedule within the time specified.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a 36-year-old single mother with four children. She runs a retail shop and lives in a permanent house in the district of Kyenjojo, Uganda. She dreams of constructing a personal permanent house for her family and transforming her retail shop into a wholesale shop. She wants a loan to purchase beer and soda to sell in her shop.

loans.use: To purchase beer and soda to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This borrower is 43 years old, married and a mother of three children. The borrower graduated from preparatory school. She will use this loan to purchase an industrial sewing machine and cloth. The borrower has a high reputation in the market. The borrower is capable of raising her family’s income due to the domestic sewing. She has lots of clients due to her experience, good quality, and the reasonable price she charges.

loans.use: For purchasing a sewing-machine & cloth

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 32 years old, married and the father of one child. He operates a boda boda (transport) business in Mathanja, Kiambu district. James has been in business for the last four years and is relatively busy in terms of business and has a large clientele as well, which is good for any business.

He got to know about KADET through a friend who was already a member. This is his first loan with KADET and with no previous credit history. With this loan James hopes to buy another motorcycle and employ someone else to boost his profits.

He desires to give his family a good life and provide a good education for his child.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Uong

texts.en: Mrs. Uong T. is a 31-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Tom Province. Uong T. is married to Kat Krouen, aged 33. This couple, who work together in the farming business, has only one child, who lives at home. In the past, Mrs. Uong T. has always hired the neighbor’s cow in order to make the chore of plowing the farmland easier. Now she hopes to buy her own cow and that is why she is applying for a loan from Kiva. This will provide her with an additional fixed asset.

loans.use: To buy her own cow.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Doña Maribel tiene 48 años de edad, localizado en casa de habitación zona # 2 de Nueva Guinea, es Comerciante desde hace 4 años, se dedica a la venta de ropa americana y nacional, tanto en su casa como a Domicilio, donde entrega a su clientela el producto a sus casas; no solo en la Ciudad, sino tambien en las comunidades aledañas de Nueva Guinea y asi de esta manera hacer mas efectiva sus ventas y conocer las carateristicas de sus clientes.  

Solicita su crédito, para  efectuar compra de mercaderia de productos y aumentar su inventario en su Pequeño Negocio de esta forma mejorar la atención de los clientes que demandan más diversificación de productos.  

Su mayor sueño es establecer una Tienda en la Ciudad y brindar mejor atencion a su clientela, a la vez desea tener salud siempre y que Diocito no la desampare.
texts.en:
Maribel is 48 years old and lives in zona # 2 (district 2) in Nueva Guinea.  She has been a saleswoman for 4 years.  She sells American and national clothes both from her home and at other people's homes where she delivers her products to her customers.  She does this both in the city and also in neighboring communities.  In this way, she makes her sales more effective and gets to know her customers.

Maribel is requesting a loan to buy merchandise and increase the inventory of her small business.  This will enable her to improve her service to her customers who are requesting a wider range of products.

Maribel's greatest dream is to set up a store in the city and provide her customers with a better service.  She would also like to enjoy good health and hopes that God never forsakes her.

loans.use: To buy American and national clothes to sell

loans.name: Jose Uriel

texts.es:
MICROEMPRESARIO: José Uriel T. V.
 
Hace 5 años José Uriel T. V. tuvo un infortunado accidente; al caer involuntariamente de un segundo piso quedó discapacitado, lo cual trajo consigo su imposibilidad para trabajar, puesto que se desempeñaba como oficial de construcción, labor que requería de todas sus facultades.
 
A raíz de esta difícil situación, su vida desmejoró mucho. Fue entonces cuando en su afán de salir adelante y generar sus propios ingresos, decidió empezar a hacer faroles y adornos navideños con materiales reciclables. 
 
Gracias a su empuje y enormes deseos de salir adelante, su negocio  ha crecido de manera considerable, teniendo la fortuna de conseguir nuevos clientes; es por ello precisamente, que requiere de un crédito para comprar insumos que le permitan tener mayor capacidad de producción y así mejorar cada día su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Small Businessman: José Uriel T. V.

José Uriel T. V. had an unfortunate accident five years ago.  An accidental fall from the second floor left him disabled.  He could not work any longer because he used to work in construction, and that required all of his faculties.   

Due to this difficult situation, his life got much worse.  That was when, in his desire to get ahead and generate his own income, he decided to start making lanterns and Christmas ornaments with recyclable materials.

Thanks to his drive and his enormous desire to get ahead, his business has grown considerably.  He has the good fortune of getting new customers.  That is precisely why he needs a loan to buy supplies.  The supplies will allow him to have a greater production capacity.  That will make his quality of life improve each day.

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia P. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 60 years old. Lydia is married. To make a living, Lydia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Lydia hopes to increase her next harvest.

Lydia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and seeds. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida T. is a single parent who works hard in order to provide the best for her son. She is 61 years old and is from Maybato North, San Jose, Antique, Philippines. She is living with her son Samson, who is 31 years old and a fisherman. Being a single mom, sometimes she encounters difficulty in coping with their family needs and especially if there are some unexpected problems. Despite some challenges, she never gives up and instead she considers the problems as an inspiration.

She has been an active member of the branch from 1998 to the present. Being a member, she maintained her good performance because she wanted to prove that she is trustworthy. Because of her good performance, she has been able to access some incentive loans of ASHI like the House Repair Loan and the Market Day Loan.

Currently, she had already fully paid her previous loan and she is now borrowing PHP 35,000. This amount will be used to purchase a unit of a pump boat (Fishing Boat) which they will use for fishing. If this amount is granted, it will be a great help for them to sustain their basic needs.

Her greatest dream in life is to have a comfortable house and to have a small variety store in their community so that they will have another source of income with which she will have a little savings for their future needs.

loans.use: Fishing Boat

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe tiene 45 años de edad y tiene ocho hijos, Ella nació en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. Actualmente Guadalupe vive  en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, Perú. 

Su principal actividad de Guadalupe es la elaboración y venta de panes “Chuta”, ella como la mayoría de pobladores que se dedican a este negocio tienen que alquilar un horno por horas para preparar sus productos. En esta oportunidad Guadalupe requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo harina, levadura y muchas cosas más. 


Guadalupe pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Guadalupe, 45, has 8 children.  She was born in the city of Ollantaytambo, Urubamba province, Cusco department.  Guadalupe currently lives in the city of Oropesa, Cusco province, Peru.

Guadalupe’s main activity is baking “Chuta” bread.  She, like most of the area residents who are in this business, has to lease an oven for hours to make their products.  On this occasion, Guadalupe needs a loan to buy ingredients like flour, yeast and many other things.

Guadalupe is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” communal bank and is grateful for the opportunity provided through this means.  In addition, she commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy ingredients like flour, yeast and many other things.

loans.name: Mary Jane's Group

texts.en:
Mary Jane M. is from the village of Holy Friday. She is 25 years old and the group leader of an eleven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Mary Jane M.'s Group.

Mary Jane is married and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. She raises pigs for fattening and sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $46 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Mary Jane joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to save the additional revenue generated from the business to pay future tuition fees for her child. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is a young mother of four children. She is 21 years old and married to a farmer. Her oldest child is only 6 years old. At her young age, Mildred has to learn to earn a living. She and her husband invested in farming and primarily plant rice crops. Mildred mostly helps in selling their harvest to the market.

Mildred requested a loan of 6000 PHP which she will use to purchase seeds and fertilizers. She hopes for their harvest to improve. She also wishes for her family to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Elyjane

texts.en:
Elyjane C., from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon, is 43 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Elyjane owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling canned goods, snack foods, breads, biscuits, shampoo, soap and candies in the local community. Engaged in her business for over two years, she earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Elyjane joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her first loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional canned goods and junk foods, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods and snack foods

loans.name: Augustine C.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you teachers of the WCSL primary School, Binkolo village, near Makeni. WCSL Primary School was founded in September 1919 by the Weslyan Church of Sierra Leone Mission (WCSL) to give formal education to the children of Binkolo and its surrounding villages. Today, the school is staffed with 11 teachers and has 409 pupils. 

This is the second loan that this school has applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. Augustine C. K. is the leader of this group of teachers. The 53-year-old Augustine was born in Binkolo village and has been in the teaching profession for 30 years now. He is married and has three children. Augustine has requested this loan in order to pay his children’s school/college fees.

loans.use: To pay his children’s school/college fees.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 42 years old and married with 4 children.

Merlinda works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a business that buys and sells bananas in the Philippines and requested a 26,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy different varieties of bananas to sell.

Merlinda has borrowed and paid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running this business for 8 years and also earns an income from being an Avon dealer.

Merlinda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy different varieties of banana to sell

loans.name: Kalo Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe KALO sont des femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 35 ans, 5 enfants et vivant avec leurs époux et enfants  dans des familles nucléaires dans le quartier Torakabougou de la ville de BOUGOUNI (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont rencontrées à travers  des relations de commerce  et de voisinage. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire leurs clientèles et augmenter la taille de leur entreprise, elles ont décidé d’adhérer au programme de crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. 
Elles achètent avec les  prêts des tissus, Céréales et des Condiments alimentaires
Avec ce nouveau prêt Odile D. compte acheter 2 sacs de 25 kg de sel avec les grossistes du grand marché de BOUGOUNI, 1 sac de piment, et  2 paniers de tomate avec les jardiniers de la place pour en suite revendre au petit marché de Torakabougou (l’un des quartier de ville de Bougouni) en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes.
Avec ce prêt elles compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000 FCFA  dont une partie sera réinvesti dans l’entreprise et l’autre partie sera utilisée pour des frais de santé.
texts.en: The members of the group Kalo are married women who are on average 35 years old, have 5 children and live with their spouses and children in nuclear families in the Torakabougou neighborhood of the city of Bougouni (the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  They met one another through commercial and neighborhood relationships.  With the intention of satisfying their customer base and growing the size of their business, they have decided to join the credit program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso.  With these loans, they will buy cloths, cereals and spices.  With this new loan, Odile D. expects to purchase two 25 kg bags of salt from the wholesalers at the big market in Bougouni, one bag of pepper, and two baskets of tomatoes from the same place to later resell them at the small market of Torakabougou (one of the neighborhoods of the city of Bougouni) at retail, for cash and for credit to a customer base made up of women.  With this loan, they expect to make a monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA, of which a part will be reinvested in the company and the rest used to pay for healthcare costs.

loans.use: to purchase spices

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge tiene 21 años de edad, es un joven soltero y trabajador. Vive en su propia casa, ubicada en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, específicamente en la localidad de Santa Rosa. Jorge se caracteriza por ser creativo y trabajador, a pesar de tener secundaria completa, no se amilana para poder estudiar la carrera de ingeniería de sistemas, con el propósito de superarse y ser especialista en programación y circuitos lógicos, pero es consciente que debe ir paso a paso. Hoy se esta dedicando a la heladería, negocio que tienen sus padres, en donde está laborando de manera constante, logrando percibir un salario justo, pues su fin es ahorar y continuar con sus estudios. En un futuro próximo anhela cumplir su objetivo de continuar y lograr ser un Ingeniero de Sistemas, pero para ello necesita de su apoyo económico. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el cual asegura cumplir de manera puntual con sus respectivos pagos, además está conforme con su banco comunal. El crédito solicitado le servirá como capital para sus padres ya que con ello comprarán barquillos y palos de helado.
texts.en:
Jorge is 21 years old.  He is single and a hard-working young man who lives in his own home, in the beautiful Ayacuchan jungle, in the town of Santa Rosa.  Jorge is noted as being a creative and hard-working man.  He completed high school and is keen to study a degree in systems engineering in order to improve himself and become an expert in programming and logic circuits.  However, he is aware that he must take things one step at a time.

Right now, Jorge is working in an ice cream parlor - a business that his parents own.  He is working there permanently and making a fair wage.  His goal is to save up and continue with his studies.  In the not-so-distant future, he plans to achieve his goal of continuing his education and becoming a systems engineer.  However, in order to achieve this he needs your financial support.

This is Jorge's second loan from MFP and he pledges that he will make his repayments on time.  He is happy to be part of his community bank.  He will use the loan he has requested as capital for his parents since he will use it to buy ice-cream cones and ice-lolly sticks.

loans.use: to buy ice-cream cones and ice-lolly sticks

loans.name: Reina De La Paz (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Reina de la Paz está formado por 11 mujeres quienes viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es patrimonio cultural de la humanidad nombrada así en diciembre de 1999,  cuenta con varios lugares naturales para visitar, tiene una amplia gastronomía, su gente es calida y amable. Nuestras socias son mujeres luchadoras que trabajan día a día en diferentes actividades  que les permiten  mejorar la economía de sus hogares.

La Señora. Elvia vive por la comunidad de Zhidmad, este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su hermana y su sobrina.
 
Tiene 32 años, es madre soletera de 3 hijos de 15, 10 años de edad y un bebé de 9 meses, su primer hijo trabaja y ayuda  economícamente y su segundo hijo estudia en una escuelita de la comunidad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña Elvira fabrica cielos rasos, trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, se dedica a esta actividad  hace 10 años. En su casa se dedica a la cría de pollos y cerdos  que los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica y también son para su consumo.

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir para iniciar un negocio de venta de comida rápida (Salchi papas), va a comprar salchichas, papas, aceite, salsa de tomate, mayonesa, fundas plásticas, etc.
 
Su meta es construir su casa ya que tiene algunos materiales de construcción.
texts.en:
The Reina de la Paz Communal Bank is comprised of 11 women who live in various areas of the city of Cuenca This city was named Cultural Heritage of Humanity in December, 1999 and has several natural sites to visit.  The city also has a widely varied gastronomy and its people are warm and friendly.  Our members are struggling women who work day to day in various activities that enable them to improve their household finances.

Elvia lives in the community of Zhidmad.  This is her first loan with the communal bank, which she joined at the invitation of her sister and niece.  She is 32 years old and is a single mother with 3 children – a 15 year old, a 10 year old, and a 9 month old baby.   Her first son works and helps financially.  Her second son is a student at the neighborhood school.  She does not own a home, so she rents.  

Elvira makes ceilings.  She works from 8:00 in the morning until 5:00 in the evening and has worked in this business for 10 years.  She raises chickens and pigs in her home. She  sells when financially necessary and they are also for consumption.

She will use the loan to start a fast food business selling Salchi papas (thinly sliced pan-fried beef hot dogs or sausage and French fries). She will buy sausages, potatoes, oil, ketchup, mayonnaise, plastic covers, etc.

Her goal is to build a house since she has some construction materials.

loans.use: to buy sausages, potatoes, ketchup, mayonnaise, plastic covers, etc.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom are currently in school. Margret has a small retail shop business, which sells essential commodities such as sugar and soap. She has run this business for three years. She also has a second business selling charcoal  
To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase sugar, soap, rice and cooking oil for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Margret hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself – for example, buying new clothes and shoes. In the future, she hopes to own a salon.  
Margret is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her skills in how to save money.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, soap, rice and cooking oil for resale.
